story:
What if there was a space where your real concerns could be addressed?

Politicians prefer to ignore everything that can harm their ratings. Bureaucrats are not able to have conversation beyond procedures. We are stuck: before trying to find the answers, we first need to create the space where thinking about social and political urgencies is possible without fear and manipulation.

We set to create Bureau of Public Insecurities - an exhibition that acts as an office for inquiries about doubts concerning present and future. The invited Brazilian and international artists have designed the works that address the issues that really worry citizens in the context of deepening political and social crisis. Failed intercultural dialogue, dysfunctional democracies, fake and dangerous ‘alternatives’ - this is just the beginning of the list of issues that our Bureau will be dealing with.

We Want Your Help to Make it Happen!

The Bureau of Public Insecurities was initiated from a thin air of uncertainty, as an idea of young, and energetic curators Caroline Carrion (Brazil) and Denis Maksimov (Russia). Without a fund to back us, we did not know if we could even find artists or spaces willing to participate.

But the topic lit up the hearts and minds of many: we had enjoyed tremendous support from a number great and passionate people. We have secured four independently run art spaces in São Paulo to host the exhibition. In these locations nearly 20 Brazilian and international artists will work on the projects that reveal neglected by politics otherness, worries and real questions of the people. The exhibition will present the survey of the issues that will never make it to the headlines of the mainstream news or be discussed in the public space. We have a good possibility for personal therapy, but what about public one?

We are going for flexible funding scheme since we have decided the Bureau will happen in one form or another. But we want your help to make the impact bigger and shake the public! We are aiming to make a big splash in Brazil and beyond in order to attract attention to the reality of vulnerability, precariousness and fearfulness in modern life.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise a modest sum for such an ambitious project of $11 000 to cover essential costs such as:

  • Setting up the exhibitions (transportation of the works, preparation of the exhibition spaces, printing of the information materials, etc.)Running exhibition spaces during the opening period (welcoming personnel, security, etc.)

  • Publication of the catalogue (which is designed by Brazilian artist Bruno Moreschi in collaboration with the curators)

  • Advertisement and promotional materials (remember we aim to make a splash!)

  • Organisation of side events, such as talks, round tables and actions on the street to make bigger impact

  • Opening event in Sao space (it is very important to invite a lot of people and make sure they spread the word and concept as wide as possible!)

The Bureau will be open free of charge for anyone in São Paulo and we are not pursuing to make any profit with it. On the contrary: we are willingly spending our time, energy and money to make it happen at least at the minimal scale - in case we’d be millionaires, believe us we wouldn’t have thought a moment before pouring our hypothetical fortunes in order to make the exhibition noticed!

To make sure you are not going home empty-handed, in exchange for your support we offer a few once-in-a-lifetime rewards. You will receive your reward regardless of the funding status!

Firstly, all our backers will have their names listed in the exhibition catalogue. You will be able to show your friends and maybe even show example to your current or future children that it is actually still possible to be a messina of arts!

Notice that each reward is unique: we will produce a special set of rewards just for the backers who participate in funding this campaign!

More Details of the Exhibition

The participating artists and collectives with their respective countries:

Bogomir Doringer (NL), Foundland Collective (NL), Giuditta Vendrame (IT/NL), Bernd Oppl (AU), Avenir Institute (BE/UK), Bruno Baptistelli (BR), Jaime Lauriano (BR), Sonia Guggisberg (BR), Bruno Moreschi (BR), Carla Chaim (BR), Thiago Navas (BR), Fabio Tremonte (BR), Clarice Cunha (BR), Alessandra Duarte (BR), Lais Myrrha (BR), Deolinda Aguiar (BR), Mano Penalva (BR), Ivan Padovani (BR), danetvozmozhno (BE/BR).

You can find more information about the particular artists by clicking on their names: some of them are participating in Sao Paulo Biennial of Contemporary Art this year, the second oldest Biennial in the world after Venice!

The curatorial duo behind the concept of the exhibition, danetvozmozhno (also known as we: Caroline Carrion & Denis Maksimov) have made a great effort to ensure participation of the most relevant and qualified artists, who represent the spirit of truth and authenticity in artistic production. They don’t produce objects to decorate offices of the banks - they make art that makes people think.

What Could go Wrong?

Since we started working on the project early 2016 a lot has happened and not only in Brazil. The political environment is far from stable, as are the currencies of the world. We have chosen the dollar as the currency for this campaign to make sure we are as safe as possible from fluctuations.

As we mentioned before, the Bureau of Public Insecurities will happen in one way or another regardless of the outcome of the campaign. But with your generous help and support, we will be able to create an opportunity for showing great works of art to the wider public at no cost and without any involvement of formal institutions. Remember what we said in the beginning: institutions prefer to ignore the issues that they are afraid to tackle. Once they abandon them, populists pick them up from the ground and using cheap manipulation and media hysteria create the societies of hate, despair and fear.

We are not naive and don’t pretend that our small exhibition, even in the context of one of the most important contemporary art biennials in the world, will standalone change the world and the people in it. But we believe that if we prove this September that a group of like-minded, passionate, smart and energetic people can raise the support of the public for fighting back against bigotry, short-sightedness and closeness in politics - we will make a truly seminal step towards providing hope for the future of our society self-organisation, even if the moment of collapse is surely to come.

Every dollar donated will help to create the self-organised Bureau that make you and us proud!

Other Ways You Can Help

At this point we are trying to raise funds to cover costs that cannot be avoided, but there are also other ways to contribute :

  • Share the campaign on your social media with a catchy message
  • Give your feedback on the concept and the campaign
  • Visit us in São Paulo in September!

Thank you for reading, and hope to see you in Brazil!

Caroline Carrion & Denis Maksimov

story:
THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

The official fundraiser has ended but you can still make a donation to this project directly through Paypal.

DONATE NOW >> https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=WF6DH8XX5HAXQ

 

Nativity 3.0

Rounding out a three-year effort by Xhurch to explore, scramble, dilute, and REDEFINE the staid tradition of the Christmas nativity scene, this year's installment promises to shepherd visitors into an uncanny digital beyond...

Planned in conjunction with Seattle's reputed Hair and Space Museum, Nativity 3.0 promises to "top out" in both conceptual scope and visual splendor. In 2010, Xhurch staged a quaint and traditional Christmas Nativity which drew friends and a few neighbors. Last year, Alien Nativity attracted hundreds of visitors and garnered international media attention with its kitsch extra-terrestrial motif. This year's installation will abstract even further away from the original, presenting a visual feast while riffing on topics like Infinity, The Coming Technological Singularity, Immortality (through technology), modern Spiritualism and THE END OF THE WORLD AS WE KNOW IT!

 

Xhurch Nativity History

Following the transformation of a former NE Portland church in 2010 into the arts venue known as Xhurch, a first nativity was staged that December—a “traditional,” LIVE nativity, featuring human stand-ins, papier mache animals, hot cocoa, classic Christmas music, and a porcelain Jesus...

 

In 2011, Alien Nativity traded out 3 wise men for 4 alien magi, a shaman Santa Claus, and a mysterious mirror manger. The exhibit was a great success, with international press coverage, hundreds of visitors, and some surprisingly touching responses.

 

Now, in a continued effort to provide an exciting experience for visitors while challenging holiday convention (and our own ingenuity), Nativity 3.0 is set to dazzle audiences again in 2012.     

 

Your contribution

Whereas last year’s Alien Nativity was funded in part by generous donations, and on a shoestring budget, this year’s will require a greater investment in technology and hi-tech mediums, some of which are proprietary and therefore costly. Additionally, the construction demands of Nativity 3.0 will require more raw materials and more time spent building. Lights will again be a key feature and are costly as well.  In order to make this year’s installation possible, we will absolutely need the help of generous and passionate contributors. This project is part of a trajectory that is three years in the making, and one predicated on the hard work and dedication of a growing pool of talented artists and individuals working for the love of their craft in order to provide a community experience that runs for a week and remains FREE-OF-CHARGE.  Please help support the Xhurch in its most ambitious effort to date and join in the fun (and surprise) of another amazing nativity creation.

 

Other ways to help

Unable to make a monetary donation? Nativity 3.0 could still use your help in the form of material and time donations. Please refer to our project website to see a current list of needed supplies, and don’t hesitate to get in touch with any other ideas for contributing. We also love the simple help afforded us by word of mouth - please pass our fundraising campaign on to your friends, family and coworkers, and promote the Nativity 3.0 exhibition dates as well (December 21-25)!

 

Tax-Deductible Donations

Interested in making a tax-deductable donation? We have an option for this. Xhurch is not a 501(c)(3) but we do have an umbrella sponsor ready to accept checks. Contact info@xhurch.net for more info.

 

About the artists

Xhurch is an interdisciplinary arts venue/community place operated by artist Matt Henderson. Since 2010, it has been a fertile ground for lectures, artist residencies, art installations, movie screenings, experimental spiritual services, and more.

Hair and Space Museum is the Seattle-based artist/musician duo Emily Pothast and David Golightly (co-founders of band Midday Veil), whose site-specific multimedia installations serve as meditations on the generative, cosmic properties of sound.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Video Credits

Nativity 3.0 Help! fundraiser video - Lymay Iwasaki

Alien Nativity video - Travis Brown (((Signal Productions)))

 

===============
story_txt:
THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!
The official fundraiser has ended but you can still make a donation to this project directly through Paypal.DONATE NOW >> https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=WF6DH8XX5HAXQ
 
Nativity 3.0
Rounding out a three-year effort by Xhurch to explore, scramble, dilute, and REDEFINE the staid tradition of the Christmas nativity scene, this year's installment promises to shepherd visitors into an uncanny digital beyond...
Planned in conjunction with Seattle's reputed Hair and Space Museum, Nativity 3.0 promises to "top out" in both conceptual scope and visual splendor. In 2010, Xhurch staged a quaint and traditional Christmas Nativity which drew friends and a few neighbors. Last year, Alien Nativity attracted hundreds of visitors and garnered international media attention with its kitsch extra-terrestrial motif. This year's installation will abstract even further away from the original, presenting a visual feast while riffing on topics like Infinity, The Coming Technological Singularity, Immortality (through technology), modern Spiritualism and THE END OF THE WORLD AS WE KNOW IT!
 
Xhurch Nativity History
Following the transformation of a former NE Portland church in 2010 into the arts venue known as Xhurch, a first nativity was staged that December—a “traditional,” LIVE nativity, featuring human stand-ins, papier mache animals, hot cocoa, classic Christmas music, and a porcelain Jesus...
 
In 2011, Alien Nativity traded out 3 wise men for 4 alien magi, a shaman Santa Claus, and a mysterious mirror manger. The exhibit was a great success, with international press coverage, hundreds of visitors, and some surprisingly touching responses. 
 
Now, in a continued effort to provide an exciting experience for visitors while challenging holiday convention (and our own ingenuity), Nativity 3.0 is set to dazzle audiences again in 2012.     
 
Your contribution
Whereas last year’s Alien Nativity was funded in part by generous donations, and on a shoestring budget, this year’s will require a greater investment in technology and hi-tech mediums, some of which are proprietary and therefore costly. Additionally, the construction demands of Nativity 3.0 will require more raw materials and more time spent building. Lights will again be a key feature and are costly as well.  In order to make this year’s installation possible, we will absolutely need the help of generous and passionate contributors. This project is part of a trajectory that is three years in the making, and one predicated on the hard work and dedication of a growing pool of talented artists and individuals working for the love of their craft in order to provide a community experience that runs for a week and remains FREE-OF-CHARGE.  Please help support the Xhurch in its most ambitious effort to date and join in the fun (and surprise) of another amazing nativity creation. 
 
Other ways to help
Unable to make a monetary donation? Nativity 3.0 could still use your help in the form of material and time donations. Please refer to our project website to see a current list of needed supplies, and don’t hesitate to get in touch with any other ideas for contributing. We also love the simple help afforded us by word of mouth - please pass our fundraising campaign on to your friends, family and coworkers, and promote the Nativity 3.0 exhibition dates as well (December 21-25)!
 
Tax-Deductible Donations
Interested in making a tax-deductable donation? We have an option for this. Xhurch is not a 501(c)(3) but we do have an umbrella sponsor ready to accept checks. Contact info@xhurch.net for more info.
 
About the artists
Xhurch is an interdisciplinary arts venue/community place operated by artist Matt Henderson. Since 2010, it has been a fertile ground for lectures, artist residencies, art installations, movie screenings, experimental spiritual services, and more. 
Hair and Space Museum is the Seattle-based artist/musician duo Emily Pothast and David Golightly (co-founders of band Midday Veil), whose site-specific multimedia installations serve as meditations on the generative, cosmic properties of sound.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Video Credits
Nativity 3.0 Help! fundraiser video - Lymay Iwasaki
Alien Nativity video - Travis Brown (((Signal Productions)))
 
===============

story:
Bring 240 students to the Krasl Art Center to experience the Graphicanos exhibition!

When I was a kid in Berrien County, there was no Krasl Art Center. I was an adult living in Minneapolis before I ever entered an art museum, and it blew my mind! I was thrilled and inspired. 
Even though we now have a wonderful art museum in St. Joseph, Michigan, many kids in Berrien County aren't able to get to the Krasl Art Center -- and this is where you come in!
Your contribution would bring in students from across the county to experience the current exhibit, Graphicanos. This exhibit offers students the opportunity to see a visually intense show. They'll experience how art has been used to create bright, graphic, cultural critiques by artists within the Mexican-American and Latino communities. They will also learn about the serigraph technique (prints made using silkscreening).
$500 could bring as many as 240 students to tour the Krasl, but a contribution in any amount helps us to reach our goal!  Also, all contributions are tax deductible, because the Krasl is a non-profit!
Help me to celebrate my 50th birthday by opening a door to the world of art for local students!

story:
Short Summary
My name is Troy and I’m a community organizer, and supporter of Claude the Dragon.  I am helping the creator of Claude the Dragon, Gabe Zanotto, and Dragon Ass Camp raise funds to get Claude to BRC!  

Claude the Dragon has an amazingly rich history that truly embodies the Burning Man culture and has been inspiring viewers for over 25 years (over 500 shows)!  Claude is a must-see, in “person” to understand the life-energy that he carries  which many attribute to the hundreds of unique parts he is made of.  He is 22ft long, breaths fire - you can even climb into the belly and move his head yourself  (trust us, it's way more fun than that description sounds!).  We can’t possibly share everything about Claude here, so please follow him on Facebook to learn more about his heart-warming past!


What We Need & What You Get

  • Our Goal is to raise $6000 to cover repairs for the truck that transports Claude.  Repairs include windshield replacement, emergency brake repairs, and transmission repair.  
  • We have been quoted at $5000 to cover the repairs.  The truck we are repairing is a tow-truck style vehicle; the transmission work is what makes it expensive.  
  • $200 (4%) will go to Indiegogo for the use of their wonderful platform
  • $800 will cover the campaign cost

  • Perks
  • We will present a special lighting ceremony at the burn in honor of contributors.  The ceremony and performance by special guests (TBA) will begin at 8:30pm, Thursday at Dragon Ass Camp (Please check guide; we intend to setup near 2:30 and D).  
  • If we do not reach our full goal, 100% of what is raised still go towards repairs of the vehicle 


The Impact
Contributions are going towards a much bigger picture beyond just getting Claude to The Burn this year.  It has become increasingly difficult to transport him as our truck has been breaking down over the years and we are now at a point where we simply cannot transport Claude until these repairs are made.  By repairing the truck, we can continue to share the joy of Claude at schools, renaissance fairs, festivals, BRC and more.

Other events that Claude normally attends:

  • Renaissance Festivals
  • Celtic Games
  •  Various parades
  • Mardi Gras in Nevada City 
  • Memorial Parade in S.F.
  • Fourth of July in Biggs
  • Parade of Lights in Willows
  • Labor Day in Live Oak
  • Halloween in Nevada City
  • Bok Kai Parade in Marysville
  • Pioneer Day Parade in Sorbestown
  • Fire Festival in Redding
  • Super Heroes Street Fair in S.F.
  • Burn the River in Sacramento
  • Reno Fire Arts Festival


Risks & Challenges
 Right now, our challenge is time!  We are raising funds within a short window  and  we will have only one week to complete the repairs after the campaign ends.  It will be hard work, but we will honor your support by doing whatever it takes to finish the repairs and get Claude to The Burn and all the many other events.  


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Follow us on Facebook!  We want to share the wonderful stories and life of Claude with you! 
  • Like, Share… tell as many people as you can about Claude!
  • Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

I'm 21 and starting school, with one major setback -- I have no way to get there. College costs are way too high for me to afford an apartment or dorm near the college, so if I stay at home I can afford tuition with minimal student loans.

The solution? I need a car. But with my very unreliable income I cannot see myself being able to afford one soon. That's where you come in -- I need your help to get my life (finally) on track.

What I Need & What You'll Get

All I'm looking for is enough for either a car that runs, or enough for a down payment on one. That's an estimated $4,000 from you, and a bit from my own savings as well.

Thankfully for both of us, I'm also working hard to become an illustrator on the side. What does this have to do with this campaign, you ask? Perks, baby, perks. At each milestone you earn a new piece of original art from yours truly. Mostly car themed, considering the subject of this campaign.

The Impact

This car would literally change my life. With it I could finally start school, and get a job in a better location. With it, the world would open up for me and I can finally move forward. It's not a worldwide impact, but for me it is life changing.

Risks & Challenges

Depending on the amount of people wanting to contribute, I may have to wait until the campaign is over to start on the illustrations that come with the perks. And they may take a while -- I will have work and school -- but they will all get done, or your money back. Guaranteed.

Wanna help in other ways?

Spread the word -- tell friends. Explain that I will draw pictures of cars in top hats for them. Explain that I will even throw in a monocle for them. Every little bit helps.

story:
Hello! I'm Alvin, a Chicago- based artist, originally trained in oil painting, and has made the move to pastels over the last four years. I've documented most of my work on my website, alvinthethird.com. I have recently been accepted into the inaugural group for La Casa de la Artistas, an artist's residency focused on empowering artists to travel and create while supplementing school systems with free education for youth. 

The funds raised from this kickstarter would pay for airfare, residency fee (which covers lodging & some meals), traveling around, and materials. In exchange for your contributions, I have perks ranging from figure sketches, to drawings of thailand, to personal portraits! If you do claim a sketch or painting, either email or comment letting me know which sketch/painting you want! 

Perks!

Some of my longer term goals as an artist is to do more teaching (after having worked as an art TA after graduation ), and to do more work into arts advocacy. 

Over the last few years, traveling has become a integral part of my artistic development, providing me with new energy, experiences, and inspiration. Working in Chiang Mai I would have the chance to be there during Songkran, the Thai water festival celebrating the new year.
Thank you for consideration in helping me with this residency! Share with anyone who might be interested!

story:
Who are us?

Hello, we are David and Nicolas and we are Studio Twin Games. We are two passionate of Fantasy, figurines and games. We are pleased to introduce you Twecoalk, an amazing univers.


Qui sommes-nous?

Bonjour, nous sommes David et Nicolas et nous sommes Studio Twin Games. Nous sommes deux passionnés de Fantasy, de figurines et de jeux. Nous avons le plaisir de vous présenter Twecoalk, un univers riche et surprenant.




Why this Indiegogo ?

Because we need you!

Developing  a range of figurines means substantial costs caused by sculpture, molding, illustration or communication investments. If these costs are easy to cover by large companies, young companies such as Studio Twin Games need the help of passionate people.

We intend to propose an original range with quality sculptures and casts. Your input will help us to fund the beautiful concepts of illustrator, as well as the sculpture of 5 figurines: Pulvun band.

Your support, will show us that Twecoalk has a future, as a world and as a range. The Pulvun band and the Walren are only a start, because  Studio Twin Games is full of ideas and projects, for figurines, boardgames or wargames. Your Support constitutes the first stone of Twecoalk, which I hope will grow with and for its fans. Each of your contributions will be of great help for the building of Twecoalk world!

Help us to give birth to Twecoalk people!

Pourquoi cet Indiegogo ?

Parce que nous avons besoin de vous !

Développer une gamme de figurine entraîne des investissements importants pour le design, la sculpture, le moulage et la communication. Si ces investissements sont faciles pour les grandes entreprises, les jeunes entreprises comme Studio Twin Games ont besoin de l’aide des passionnés.

Nous sommes désireux de proposer une gamme originale avec des sculptures et des moulages de qualité. Votre contribution nous aidera à financer les magnifiques concepts de notre illustratrice, ainsi que la sculpture de 5 figurines : le groupe des Pulvun.

Votre soutien nous indiquera que Twecoalk a un avenir, que ce soit comme univers ou comme gamme. Les Pulvun et le Walren ne sont qu’un début, car Studio Twin Games a plein d’idées et de projets : Figurines, Jeux de plateaux ou Wargames. Votre soutien constitue la première pierre de l’édifice Twecoalk qui nous l’espérons grandira avec et pour ses passionnés. Chacune de vos contributions sera une aide formidable pour la construction de cet univers !

Aidez-nous à faire vivre les peuples de Twecoalk !


What will be developed with this indiegogo ?

The purpose of this indiegogo is to finance and support the sculpture and the design of five Pulvun’s musician as well as many accessories and special figurines.

We will assure finance of the resine cast.

We intend to implement our range in medium-term in the shops near you. A pledge to the shop is also open in this direction.

In addition, we count on you to share with us your opinions, wish, envy on the current project and following of Twecoalk. You are the players in the creation of this world!

Qu’est ce qui sera développé grâce à cet Indiegogo ?

Cet indiegogo a pour but de Financer et de soutenir la sculpture et le design d’un groupe de 5 Pulvun Musicien ainsi que d’autres accessoires et figurines spéciales.

Nous assurerons le financement de la production résine.

Nous avons l’intention d’implanter à moyen terme cette gamme dans les boutiques près de chez vous. Un pledge vous est d’ailleurs ouvert en ce sens.

Par ailleurs, nous comptons sur vous pour nous faire partager vos avis, impressions, envies quant au projet actuel et la suite de Twecoalk. Vous êtes les acteurs de la création de ce monde !

How will take place the campaign ?

The campaign will run on INDIEGOGO and will be relayed on facebook : https://www.facebook.com/studiotwingames.

We invite you to share this campaign to a maximum of people in order to make this indiegogo a success!

Then, once the campaign is launched, and according to its evolution, numerous stretch goals will be announced and, if the objectives are achieved, unlocked. The campaign's goal is to make you access Twecoalk’s figurines at more attractive prices, shipping cost inclued and give you access to unique and surprising exclusivenesses.

Once the funds raised we will initiate or conclude the necessary productions, and you will be contacted to confirm your contact details in order to send you your figurines before the end of october 2014.

Two miniatures, Lagnetha and Kolcrann was launched in advance of the campaign to allow you better visualize of the quality sculpted miniature. They will be finished before the end of the campaign and we will unveil them throughout it progresses.

Comment va se dérouler la campagne ?

La campagne se déroulera sur cette page indiegogo et sera relayé, notamment sur facebook : http://www.facebook.com/studiotwingames.

Nous vous invitons à partager et à faire suivre cette campagne à un maximum de gens, afin de faire de cet indiegogo un succès !

Ensuite, une fois la campagne lancée, et selon son évolution, de nombreux stretch goals seront annoncés et, si les objectifs sont atteints, déverrouillés. La campagne a pour but de vous faire accéder aux figurines Twecoalk à des tarifs intéressants, frais de port inclus et de vous donner accès à des exclusivités uniques et surprenantes.

Une fois les fonds levés nous lancerons ou achèverons les productions nécessaires et vous contacterons afin de valider vos coordonnées afin de vous envoyer vos figurines avant la fin octobre 2014.

Deux figurines, Lagnetha et Kolcrann ont été lancée en avance de cette campagne pour vous permettre de mieux visualiser la qualité des figurines sculptées. Elle seront finis avant la fin de la campagne et nous vous les dévoilerons au fur et à mesure de son avancement.



How can you tell us what you want ?

Once your subscription registered :

If goodies and stretchs goals are reached, your pledge inform us if you have acces to it.

The requested goods will be delivered before the end of October 2014.

And you can change your choice until the announcement of sending orders by contacting us !

In addition, each figurine proposed in the indiegogo ans figurine in unlocked stretch goal can be individually added to your pledges to the cost indicated in the list below.

Comment nous indiquer ce que vous souhaitez ?

Une fois votre pledge enregistré :

Si des goodies et strech goals sont atteints, votre pledge vous indique si vous y avait accès.

La plupart des pledges, seront livré avant la fin octobre 2014.

En cas de modification ou de changements dans vos choix avant les envois de commandes, n’hésitez pas à nous contacter afin que nous les prenions en compte.

Les diverses Figurines et stretch goals débloqués sont achetables individuellement aux prix indiqués en dessous des photos de celles-ci!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Many Thanks for your support.

D'autres façons de nous aider

Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas nous aider :

Demandez aux personne de votre entourage de passer le mot et de faire de la publicité autour de notre projet.

Merci de votre soutien.

Les Pledges


Les Stretch Goals


Options :

Walren 18 euros

Sculpt by David, first figurine for Twecoalk, 42mm Tall.


Meet the Crew

For this project we needed some help. We are not very good for drawing. So we work with Charlene Tabary (CHANE), a great artist for help us to picture Twecoalk and his people.

This is an exemple of other works of Chane :

Pour ce projet, nous avions besoin d'aide. Nous ne sommes pas très bons pour le dessin. Nous travaillons donc avec Charlène Tabary (CHANE), une artiste géniale pour nous aider à vous représenter Twecoalk et son peuple.
Ceci est un exemple d'autres travaux de Chane:

Chane

David sculpt a little, but we want to bring new blood and enrich Twecoalk with "touch" of several artists. For carving Pulvun we work with Olivier Bouchet (Buba).
Here is a selection of some of his sculptures:

David sculpte un peu, mais nous souhaitons apporter du sang neuf et enrichir Twecoalk du « grain » de plusieurs artistes. Pour la sculpture des Pulvun, nous travaillons avec Olivier Bouchet (Buba).

Voici une sélection de quelques-unes de ses sculptures :


Olivier Bouchet


Because we love his work and because it is also a friend who have paint in blood, we are working with Jonathan Gonthier (Khaine974) for the color.
Here is a selection of his paintings, some of which award-winning in Games Day:

Parce que nous adorons son travail et parce que c’est aussi un ami qui a la peinture dans le sang, nous travaillons avec Jonathan Gonthier (Khaine974) pour la mise en couleur.

Voici une sélection de ses peintures, dont certaines primé en Games Day :

Jonathan Gonthier

And because we can’t live without their support, Berengere and Marine, our wifes. Thanks for support us and your help for all!

This is the crew who work for Twecoalk.

Et parce qu’il y a toujours des personnes proches pour nous supporter, merci à Bérengère et Marine, nos femmes. Merci pour votre aide et votre soutien !

Voici toute l’équipe qui travaille pour Twecoalk.

construction de cet univers !

Aidez-nous à faire vivre les peuples de Twecoalk !
What will be developed with this indiegogo ?

The
purpose of this indiegogo is to finance and support the sculpture and the
design of five Pulvun’s musician as well as many accessories and special
figurines.
We
will assure finance of the resine cast.
We
intend to implement our range in medium-term in the shops near you. A pledge to
the shop is also open in this direction.
In
addition, we count on you to share with us your opinions, wish, envy on the
current project and following of Twecoalk. You are the players in the creation
of this world!

Qu’est ce qui sera développé grâce à cet
Indiegogo ?
Cet
indiegogo a pour but de Financer et de soutenir la sculpture et le design d’un
groupe de 5 Pulvun Musicien ainsi que d’autres accessoires et figurines
spéciales. 
Nous
assurerons le financement de la production résine.
Nous avons
l’intention d’implanter à moyen terme cette gamme dans les boutiques près de
chez vous. Un pledge vous est d’ailleurs ouvert en ce sens.
Par
ailleurs, nous comptons sur vous pour nous faire partager vos avis, impressions,
envies quant au projet actuel et la suite de Twecoalk. Vous êtes les acteurs de
la création de ce monde !
How will take place the campaign ?
The
campaign will run on INDIEGOGO and will be relayed on facebook : https://www.facebook.com/studiotwingames.
We
invite you to share this campaign to a maximum of people in order to make this
indiegogo a success!
Then,
once the campaign is launched, and according to its evolution, numerous stretch
goals will be announced and, if the objectives are achieved, unlocked. The
campaign's goal is to make you access Twecoalk’s figurines at more attractive
prices, shipping cost inclued and give you access to unique and surprising
exclusivenesses.
Once
the funds raised we will initiate or conclude the necessary productions, and
you will be contacted to confirm your contact details in order to send you your
figurines before the end of october 2014.
Two miniatures, Lagnetha and Kolcrann was launched in advance of the campaign to allow you
better visualize of the quality sculpted miniature. They will be finished before
the end of the campaign and we will unveil them throughout it progresses.
Comment va se dérouler la campagne ?
La campagne
se déroulera sur cette page indiegogo et sera relayé, notamment sur
facebook : http://www.facebook.com/studiotwingames.
Nous vous
invitons à partager et à faire suivre cette campagne à un maximum de gens, afin
de faire de cet indiegogo un succès !
Ensuite,
une fois la campagne lancée, et selon son évolution, de nombreux stretch goals
seront annoncés et, si les objectifs sont atteints, déverrouillés. La campagne
a pour but de vous faire accéder aux figurines Twecoalk à des tarifs intéressants,
frais de port inclus et de vous donner accès à des exclusivités uniques et
surprenantes.
Une fois
les fonds levés nous lancerons ou achèverons les productions nécessaires et
vous contacterons afin de valider vos coordonnées afin de vous envoyer vos
figurines avant la fin octobre 2014.
Deux figurines,
Lagnetha et Kolcrann ont été lancée en avance de cette campagne pour vous permettre de mieux
visualiser la qualité des figurines sculptées. Elle seront finis avant la fin de
la campagne et nous vous les dévoilerons au fur et à mesure de son avancement.
How can you tell us what you want ?
Once
your subscription registered :
If
goodies and stretchs goals are reached, your pledge inform us if you have acces
to it.
The
requested goods will be delivered before the end of October 2014.
And
you can change your choice until the announcement of sending orders by
contacting us !
In addition, each figurine
proposed in the indiegogo ans figurine in unlocked stretch goal can be
individually added to your pledges to the cost indicated in the list below.
Comment nous indiquer ce que vous
souhaitez ?
Une fois
votre pledge enregistré :
Si des
goodies et strech goals sont atteints, votre pledge vous indique si vous y
avait accès.
La plupart
des pledges, seront livré avant la fin octobre 2014.
En cas de
modification ou de changements dans vos choix avant les envois de commandes,
n’hésitez pas à nous contacter afin que nous les prenions en compte.
Les diverses
Figurines et stretch goals débloqués sont achetables individuellement aux prix
indiqués en dessous des photos de celles-ci!!!
Other Ways You Can
Help
Some people just can’t
contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Ask folks to get the word out and
make some noise about our campaign.
Many Thanks for your support.
D'autres façons de nous aider
Certaines personnes
ne peuvent pas contribuer mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas nous
aider :
Demandez aux personne
de votre entourage de passer le mot et de faire de la publicité autour de notre
projet.
Merci de
votre soutien.
Les PledgesLes Stretch GoalsOptions :Walren 18 eurosSculpt by David, first figurine for Twecoalk, 42mm Tall.Meet the CrewFor
this project we needed some help. We are not very good for drawing. So we work
with Charlene Tabary (CHANE), a great artist for help us to picture Twecoalk
and his people.
This is
an exemple of other works of Chane :Pour ce projet, nous
avions besoin d'aide. Nous ne sommes pas très bons pour le dessin. Nous
travaillons donc avec Charlène Tabary (CHANE), une artiste géniale pour nous
aider à vous représenter Twecoalk et son peuple. 
Ceci est un exemple d'autres travaux de Chane:
Chane
David sculpt
a little, but we want to bring new blood and enrich Twecoalk with "touch"
of several artists. For carving Pulvun we work with Olivier Bouchet (Buba). 
Here is a selection of some of his sculptures:David sculpte un peu,
mais nous souhaitons apporter du sang neuf et enrichir Twecoalk du « grain »
de plusieurs artistes. Pour la sculpture des Pulvun, nous travaillons avec
Olivier Bouchet (Buba).

Voici une sélection
de quelques-unes de ses sculptures :
Olivier Bouchet
Because
we love his work and because it is also a friend who have paint in blood, we
are working with Jonathan Gonthier (Khaine974) for the color. 
Here is a selection of his paintings, some of which award-winning in Games Day:Parce que nous
adorons son travail et parce que c’est aussi un ami qui a la peinture dans le
sang, nous travaillons avec Jonathan Gonthier (Khaine974) pour la mise en
couleur.

Voici une sélection
de ses peintures, dont certaines primé en Games Day :Jonathan GonthierAnd
because we can’t live without their support, Berengere and Marine, our wifes.
Thanks for support us and your help for all!
This
is the crew who work for Twecoalk.Et parce qu’il y a
toujours des personnes proches pour nous supporter, merci à Bérengère et
Marine, nos femmes. Merci pour votre aide et votre soutien !
Voici toute l’équipe
qui travaille pour Twecoalk.

story:
ANIMITA PAPEL es una publicación de artes visuales que circula como obra en si misma y hace circular obra de otros artistas. Es una edición que lleva nueve años de existencia con 16 números a su haber. Ha publicado los "ensayos gráficos" de más de 20 artistas y colectivos de Chile, Argentina, Paraguay, Bolivia, Francia, Suiza, Bélgica y Suecia.

Una de sus principales características es el uso del soporte papel para todos sus ejercicios de edición, publicación y circulación. ANIMITA PAPEL es una organización sin ánimos de lucro con el objetivo de aproximar los proyectos de artistas al público, en la ciudad. Su distribución es gratuita.


En la ultima edicion, ANIMITA PAPEL #16 ha reunido los trabajos de cuatro artistas chilenos que viven fuera de su pais a traves de una mirada desde la distancia sobre los 40 años de la dictadura politica en Chile. La edición se ha distribuído por todo em país juntamente con el periódico 'El Sur', de Concepción.

Se pretende ahora la invitación a un artista español (por primera vez) y un arquitecto portugúes para que desarollen en paralelo una edición a dos caras con el objectivo de distribuirse en un evento público que tendrá lugar en Concepción, Chile, durante el primer trimeste del próximo. La temática todavia no está defenida ya que será una consequência del evento que se anunciará a lo largo del mês de Enero.

Se harán 1000 ejemplares de lo cuales un percentaje se distribuirá tanbién en Portugal y en España.

story:
Beautiful Times

My name is Hyland Mather, I go by X-O as my artist name.  I'm the long time owner of Andenken Gallery.   I'm undertaking a project with my artist friend, Amanda Marie...some of you might know her under her moniker seeyouthroughit or Mando.  

This summer we are headed out on an 'ART' road trip from Colorado to New York, but as we do it, we want to support some causes that we both believe in...so we've dreamed up 'Beautiful Times'.  

Simply put, our children are worth protecting, and so are our wildflowers. Pretty hippy stuff actually. ;)

We've picked a pair of organizations that deserve our efforts and we aim to make contributions to each through your support and our hard work.

The Morgan Adams Foundation (pediatric cancer research)...

The Lady Bird Johnson Wildflower Center (self explanatory)

Morgan Adams does an event that both Amanda and I have contributed artwork to, called ARTMA, it's an art auction aimed to raise money for pediatric cancer research.  We thought with Beautiful Times we could go a step beyond our usual donation and do this murals tour.

The Lady Bird Johnson Wildflower Center...neither of us has ever worked with them before, but the cause is noble and we're both sorta mega into the theme right now. Plus, Mando is a true green thumb.  

That's the bones of the idea.  We want to do a cool tour and we want it to benefit some worthy causes.  We've got good walls and project places lined up in Denver, Boulder, Philadelphia, Beacon, and NYC.  We've got great allies in all those places. The project site is: beautifultimes.net

If you like what we make and you like the idea of helping out some deserving causes, we might be a match for your contributions, plain and simple.  


What is in it for you, What is in it for us?

Well for you...basically we've got some perk tiers, and they range from $20 for a screen printed postcard and a generous thanks to $650 for an original Amanda Marie painting on paper.  

We are trying to raise a total of $35000 USD...this isn't too much money really, but it will help these causes.

Here is how we see it breaking down...We want to do 7 or 8 mural / installation projects on our 3.5 week trip, all along the way we will be documenting the project with video and pics and building awareness for the causes we are supporting.

But being realistic, it's gonna cost a sizable chunk of the pledges towards the total goal just to do the projects...travel, accommodations (though mostly we'll be couch surfing and vanpiring) , food, paint, tools, mural making supplies...it all adds up.  

In the end we hope we can reach our goal to donate $7000 to $12, 000 to each of the charities.  

If we don't reach our total goal, we'll bite the stoopid bullet...for every penny that comes in at least half goes to the charities...

Why Why Why?

We're going to go out and do this project anyway, it's fun stuff, it's Beautiful Times. We are going on a road trip and we're gonna make art.  The point is, we can do this in a way that benefits some other people, some deserving people.  You know, Street Art, Urban Art, Graffiti...it's got a strange vibe in a lot of people's minds...which is fine...totally fine.  But, we want to show what a strong community can do behind a couple of artists that have positive goals with worthy causes in mind. 

I've been working on big good projects for a long time and we always seem to make them work.  We hosted the Manifest Hope show at the Democratic National Convention when Obama was trying to get elected the first time in 2008.  Last year we worked with the Dutch Consulate in New York to bring 20 artists together in Miami for an amazing mural project called Caleidoscoop.  Beautiful Times is just the latest in a chain of positive projects that stretches back more than 15 years.  

Risks & Challenges

I'm a little nervous about bringing our vision outside of our normal realm of our regular 'street art' community.  We're going to be working with urban farmers and gardeners and all kinds of folks we might at first feel a bit estranged to.  Amanda grew up on a farm so she'll get in the swing soon enough, and I've worked in all kinds of places from dishpits to the north slope oil fields, from hockey rinks to ice cream shops...I'm pretty sure I can settle into a groove with almost any kind of person, but it is a bit 'off compass' for us...and that's part of the challenge and fun.  I just hope they like what we make.

The other big challenge is emotional and creative exhaustion.  By the time we get done in New York...one of the cities that we must truly kick ass for...we're either going to be totally wiped out or totally in the groove.  All we can do is hope that it's the latter.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word and point people to this indiegogo campaign.  We have a cool lil project and it's just what it says it is 'Beautiful Times'  .  As we work on this project and we make it succeed,  it then becomes an inspiring example for other artists who want to hit the road and do it in support of their own ideas of something good and beautiful.

story:
DOC NOW 2015

DOC NOW is an annual, free documentary arts festival, taking place in Toronto, ON in May-June 2015, and featuring the photography, film, new media, and interactive art works of the graduating class of Ryerson University’s Documentary Media Master of Fine Arts program.

Why help us?

Funding the DOC NOW 2015 festival provides free documentary programming for Toronto’s communities, supports emerging and innovative media makers, and raises community awareness on the important social issues featured in these documentary projects.

Who are we/What is DOC NOW?

DOC NOW showcases a diverse group of artists living in Canada—with their backgrounds ranging from Trinidad and Tobago, Italy, the United States, Latvia, Nigeria, Japan, Ireland, and Colombia—and working in film, photography and new media. The festival will take place in May and June 2015, and will feature the world premieres of 18 unique documentary projects, including seven gallery installations, 13 events, and 11 films screening on June 3rd and 4th at the Bloor Hot Docs Cinema in Toronto. 

All exhibitions and film screenings are free to the public.

DOC NOW supports Canadian and international emerging artists based in Toronto. The festival is an inclusive space featuring the work of LGBTQ artists, artists with disabilities, artists of colour, and female artists, including the work of 11 women film directors and two female documentary photographers. 

The documentaries in this year’s festival focus on topics such as:

-  Mental health

-  Feminism and women in gaming

-  Immigrant experiences in Canada

-  Post-Soviet Latvia

-  Sexual assault and domestic violence

-  Single parenting

-  Black Queer identity

-  Grief

-  Domestic ethnography

-  Medical marijuana

-  Ageism

-  The cosmetics industry

-  Religion and spirituality in contemporary urban customs and communities

-  Irish folklore

-  Female wilderness pioneers

-  Ocular disabilities and technology

-  Disability in the workplace

-  Photography for at-risk Toronto youth

-  Women in the music industry

DOC NOW is proud to be a part of Toronto’s rich and vibrant documentary community.

What we need your help with! 

DOC NOW is free to the public and run by volunteer, student artists. This is the seventh year of the festival and it depends entirely on our ability to raise funds from the community and donors like you! Contributions go directly to securing venues, producing promotional materials and running the screenings and gallery openings. Your help is crucial in realizing this non-profit arts festival and supporting documentary work in Toronto.

Take a look at our funding incentives. You can also help us by spreading the word, sharing this fundraising page by email and social media, telling everyone about DOC NOW 2015, and attending the festival!

Ryerson’s Documentary Media MFA Program:

Documentary has a rich history in Canada, and the Documentary Media MFA Program at Ryerson is the only graduate program devoted to documentary in the country. It attracts established and emerging artists from all over the world to study with acclaimed filmmakers, photographers, and new media artists, as well as scholars and historians in the field. Critically engaging with the history and contemporary landscape of documentary practice, students are empowered to create innovative work that challenges the boundaries of the documentary form.

If you're interested in becoming a major sponsor of this event or making an in-kind donation, please contact ryerson.docnow@gmail.com

Participating Artists 

Miya Akiyama

Katie Anderson

Kathryn Atkinson

Gesilayefa Azorbo 

Vivian Belik

Siobhan Brannigan

Giulia Ciampini

Michèle Pearson Clarke

Karin Culliton

Chantal Dignard

Briar Gorton

Jon Higgins

Tariq Kieran

Zile Liepins

Anna MacLean

Juan Pablo Pinto Mendoza

Vincenzo Pietropaolo 

Kelly Showker

Thank you to our contributors

Blue Ice Group

Yeates School of Graduate Studies, Ryerson University

Documentary Media Program, Ryerson University

School of Image Arts, Ryerson University

Faculty of Communication, Art and Design (FCAD), Ryerson University

Ryerson Artspace at the Gladstone

Ryerson Image Centre (RIC)

Ryerson Documentary Media Program

Art Gallery of York University

story:
My name is Candace Nyaomi, I am an artist and photographer entering my final year at OCAD University.

For the past five years I’ve been focusing on perfecting my craft. Exploring many different mediums I've dabbled in portraiture, concerts, weddings, sports and product photography. 

This past school year I’ve been taking on new challenges with my photo based work by experimenting with text, image, textiles and fabrics. Although in past exhibits I’ve created social and political photography, I enjoyed the process of transforming my images and texts into patterns so much I wanted to continue with this new approach for the NS Photo Exchange Project.


NS Photo Exchange Project

NS is an online photographic exchange project between Gallery 44 Centre for Contemporary Photography (Toronto, Canada) and PH15 Foundation (Buenos Aires, Argentina) and OCAD University (Toronto, Canada). It was commissioned by the TORONTO 2015 arts and culture festival PANAMANIA, presented by CIBC and is also a proud IGNITE community partner. Six photographers from Toronto have been paired with six photographers from Buenos Aires to create photo-based projects exploring connections between and within different places that are oceans apart. More information can be found on our website at http://nsphotoproject.com. The show will be in Toronto July 17th – August 1st and August 29th – September 9th in Buenos Aires.

Together my partner Luján Augusti & I  collectively realized that our niche was text, image and fabric, making it the simple choice for our final assignment. The only setback we've encountered has been that printing on fabrics can be quite costly.

Looking to supplement costs we are calling on you for your support. We want to be experimental with our project & being hindered by such a short goal will not stifle our creativity.

This is my first international show and I can’t put into words what it would mean for me to be at the show opening in Argentina. Quitting my job to focus on my career as a photographer & full time student has had its lows, but opportunities like this make it worthwhile. 

What I Need

Travel expenses:

Argentina $2000

Print Expenses:

$1000 Allows for us to print different sizes and fabrics, 

$500 budget each would allow for us to have a little more flexibility to use whatever material we desire.

Food and Transportation in Argentina: $300

Contingency Funds & Fees: $600

In the unlikely event we cannot make our goal, the funds would first go into printing the work. 

Any additional funding would go towards covering airfare to Argentina.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk/concern is funding & time. If we are unable to reach the goal we will either look into another way to fund the project or modify accordingly. 

I’ve had my share of risks and challenges planning group shows and exhibitions over the last couple years. From the initial shooting, to printing, to the installation, I’ve learned to always be prepared for unexpected obstacles and remain open minded. I will go into this project with the same mind state. My experiences have taught me not to panic. Instead take a breath, figure out a solution and act on it. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word :)
Thank you for your love and support!

Besos,
Boogs xoxo
story_txt:
My name is Candace Nyaomi, I am an artist and photographer entering my final year at OCAD University.
For the past five years I’ve been focusing on perfecting my craft. Exploring many different mediums I've dabbled in portraiture, concerts, weddings, sports and product photography. 






This past school year I’ve been taking on new challenges with my photo based work by experimenting with text, image, textiles and fabrics. Although in past exhibits I’ve created social and political photography, I enjoyed the process of transforming my images and texts into patterns so much I wanted to continue with this new approach for the NS Photo Exchange Project.



NS Photo Exchange Project
NS is an online photographic exchange project between Gallery 44
Centre for Contemporary Photography (Toronto, Canada) and PH15 Foundation (Buenos
Aires, Argentina) and OCAD University (Toronto, Canada). It
was commissioned by the TORONTO 2015 arts and culture festival PANAMANIA,
presented by CIBC and is also a proud IGNITE community partner. Six
photographers from Toronto have been paired with six photographers from Buenos
Aires to create photo-based projects exploring connections
between and within different places that are oceans apart. More
information can be found on our website at http://nsphotoproject.com. The show
will be in Toronto July 17th – August 1st and August
29th – September 9th in Buenos Aires.


Together my partner Luján Augusti & I  collectively realized that our niche was text, image and fabric, making it the simple choice for our final assignment. The only setback we've encountered has been that printing on fabrics can be quite costly.
Looking to supplement costs we are calling on you for your support. We want to be experimental with our project & being hindered by such a short goal will not stifle our creativity.
This is my first international show and I can’t
put into words what it would mean for me to be at the show opening in Argentina.
Quitting my job to focus on my career as a photographer & full time student
has had its lows, but opportunities like this make it worthwhile. 
  


What I Need


Travel expenses:
Argentina $2000
Print Expenses:
$1000 Allows for us to print different
sizes and fabrics, 
$500 budget each would allow for us to
have a little more flexibility to use whatever material we desire.
Food and Transportation in
Argentina: $300
Contingency Funds & Fees: $600

In the unlikely event we cannot make our goal, the funds would first go into printing the work. 
Any additional funding would go towards covering airfare to Argentina.



Risks & Challenges  

Our biggest risk/concern is funding & time. If we are unable to reach the goal we will either look into another way to fund the project or modify accordingly. 
I’ve had my share of risks and challenges planning group shows and exhibitions over the last couple years. From the initial shooting, to printing, to the installation, I’ve learned to always be prepared for unexpected obstacles and remain open minded. I will go into this project with the same mind state. My experiences have taught me not to panic. Instead take a breath, figure out a solution and act on it. 
   Other Ways You Can Help  Please spread the word :)

Thank you for your love and support!

Besos,
Boogs xoxo

story:
This September, we want to launch a historic Portal between San Francisco and Herat, Afghanistan, Havana, Cuba and Tehran, Iran. 

Join us!

Portals are gold shipping containers with immersive audio-visual equipment inside. When you enter one, you come face-to-face with someone in another container live, full-body, and the two of you converse as if in the same room with real-time translation. As many participants have put it, “you feel as though you’re breathing the same air.” 

Since December 2014, more than 2,500 people have engaged in 20-minute conversations about daily life with distant strangers. They have come out deeply moved -- giddy, weeping, and everything in between. As one participant put it after performing live for his family in Tehran for the first time:

Life has thrown me a gift...wrapped in a gold shipping crate. I have been given the opportunity to laugh, dance and stand face to face for the first time in my life with my family in Tehran, Iran. I felt as though we were breathing the same air....The potential to bridge the gap between unlikely spaces, people and time with this project is remarkable!

In addition, artists collaborated together -- painters, musicians, poets and actors. Special guests like documentary filmmaker Morgan Spurlock gave advice to students in Tehran and talked shop with their peers. Entrepreneurs traded ideas. And sixth graders in the U.S. asked university students in Tehran about what their schooling was like.

Press Coverage

Portals have been covered by dozens of media outlets including the the New York Times, Washington Post, ABC's This Week with George Stephanopoulos, CNN’s Fareed Zakaria GPS, NPR’s Morning Edition with Steve Inskeep, and many more including Foreign Policy, MSNBC, CBC, Al Jazeera, and Telemundo. The full list of press is available at www.SharedStudios.com/Press.

Why?

Fiercely exclusionary group identities are thriving in the 21st century, from religious intolerance to racial and sexuality-based bigotry. If we do not meaningfully engage with people from different walks of life, our capacity for empathy weakens and divisions of class, race, and identity deepen.

And while new technologies allow us to connect across boundaries as never before, we too often use them to insulate ourselves in our own communities. Online behaviors such as Liking, Tweeting, or Posting rarely encourage us to engage directly with individuals far outside our existing group affiliations.

By conversing through a Portal, participants step out of their daily routines and their comfort zones. Away from the distraction of cell phones and their peers, people swiftly connect across distances, real and imagined. They share a quiet moment. In these encounters, people learn about the “other” and challenge their own values, beliefs, and assumptions.

We aim to create a global network of interconnected Portals around the world – from big cities to small towns, rich and poor, urban and remote. We envision these Portals providing room for global conversation and collaboration across all forms of distance. We want Portals to become the world's arts and community center. And we want Silicon Valley to be one of its founding hubs.

What We Need

  • Our tech package to make this happen is $7,500. It includes our customized lens. Our container and its outfitting is another $7,500. Operating the Portal is even more. 
  • We've gotten generous backing already; however, we need these funds and your excitement to help move us closer to reaching our goal. 

You'll get:

  • Priority notification when the Portal opens so you can book your slot right away.
  • A chance to reserve Portal time in off hours for your own event: debates, performances, poetry readings, dance.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love support of any kind.

  • If you have a great spot in the Bay Area where this can go after November!
  • If you can donate an ultra-short-throw projector, please do!
  • If you can help us move the Portal by flatbed, please do!

story:
Parée pas parée j'y vais!

Ça y est! Ma valise est pleine, ma peinture est dans la voiture et Muse me suit partout pour faire sûr que je ne l'oublie pas! Je me sens tellement excitée à l'idée de me concentrer exclusivement sur ma peinture pendant les 3 prochains mois, quelle belle façon d’entreprendre une année n'est-ce pas!?

Pour moi, c'est l'accueil d'un renouveau dans mon œuvre car je me sens plus affranchie que jamais! J'admets qu'une certaine nervosité me gagne aussi... ça fait un bout de temps quand même que je ne me suis pas penchée sur une série de tableaux! Je me sens un peu comme une néophyte et c'est ce qui est le plus admirable et le plus encourageant dans ce projet je trouve :  j'ai confiance de recouvrer une certaine fraîcheur dans mes nouveaux paysages.

* * *

En 2015, après avoir mené de front une carrière artistique et des études soutenues en arts visuels pendant de nombreuse années, j'ai fait le choix d'arrêter la peinture. En réalité, je voulais faire l'expérience de renvoyer dans mon inconscient tout ce que           j'avais appris et absorbé, pour lui demander de revenir, en temps et lieu, dans son plus simple apparat.

Je suis donc partie en arctique, là où seul l'horizon délimite le ciel et la terre.  L'interruption est ainsi devenu un moment crucial de mon processus plastique, où l’exploration du vide est devenu comme un potentiel, quelque chose qui attend patiemment d'être occupé, et par extension, d'être réalisé. C'est cet espace      - particulièrement disponible - qui veut se déployer dans ma peinture aujourd'hui.

La Ville de Coaticook m'offre un atelier-résidence où je pourrai me concentrer sur mon œuvre de janvier à mars.  Le comité de sélection favorisait l'artiste qui démontrait un intérêt marqué pour la communication, qui aime travailler avec le public et qui souhaite s'intégrer à la vie culturelle locale. 

Le paysage sera le sujet de ma recherche. Je m'intéresserai donc au lieu dans lequel je me trouve, mais surtout, aux personnes qui y habitent. Dans le cadre d'une pratique artistique où ma relation à l'autre actionne le propos du tableau, je m'en vais tisser des liens et oeuvrer auprès des personnes âgées de cette région.

Cette campagne de socio-financement devient un véritable atout pour la réussite de ce projet et votre contribution est plus qu'importante pour moi. À vrai dire, bien que le studio soit fourni, aucune allocation de subsistance n'est allouée à l'artiste pendant son séjour. Il va sans dire qu'un minimum de frais sont donc à prévoir!

Votre appui financier me permettra carrément de me nourrir, d'acheter du matériel artistique et surtout, de m'accorder une certaine tranquillité d'esprit, indispensable à une saine créativité.

Votre impact sur mon projet :

Je ne saurais + vous démontrer à quel point votre soutien financier est déterminant ! Votre appui me donne les moyens d'acheter le matériel artistique dont j'ai besoin. Également, vous m'appuyez dans ma volonté de communiquer avec les personnes âgées au moyen de l'art. Enfin, vous offrez un élan à ma créativité. Vous êtes un moteur dans ce projet et je suis consciente du privilège que vous m'octroyer.

!MERCI!

Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtenez :

Pour que mon projet de résidence et ma campagne de socio-financement soient réalistes et transparents, j'ai fait l'exercice d'un budget formel et je vous offre des "perks" généreux pour honorer vos donations. (voir juste ici, en dessous)

C'est quoi des "Perks"?

C'est ma façon de vous redonner quelque chose pour vous remercier de votre appui à mon projet! "Perks" est un mot anglais qui signifie "avantages", ou mieux, ce que vous gagnez en me soutenant : 

​PERK de 50 $

​​Un GROS merci! Tu recevras 4 cartes de voeux avec l'image de 4 oeuvres différentes, réalisées sur place. Je te donnerai de mes nouvelles tout au long de ma résidence en te faisant parvenir 6 info-lettres. De plus, je t'invite à mon studio pendant la relâche.

PERK de 200 $

Pleine gratitude! Tu recevras un petit tableau original crée pendant ma résidence et 4 cartes de vœux. Je t'enverrai les info-lettres et tu es invité à participer aux activités de la semaine de relâche à Coaticook.

PERK de 500$

Je suis si reconnaissante de ce que tu fais pour moi! Je te donnerai une œuvre de grand format réalisée ici pendant les 3 mois de ma résidence. Tu recevras 4 cartes de voeux avec l'image de 4 oeuvres différentes. Je te donnerai de mes nouvelles en t'envoyant 6 info-lettres et je t'invite bien sûr à l'atelier de Coaticook pendant la relâche (horaire à venir).

PERK de 1000$

WOW! Tu es un réel défenseur des arts et tu me permets de développer mon travail comme jamais!  Je te propose de me rencontrer pour évaluer ce que tu veux comme œuvre originale. Nous déciderons des dimensions, des thèmes et même de la palette de couleur souhaitée. En mi-travail tu me donneras tes commentaires et une approbation pour la poursuite du travail. Tu recevras 4 cartes de voeux. Je te donnerai de mes nouvelles par le biais des info-lettres et je t'invite à l'atelier de Coaticook!

Y a-t-il d'autres façons de m'aider ? OUI!

Soutenez-moi en partageant mon projet sur vos réseaux sociaux et en parlant de moi à vos ami.es! Avec Indiegogo c'est très simple de partager ma cause!

MON BUDGET

REVENUS

 

Contribution personnelle (confirmée)

800 $

Demandes de commandites (NON-OBTENUE ☹ )

0 $

Campagne de Socio-financement Indiegogo (en cours)                      OBJECTIF

2935 $

Total des revenus

3735 $

FRAIS DE RÉALISATION

 

Achat : Panneaux de bois montés sur châssis (formats variés)          

700 $

Achat : Peinture, pinceaux et outils

700 $

Achat : Encre pour imprimante et papier

200 $

Achat : Impressions photo

200 $

Frais d'assurances

270 $

Frais de recherche : Abonnement bibliothèque Coaticook

45 $

Frais de recherche : Achat de livres spécialisés

100 $

Frais de transports : Voyage vers la résidence et déplacements

500 $

Repas (12$ x 85 jours x 1 personne)

1020 $

Total des dépenses 

3735 $

 

Pourquoi ai-je choisi une plateforme en anglais?

J'ai choisi Indiegogo car c'est la seule plateforme qui propose un financement flexible. C'est-à-dire que si je n'atteins pas mon objectif de 2935 $ (je l'espère!) je pourrai recevoir le montant amassé (contrairement à un type de campagne "tout-ou-rien" comme la plate-forme La Ruche par exemple). C'est ma première expérience de socio-financement, alors je préfère faire appel à quelque chose de plus stable. N'hésitez surtout pas à communiquer directement avec moi si vous avez des questions à propos du fonctionnement sécuritaire d'Indiegogo ou consultez leur site.

ENCORE DES QUESTIONS ? Pas de troubles va voir ma section FAQ!

Diplômée en Muséologie, Véronique Tifo est bachelière de l'Université Concordia (B.F.A. - 2005) et termine des études supérieures en Art-Thérapie en 2010 (D.E.S. - U.Q.A.T). De 2005 à 2012, elle fonde et dirige Ŭtĕrum, École de Peinture Actuelle, où sa prémisse est de mettre en valeur l’individualité artistique de chacun de ses étudiants. Après sa maîtrise en Arts visuels et médiatiques (UQAM, 2015)  l'artiste quitte son atelier de Montréal pour oeuvrer au sein du Great Northern Arts Festival à Inuvik. En 2017, elle est invitée à bord de l'équipage de Canada C3. Le voyage de 20 jours en brise-glace fait un tour complet de L’Alaska et lui permet d’explorer le carnet de voyage, inspiré de l’aspect narratif des qimiqrunguaq (dessins Inuits). En 2019, Véronique Tifo se joint à l'équipe du MAC Laurentides pour y oeuvrer en muséologie.

Tu veux voir un peu ce que je fais? 

  • Thérèse et Véronique
  • Communiquer au passage
  • Decover Magazine
  • Télé-série L'Imposteur 
  • Mon voyage Canada C3 
  • Mon site web personnel (en construction, comme le pont Champlain..)

merci!

270 $


Frais de recherche : Abonnement bibliothèque Coaticook
45 $


Frais de recherche : Achat de livres spécialisés
100 $


Frais de transports : Voyage vers la résidence et déplacements
500 $


Repas (12$ x 85 jours x 1 personne)
1020 $


Total des dépenses 
3735 $


 

Pourquoi ai-je choisi une plateforme en anglais?
J'ai choisi Indiegogo car c'est la seule plateforme qui propose un financement flexible. C'est-à-dire que si je n'atteins pas mon objectif de 2935 $ (je l'espère!) je pourrai recevoir le montant amassé (contrairement à un type de campagne "tout-ou-rien" comme la plate-forme La Ruche par exemple). C'est ma première expérience de socio-financement, alors je préfère faire appel à quelque chose de plus stable. N'hésitez surtout pas à communiquer directement avec moi si vous avez des questions à propos du fonctionnement sécuritaire d'Indiegogo ou consultez leur site.
ENCORE DES QUESTIONS ? Pas de troubles va voir ma section FAQ!

Diplômée en Muséologie, Véronique Tifo est bachelière de l'Université Concordia (B.F.A. - 2005) et termine des études supérieures en Art-Thérapie en 2010 (D.E.S. - U.Q.A.T). De 2005 à 2012, elle fonde et dirige Ŭtĕrum, École de Peinture Actuelle, où sa prémisse est de mettre en valeur l’individualité artistique de chacun de ses étudiants. Après sa maîtrise en Arts visuels et médiatiques (UQAM, 2015)  l'artiste quitte son atelier de Montréal pour oeuvrer au sein du Great Northern Arts Festival à Inuvik. En 2017, elle est invitée à bord de l'équipage de Canada C3. Le voyage de 20 jours en brise-glace fait un tour complet de L’Alaska et lui permet d’explorer le carnet de voyage, inspiré de l’aspect narratif des qimiqrunguaq (dessins Inuits). En 2019, Véronique Tifo se joint à l'équipe du MAC Laurentides pour y oeuvrer en muséologie.
Tu veux voir un peu ce que je fais? 

Thérèse et Véronique
Communiquer au passage
Decover Magazine
Télé-série L'Imposteur 
Mon voyage Canada C3 

Mon site web personnel (en construction, comme le pont Champlain..)


merci!

story:
What is this "mini-fest" anyway? 

To complete my DMA, I have to do one more recital that showcases my artistry and interests. As an artist with a wide range of interests, it became clear to me that I couldn't possibly encompass my work in one solo recital. "queer time | two happenings on november 5th" is meant to showcase my work as a performer, but also as a curator, producer, and facilitator. 

The first event of the day, a 5pm recital at the Experimental Theatre at UCSD, features two works for voice and piano. Sharing the stage with long time collaborator Kyle Adam Blair, we will perform "L'Ame en bourgeon" (1937) by Claire Delbos. This eight song cycle is rarely performed; composed by Olivier Messiaen's first wife, these songs are settings of poems by Messiaen's mother, Cecile Sauvage. These songs are both deeply personal and tender, giving a voice to two brilliant women that history has hidden in the shadow of a powerful man. The second half of the recital features a world premiere; composer Justin Murphy-Mancini has set multidisciplinary artist Miguelzinta Solis's poem, "Pinterest Sex" as a multi-movement monodrama. This work is a mix of camp and pastiche, and evokes the tragedy of the queer adolescent experience. I am so excited to show this piece to the world; Justin and Miguel are two of my best friends, and I feel incredibly honoured to be a part of this collaboration. 

The second event of the day, an 8ish pm art party at the Che Cafe, features visual artists, performance artists, drag performers, musicians, and everyone in between. I am performing a set in this show with my bandmate Sadie Hochman, but I am also taking on the role of organizer and curator; this event is as much about the other artists and performers involved as it is about me. The guiding themes for this show are nostalgia, personal history, memory, and queer time. Featured artists include Grace Huddleston, Asa Mendelsohn, Lauren Jones, Joshua Moreno, Madison Greenstone, and others. Given that this event is taking place in the historic Che Cafe, this is meant to be a community event that embraces the inclusive ideology of the Che; the space is accessible and all ages (the Che is a sober space), we will have vegan snacks and cold brew coffee, and cover is $2-$5 pay-what-you-want (no one turned away for lack of funds). 

 

How can I help/why should I help?

This campaign is trying to raise $500, but that is just the minimum that Indiegogo requires for a crowdfunding campaign; I actually only need about $400. This $400 would be used to cover several expenses so that I can give all the money made at the door back to my collaborators. Artists (and especially grad student artists) are often expected to work for free, which is both unethical and unsustainable. For example, during my time at UCSD, my institution has only paid me to sing once. I don't want to be a part of that problematic pattern; I may not be able to pay my collaborators much, but it is important to me that I be able to pay them something. The funds raised from this campaign would be used to cover the following:

  • Miguelzinta's flight (~$270). Miguel is currently pursuing an MFA in Lethbridge, Alberta, but it is very important to me that he be here for the premiere of the piece he co-wrote.
  • Food  and modest honoraria for kitchen and door volunteers and the Che (~$130)

So what's in it for you? I am recording several of the pieces featured in these shows at the beginning of December; every person who donates $10 or more will receive a copy of this recording. This will be a professional quality recording done at UCSD's state of the art recording studios, consisting of approximately 60 minutes of music, including the above mentioned premiere.

For everyone who donates, you will have my undying gratitude, and the knowledge that you helped a bunch of artists actually make a living doing what they love. Even if you can't donate, I am planning on livestreaming at least the first show via Facebook, which you are all welcome to watch. 

Thank you all for your help!

story:
Quixotic needs your help! The ground-breaking performing arts collective based in Kansas City is just beginning to win national and international acclaim. This month, Quixotic is proud to be working with the Nelson-Atkins Museum to present a free to the public art event on Saturday, April 27.  “SURFACES: An Illuminated Retrospective” will draw thousands of people to the museum's south lawn for a celebration of the Nelson-Atkins through Quixotic's signature mix of music, dance and aerial arts, video projection, and elaborate costuming. As part of the FREE performance, the troupe will explore carefully selected treasures form the museum's collections with huge video projections on the building’s south façade. 

How you can make a difference

The projectors used for SURFACES, though, will be rented. Every video projection Quixotic creates from our installation at the Kauffman Center to our first time exploring projection mapping at the Nelson-Atkins for Surfaces in 2009 is with a rented projector, in fact. The goal of this campaign is to help the group raise the $18,000 they badly need for a digital video projector of their own.  

How it will make us better

With this extraordinary equipment, the group will not only be saved from the huge drain of constant rentals, but they will finally be able to create and rehearse using the same equipment they perform with allowing the troupe to take a quantum leap in the level of performance.  

How you can help

Support from other creative, caring people has always been a crucial part of Quixotic's success. If you can, please help the troupe now. While there's no way to thank everyone enough, the group has assembled a stellar selection of gifts for donors at all different level as a small way of saying thank you for the support. 

If you're unable to help us with this campaign it would be really appreciated if you could at least share this campaign with others using the Indiegogo Share!
