story:
Public Interest

If you have missed donating to Nigel's 'Public Interest' Indiegogo project you can still contribute via the following link. Link to Nigel's 'Public Interest' blog 'donations' page.

My Ongoing Work.

An update on what I've been making happen since I started this campaign.

Over the last six weeks I have been to 13 political meetings including Full Council, Cabinet, individual meetings with cabinet councillors, Hustings for the PCC election, and attended Public meetings on Planning and the City's Budget.

So far I've published 19 articles to my Blog site, had an article published in Now Then Magazine, an interview with them is published on December 3rd, an interview with Ellen Beardmore published in 'The Sheffield Star' newspaper and talked on BBC Radio Sheffield about the post of the PCC and the by-election.

I was also interviewed by Max Munday alongside Scott Lavery of the University of Sheffield, on Sheffield Live TV, talking about the current so called 'devolution' on offer to the city regions.

During that short six weeks my main achievement has been to drag the 'Devolution' issue into the light of public scrutiny. Secrecy over discussions between councils and the government on what is being termed devolution has been brought out and the fact that both government and councils are denying the public any knowledge or say in the process has now been publicised.

In addition I've managed to get a cabinet councillor to confirm that transparency and openness are the most important things in the planning process and the commitment of another cabinet councillor to regreening Meadowhead roundabout desecrated by Highway Department 'improvements'. Finally I was able to act as a catalyst for the objections to the proposed demolition plans for the Devonshire Street shops that include 'Rare and Racy', a legendary record & book store, and other independent traders.

I think that's a good record for six weeks work. The trouble is, unless this campaign generates significantly more money than to date, this level of work is unsustainable.

The actions and decisions of City Council and regional decision makers like the Sheffield City Region Combined Authority, The Sheffield Executive Board and the Police and Crime Panel will be largely under the radar. This will be bad for the public and bad for the city.

I therefore appeal to each and every person who reads this to contribute to my campaign. Without support I cannot continue at this level, if at all. A small donation from many people will enable me to continue and to keep our community leaders as honest as possible and their decision making as transparent as possible. If you don't contribute who will?


Background

The public should know all we can about the business of the decision makers that affect our lives, our wallets and our democracy. I want to be able to put full time effort into trying to improve the levels of transparency and accountability within Sheffield City Council and the other organisations that influence the way our City is run. To shine a light on how decisions are made and where the money goes. If I can also help others to find their own voice and influence along the way, then that is a bonus. 


Listen to Nigel describing his 'Public Interest' funding campaign



About Me

    The Public Interest Blog - Facebook Page - My Twitter

Nigel Slack. I'm a 53 year old citizen of Sheffield. I use the term 'active citizen' to describe myself as someone who is busy in the city's civic society. I try, where I can, to make a difference, to provide a public point of view on the way decisions are made and influenced.

I was switched back on to politics following the emergence of the 'Occupy' movement worldwide and particularly in Sheffield. I began to realise that we have lots of information in this world but often have too little knowledge to make sense of the 'system'. One news story about the City Council congratulating a profit making major bus company on securing public funds to invest in new buses, from which it would make yet more profit made me wonder 'why?'. I took my first step on this road to a better understanding of local politics, decision making and influence. Now I'm excited to try and take this to a new level.

My background experience has been invaluable in helping me navigate this tangled web, from my education, post graduate level in management studies through many years in sales to working in business strategy and restructuring. Throughout I've had a thread of charity volunteering, working with Sheffield AIDSline in the early days of the HIV crisis and for some ten years, as an elected officer, part of the charity's team, guiding it in addressing local and regional strategic approaches to sexual health.


About what I do

The biggest part of what I do is ask questions. A simple idea but, getting sensible and informative answers means devising questions that cannot easily be ignored and are not just about criticising what's happening but looking for a way to improve what is happening. It's about knowing how to research the information needed to write a good question, who is the best person to ask, and how to spot when questions are responded to but not answered. It's also about persistence. If you don't get the information you need first time, ask a different question, ask a different person or break it down into bite size questions that come together as the answer to the big question.

Most people don't have the time to get involved in Council Meetings, asking questions, doing research, chasing for answers. Many would find it dull or worry that they don't have the skills. I find it exciting. It's a 'thrill of the hunt' thing or like solving the mystery before the author gives it away. The chance to devote myself to it full time? Incredibly exciting.

Asking questions opens doors, persistence pushes doors wide and good research lets you understand what's behind the door. This combined approach has enabled me to effect change. Changing the way my questions and suggestions are seen within the establishment, changing the way information is available to the public and changing the perception of what one person can achieve.

The other thing I do is to offer a different perspective. I am apolitical, I have no affiliation to any political party, large or small. I will talk with any of them and I will debate with any of them. I have the ability to 'think outside the box' as they say and there is no 'party discipline' preventing me from asking what I want and debating what I want. Some of the local parties and their extended networks seem to appreciate this fresh point of view, others are more wary and prefer an arms length approach, but I think they are all now aware that my intentions are to help improve my City and the way it is run.


About my work with others

    Sheffield for Democracy website

Having talked about what one person can achieve, there is also a place for teamwork. Recently I have begun working with a local community group called Sheffield for Democracy, alongside my own public interest. Many of our issues are complementary and, like me, they take an apolitical approach to their campaigning. As the group we address local issues like the way Sheffield City Council address community engagement and the way the scrutiny system works. We have also submitted evidence to the council about the current electoral boundary review.

Regionally we are continuing efforts to make oversight of cross border bodies like Sheffield City Region Combined Authority and the Police & Crime Commissioner more transparent and accessible to the public, whilst nationally we have submitted evidence to two inquiries by the Political & Constitutional Reform Select Committee and appeared before them to give evidence on 'Voter Engagement'. We actively engage with local MPs and recently had a meeting with the Deputy Prime Minister, Nick Clegg about local devolution and the 'MPs Recall Bill'.

Sheffield for Democracy has a hard working core of dedicated volunteers but no money and a big job to do in protecting and promoting democracy in the city and region. This project will help me and them to continue working together long term and continue engaging the public of Sheffield in democratic issues.


The Money

What will the money do? In the simplest terms it will provide a basic wage to enable me to commit to this work full time. With the money being raised by public subscription it will mean I am operating entirely independently. Independent of party politics, independent of patronage, and independent of influence from other organisations. I will be able to continue to ask the questions that need asking, push for positive change in the city and to work with others of a similar mind without restrictions imposed from any 'other'. I will have the opportunity to share all I do with the public, through social media, blogging and regular reporting to other media outlets.

Basic wage + stationery + travel = £18,000 + Middle man costs (Indiegogo) + donation rewards = £20,000

If I don't raise this amount, I will use whatever I do raise to work on the project for as long as possible. If I raise more, which would be incredible, it will simply extend the length of time available to work for the public good before I have to do more fundraising.


Future Plans

I'm currently working towards getting the City Council's public meetings broadcast on the internet (Webcasting) to improve transparency and in trying to get the council to find ways to increase income to the city to mitigate by millions of pounds the effect of austerity funding cuts handed down from Government.

I am also continuing to push for ever greater information to be made available about the private companies that deliver public services, including profits and their inclusion under 'Freedom of Information' regulations.

In the immediate future the launch of this project will also see the public launch of what has been a relatively private blog site of mine called 'Public Interest' recording my work, as well as a new Facebook page for discussions and my newly acquired Twitter presence for news updates and interesting tit bits.

Further down the line I want to start looking at the 'planning' process within the city as there seem to be some problems around transparency and the public's basic understanding of how the procedure works. In addition there seems to be ongoing concerns with the protection of the city's heritage. I also want to explore the public appetite for and the opportunity for holding Councillors to account for their voting and attendance record at various council meetings.

The potential of the city's new TV service is on my horizon where I hope to pitch, in the very near future, an idea for a politics debate show of some form


Past accomplishments

I hate blowing my own trumpet, it's not really my style. I tend to get on with what I'm doing and making positive change happen is what matters to me. I also know that what I do has an effect, sometimes small but sometimes not so small. For this project however I guess I need to give some outline of what I've been able to achieve over the last couple of years as a very part-time 'Active Citizen'.

The first thing I managed to do was to place in the public realm information about the amount of profits private contractors were making out of the public purse. It actually took a few months but it rated a front page splash in the Sheffield Star newspaper. Following on shortly afterwards I was interviewed by Sheffield Live Community Radio about my efforts and that meant the Council Cabinet member for finance felt he had to respond with a similar interview to defend the council's position. I've also contributed BBC Radio interviews and 'Now Then' magazine article on this subject.

I have continued working on the transparency of council 'Outsourcing' arrangements and, working with officers as well as cabinet members, the council website now carries detailed information on the major city contracts. They detail the services that the contractors are supposed to deliver (for the first time) and information about their performance and the contract management arrangements. We now know names and contact information for the service managers and the council officers that oversee their operations. The 'Streets Ahead' contract with Amey is available on the website, after many attempts by the then cabinet member for finance to forget that he'd agreed to do this. More importantly the way future contracts will be negotiated now commits the council to what's known as 'presumed disclosure'. In other words, unless the contractor can prove strong 'confidentiality' reasons not to, the process and the contract itself will be in the public domain.

My concerns, first raised in October 2012 about the tax affairs of some outsourcing contractors and the poor human rights records of others, has continued to gain momentum and the council recently confirmed they will be reviewing the contracting regulations in the city to reflect public concern over these issues.

In July 2013 I was the first to raise concerns with the council about the increasing use of zero hour contracts, particularly in the care sector and questioned their use by the council. This led to a review by the council of its use of zero hour contracts. A little later in the year I undertook some research for the Green Party into what is termed the 'Supermarket Levy' which led to a motion being placed before the council to ask central government to use the Sustainable Communities Act to enable local authorities to implement the scheme. This was inevitably defeated by the council's majority party.

Over and above these specific achievements I now represent either myself or Sheffield for Democracy at events and meetings throughout the city and region. I connect with and try to influence organisations such as the Sheffield Executive Board, the Police & Crime Panel, and various one off events such as the Sheffield City Summit.


If you have missed donating to Nigel's 'Public Interest' Indiegogo project you can still contribute via the following link. Link to Nigel's 'Public Interest' blog 'donations' page.

story:
The Dream

Every since I began slamming two years ago, I have wanted to make a National Poetry Slam team. The experience, connections, and exposure are an amazing opportunity to get me to the next level of my writing/performing career. I have worked so hard to get here, and I've made it. The only problem is that it costs money to get to Nationals. This year it's in Oakland, California. 

The Goal

I'm trying to raise $2,000 to help get myself and the rest of my team to the National Poetry slam. 

Why You Should Help me.

Slam poetry has been such a rewarding experience for me. I love getting on stage and sharing my personal stories and dreams with others. Reaching out to others and talking about important issues is something that matters so much to me. 

Help me to keep doing it.

Getting to the National Poetry Slam will allow me to meet other important writers in the community, get exposure, and attend workshops to improve my craft. 

Thank you all so much for your love and support. I couldn't have made it this far without you. 

With so much love,

Paul "Canada" Nemeth

story:
Help an Old Lady Buy A Shoe

Hi, I'm Maggie Rivers.  I'm an author.  Together with friends C. Deanne Rowe and Glenna West we write "The Stiletto" books.  The books are doing great, thanks to all our fans.  They're quick, fun reads with three separate stories in one book and they each involve "stilettos" in some way.  At our book signings, we give away "stiletto" keychains as a token of our appreciation to those who buy our books. 

Well, one day, a friend sent me the picture of what I call "The Stilettomobile".  That was it. I just had to have it to take to our book signings.  Can you imagine the excitement that would cause!  It'll bring people out to our signings and in today's book world, you need something to draw attention to your books; something to make you stand out from the crowd.  We're no Stephen King or Janet Evanovich although we're trying.  So the something for us is "The Stilettomobile". 

Once I saw the photo, I asked on Facebook, who could build it for me and low and behold a lady I grew up with, Brenda, told me her son, Chad, could build it.  Chad builds custom trucks and for him building "The Stilettomobile" would be a piece of cake.  Thus, my fund for the "Help an Old Lady Buy a Shoe" campaign started.  I made a sign to take to our book signings, put a picture of "The Stilettomobile" on it and started talking it up.  People love it and have been donating a few dollars as they could.  So far I've raised over $2,000.

What We Need & What You Get

We 're going to build the Stilettomobile in steps.  The first thing is we need the motorbike base and for that we're trying to raise $10,000 to go with the $2,000 I already have. 

All the money we collect goes to Chad in Northport, Alabama.  He'll use all the money we send him to buy the bike that'll go underneath the shoe and also have the shoe itself cast from fiberglass.  It'll be expensive!  But I know with your help we can do this!

Once it's done, "The Stiletto Girls" as we've become known, will take it on the road.  Yep, we plan to take it to all our book signings, and drive it in parades and other events.  We'll bring it to a town near you and you can have your picture made with it.  It'll be totally awesome!

We're planning a contest for those who donate.  For a certain number of lucky winners, we'll bring "The Stilettomobile" directly to your town, right to your front door and we'll take you for a spin in "The Stilettomobile."  We haven't figured out just how many trips we can do in a year.  We both have to make a living so we work full-time jobs in addition to our writing.

If we don't make our entire goal, the money still goes to Chad and he'll work on "The Stilettomobile" as he can and as we continue to raise funds and send it to him. If we make more than our goal, we'll use the rest for the upkeep of "The Stilettomobile" like gasoline, oil, etc.

After we get the bike, then we'll start working on raising the funds for the fiberglass shoe itself (unless of course we can get this campaign to go viral and we get enough donations here to take care of the entire thing!). 

The Impact

Now "The Stilettomobile" may not be the top campaign in the world right now but at least it'll bring a smile to a lot of faces when it shows up at your front door.  You know you want a chance to ride in it and wave at all your friends as you pass by.  What a hoot! 

For the Stiletto Girls, it will get us one step closer to the New York Times Bestseller List.  All three of us, myself, Deanne and Glenna would love being full-time writers.  We love getting out there and meeting all of you, our fans!  That's what makes writing so much fun for us.  It's meeting the fans and hearing your stories of what our stories mean to you!

Other Ways You Can Help

While most of you will be able to donate something to help us out, some of you may not.  But, you can still help.  You can spread the word about "The Stilettomobile" and help us get those donations rolling in.

The more noise we can create about our campaign the better our chances are.  So have fun with it, talk it up, tell your neighbors they're never going to believe what you saw!  Let them know they can help bring the Stilettomobile to your town!  Spread the word!

Use the share tools here at Indiegogo and get "The Stilettomobile" campaign going viral and "Help An Old Lady Buy A Shoe!"

story:
Hello, lovelies.


A brisk nine months ago, a wonderful burlesquer by the name of Apple Angel gave me a shot at performing.  Now, Burlycon is giving this young gun yet another shot by offering me a scholarship to attend Burlycon 2014.

As much  tawdry delight as I've had in these past nine months, I still have so much to learn - and such a ravenous hunger for knowledge.  Burlycon offers this chance to expand my smarts about the history and art of American burlesque, both as a performer and a filthy little fanatic.

And they've actually invited me to attend!


"Wait, so am I putting my money on your shimmying bum or...?"

My scholarship to Burlycon 2014 covers tuition for the educational convention; however, it is only a partial scholarship.  It does not cover expenses like transportation, room & board or food.

Because Burlycon 2014 is not until October, I have time to squirrel money away for things like a hotel room and meals.  What I need assistance with is the cost of the plane tickets to and from SeaTac.  That is the reason for the season, my sweets.

  • This fundraiser goes strictly to travel expenses.
  • In exchange for your gracious assistance, I would love to craft you some delightful little burlesque accoutrements.

  • Most importantly!  Even if I do not achieve my goal of $500, the money raised will still help me greatly in getting my little behind to Seattle so that I can shimmy it right off!


"I feel the earth, move, under my feet."

  • I want to come back to Oklahoma as a better performer - a woman who can be a part of our flourishing burlesque community and contribute to the greater naked good. 

A shimmy and a shake

You don't have throw down your singles to be a mover and a shaker, my love.

  • One minute can last an eternity on the stage, but it takes barely a wink of your eye to share this fundraiser - and sometimes, a share is all it takes.
  • Follow the Indiegogo share tools, and thank you for your time!


bisou bisou,

Valerie de Renard


    To learn more about Burlycon 2014, please visit: http://burlycon.org/about/faq/

    To get a glove-peel of my family, TnT Burlesque & Variety Troupe, peek behind the curtain: http://www.tntsizzle.com/

    And find me on Facebook or Instagram if you want to keep dibs on my burly adventures!

    https://www.facebook.com/Mlle.deRenard

    Instagram:  @valeriederenard

    *Photo detail courtesy of Leia Smethurst Photography

    https://www.facebook.com/leia.smethurst/about

story:
Short Summary

My name is Marianna Mills, a Hungarian photographer and artist of many disciplines, currently living in the United States.

Nearly every day I hear about selfies and see them in the media. Admittedly, I have also taken photographs of myself over the past years, recording the changes of my facial expression, and how my changing circumstances have made me look different. The recent media attention to selfies - some saying it's narcissism, while others explain it as self-exploration - caused me to think about my motivations and those of others who practice this new form of self-portraiture.

I would like to explore this topic through the creation of a photo book of selfies.

Self-exploration and self-portraits are also an art genre. In the past, almost every famous artist has done self-portraits with traditional methods. But nowadays, we are fortunate to have our high-tech camera phones, tablets or digital cameras to create this new form of art.

I want to give you an insight of my very personal and intimate life.... and I promise to provide you an extraordinary art experience, with some stories attached to the images, the meaning behind the self portraits, and what made me take them at that particular time.

The main reason I am creating this book is because I want to understand who I was and who I became under life's happiness, pressures, and changing circumstances. And, maybe you, too can learn something from my experiences.

I truly believe that this project could be a milestone in art, and in human psychology and sociology.

Did you know; Oxford officially named ‘Selfie’ the word of the year in 2013?

For those who already seen my campaign, and wondering about the changes, please visit my website for the explanation.


What I Need & What You Get

I've set the funding to $500, which is the smallest amount here on Indiegogo.

That is because it's the minimum to pay for my time and effort in creating this book, and I didn't want to set an unrealistic goal for my campaign.

I am thinking of using the Blurb self publishing website to create the book. It will be a small square format book, size 7×7 in (18×18 cm) with hard cover and image wrap.

To produce one book, it will cost between $65-80 USD - depending on quantity, for a 100 page book.

When you support this project, you have many perk to choose from. Or, if you wish, you can contribute any amount without chosing any perks.
About the Perks:
This is a great opportunity to get personally signed fine art prints. Usually my art sales are fulfilled by Fine Art America, and I don't have the chance to sign them. But this time will be different, as I will order them and have them shipped to me first. Then, after I've signed your print I will personally ship it to you. So you will get something personal from me in return for your generosity.

If you contribute with the postcard or art print perk, please visit my artist website to choose the image you would like to receive, and don't forget to leave your postal address here on Indiegogo.

In the project Gallery, you can see some of my work as a sample images you can choose from to be a signed art postcard or print.


The project will run for 60 days, and I am planning to complete the book by the end of October 2014.

I am very excited and kind of scared at the same time about this art project. This is my first self-published photo book. I know it will be challenging, because it took so much time to overcome with my feelings to understand my feelings and share my most private moments - but I am up for the adventure.

If you have any question, please feel free to ask.

I will update this project regularly with screenshots of the developing book. And you can follow me on Twitter and/or like my page on Facebook, because I will also use my sites for updates on the project.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

      Please, promote my campaign because you love what I am doing and support the cause.

        SHARE, SHARE, SHARE...please use the Indiegogo share tools :)

          And that's all there is to it.


          Tags: selfie, selfies, selfies book, selfiesbook, selfiebook,self portrait,  selfportrait, #selfie, #selfies, #selfish #selfiesbook, #selfiebook, #selfisbook, #mgmart

story:
Meld - A Sourcing Project...

Meld is a traveling exhibitions and event management team.  We are a collection of artists, designers, builders, farmers and big-time thinkers all based in Boston Massachusetts! The team temporarily turns established spaces into places for both food and art in the form of a pop-up gallery. We curate and install exhibitions in food resources such as breweries, restaurants and markets. Finally to bring the public together the team crafts an event infused with local food and the exhibited art. Meld is an effort to provide a space where the middleman for the local food and art industry become one. 

This campaign is important to us because we believe that art, food and conversation are inextricably connected. Farmers and artists are not too different from each other, they both need the support of a community and the exposure. Meld feels strongly that we can provide that support through our events.

By investing in Meld's campaign you are investing in promoting a local community. All funds will go towards starting the foundation of this program. We need the funds to build the walls, the pedestals, purchase lights, promotional materials and local food from our farmers.

With this kind of foundation we can provide a pop-up gallery in a local venue. For every venue we will change the gallery layout, the exhibited show, and the seasonal food provided at the opening event.

Meld gives spaces a chance to be pop-up places. 


What does this thing look like?

Different Meld team members have developed the skills to put on an event like this through producing gallery shows, openings, and various performative productions. Meld will bring the qualities that a gallery space has to offer with the comfort of a farm to table experience. Openings will be infused with locally sourced hors d'oeuvres and unique gallery spaces. A few examples of what we are MELDing  together are in the images below.

[above] A pop-up gallery show in the south end called Regeneration. One of Emelie Berghs[Garden Collective artist] collections is featured here.
 

[above] The Garden Collective co-curated a show called Honey Bees & Garden Weeds in the Student Life Gallery at MassArt in the spring of 2014. This show included 25 artists in a variety of mediums. 


[above] Anna was the Production Assistant for the The Community Canteen - A pop-up dinner series in Somerville, MA at Something GUD.


What We Need & What You Get

To launch Meld we need to raise $7,900. Ok, but for what?

-Fabricating portable gallery walls and pedestals

-Purchasing adequate lighting

-Ordering seasonal produce for the opening event

-Paying for the labor needed to produce the event and gallery [such as the chef and designers]

-Promotional materials and printing

-Materials for documenting the project for our handmade show catalogues

PERKS! Of course there are perks, duh. We believe investing is an energy exchange. We provide a product and you invest in it. That investment is satisfactory in thought but we believe that there is something special about having a little piece of that project to keep. Here are our options...

$15 - Credit on our website for being a loyal investor [coming soon...big-time graphics coming to a screen near you soon ;) ]

$25 - Preserve Package [You will be guaranteed a package of three different preserved goods. This trio will include something sweet, something savory and something pickled! ]

$50 - Small Print [You will receive a small print by one of the featured artists in the first exhibit]

$75 - Handmade catalogue of the show [There will be a small quantity of handmade catalogues made recapping Meld. These are one of a kind gems made by the team.]

$100 - Large Print [One of the works exhibited will be blown up into a large print to thank you for your $100 investment]

$200 - Full Package [A box will be sent to you including a little bit of everything above; a jar of pickled or preserved local goods, a print of art, a mini-catalogue with info about the involved artists and farmers in the project]

How we meld with you?

In our high paced consumer society we have grown distant from the origins of our resources. It seems to me that we tend to gravitate towards food and art for socializing, it’s at the heart of our culture. Going to a gallery, a cup of coffee with a friend, watching a new film, or sitting down for a beer at the end of a long day, are all examples of how we interact but they rarely overlap. What if there was a space where you could enjoy cuisine made from local produce, grab a beer at the brewery bar and browse some locally grown art with friends? Wouldn’t that be something?

In Anna's (founder) time at MassArt she has established herself in the event production field. She has curated shows on and off campus. Anna and the team have been involved in many productions in the city, together building a diverse range of skill sets. The most thrilling part of these production is designing experiences that activate a sense of comfort and trigger a spark of change in a viewer. The Meld team wants to bring these pop-up gallery spaces out to the public to travel and share the experience of local potential.

Other Ways You Can Help

Investing in our campaign is a great way to help and push this project forward. However we know that is not possible for many. Other great ways to support us is sharing our story.

Tell your local farmer, share our mission with your aunt's pottery class, tell your favorite brewery they could have a pop-up gallery and send them our way!

And of course, in the age of the post-ing. POST about us! Only if you're into it though. If you're into it, we're psyched! If not, let us know why, constructive criticism is better than nothing at all!

If you have any further questions do not hesitate to email meld.team@gmail.com

society we have grown distant from the origins of our resources. It seems to me

heart of our culture. Going to a gallery, a cup of coffee with a friend,
watching a new film, or sitting down for a beer at the end of a long day, are
all examples of how we interact but they rarely overlap. What if there was a
space where you could enjoy cuisine made from local produce, grab a beer at the
brewery bar and browse some locally grown art with friends? Wouldn’t that be
something? 
In Anna's (founder) time at MassArt she has established herself in the event production field. She has curated shows on and
off campus. Anna and the team have been involved in many productions in the city, together building a diverse range of skill sets. The most thrilling part of these production is designing experiences that activate a sense of comfort and trigger a spark of
change in a viewer. The Meld team wants to bring these pop-up gallery spaces out to the public to travel and share the experience of local potential.

    Other Ways You Can Help Investing in our campaign is a great way to help and push this project forward. However we know that is not possible for many. Other great ways to support us is sharing our story.
Tell your local farmer, share our mission with your aunt's pottery class, tell your favorite brewery they could have a pop-up gallery and send them our way!
And of course, in the age of the post-ing. POST about us! Only if you're into it though. If you're into it, we're psyched! If not, let us know why, constructive criticism is better than nothing at all!
If you have any further questions do not hesitate to email meld.team@gmail.com

story:
Hello lovelies!

We are Amanda and John, two Portland-based artesans. We love to create awesome things like book necklaces, wire twist earrings, and hand etched glass.

Our dream is to sell at Leaky Con in Portland, Oregon, June 27-30, 2013. And we have been invited to be an official Leaky Con vender!

Unfortunately, the vendor fee ALONE is $800. 

Help us out and bring the famous "Hanklerfish" earrings to Leaky Con this year! 

~

More about us and our team: 

I (Amanda) run the Amery Studios on Etsy (amerystudios.etsy.com), where I sell fandom jewelry and unique wire designs. I've got things for fans of Harry Potter, Doctor Who, Nerdfighters, and more! 

I also make recycled jewelry out of ethernet cable. The Hanklerfish and "DFTBA" earrings above are made that way.  

John is a budding film student, a painter, and an awesome writer. He makes custom ceramic shot glasses in Hogwarts House Colors, and many others as well! He once painted a painting for Misha Collins. It was epic. 

Lexi is our friend, mama bear, and overall great person and organizer. She has great ideas and is always willing to put in time to help us figure things out. She is brilliant and creative, and keeps us together and on our toes. She is also ready and excited to write you pun-tastic thank you notes for any level of donation! 

 

Together we're working to make this happen!

story:
The artist:

 Hi, I am Blanca Caraballo, a visual artist born in Cuba in 1969. I studied visual arts in the Higher Institute of Education: Enrique Jose Varona in La Habana (mostly know as the Columbia) from 1987 to 1990. I immigrated to the United States in 1991, during  the “special period”. I continued my education in the arts in Miami, Florida graduating in 2002 from Florida International University. I  have participated in many exhibitions in USA, Mexico, Spain and Argentina. I  worked mainly in painting and drawing, but also has produced artist’s books, mail art, sculptures and objects. 

On December 2011, I felt the need to communicate to a wider audience and to leave the traditional setting of a gallery space. I participated in the Miami based public arts project “Giants in the City“ with a 20' sculpture depicting a white queen chess piece called “God Save the Queen”. Using the game of chess as a symbol of life, I choose the only feminine piece in the board, the queen, and investigates our understanding of gender and power.  The project was exhibited in Bayfront Park, Miami during Art Basel week in 2011, and subsequently in Sleepless Night Festival and the Botanical Garden in Miami Beach and the opening of the Young Art Museum in Davie, Florida. 

 Although the project has become a tradition in Miami since 2008 when it won the Knight Foundation award, and have considerable assistance from the local government, the artists have to come up with the funding for their individual projects. I self-produced the first piece “God Saved the Queen” in 2011, but I need funding to produce a second sculpture, the Star Finder Project. 

Description:

The Star Finder Project involves the production of a giant 25’ x 15’ inflatable sculpture for the Miami based Public Art Project “Giants in the City” (http://giantsinthecity.com/) that was invited to participate in Essen, Germany for the prestigious International Art Fair - C.A.R (Contemporary Art Rhum) (http://www.contemporaryartruhr.de) that will take place from November 2nd to 4th, 2012. The piece should be made in black fabric to match the specific architecture and aesthetic concept of the fair, based on the New Puristic style of the architecture in Essen, an industrial city, known for its beautiful coal mines.

Star Finder Project Statement:

I use art as a practice of self-inquiry. It becomes a decantation process of possible adjunct identities, which leads to the void.

In the Star Finder project, a fragment of the astrolabes, an old time and location measuring instrument, (The star pointing device) is interpreted increasing its size to a massive 25 feet inflatable sculpture. It points to the zenith, encircling stars suggesting our location in time and space as well as it relation to the cosmos.

The sculpture will be exhibited during C.A.R. and it will continue its travel as part of the nomadic public arts exhibition of massive sculptures Giants in the City.

The Rewards:

By contributing to this campaign you will have the reward of producing the sculpture and allowing its participation in one of the most prestigious young art fairs in Europe. Even though I have  participated in exhibitions oversea none have been as important as C.A.R. Participation in this project will catapult my career to a higher level. In the past, I have been unable to travel with my art due to lack of funds. This would be the first time that this public arts project and I as an artist cross the ocean to Europe and exhibit in one of the most prestigious fairs in Germany. 

The participation of giants in the City in this great project is contested upon the participation of the individual artists. The participation of the Star Finder is dependent of your generous contribution to the elaboration of the piece. The cost of producing the piece is estimated $3000 which covers the fabric, manufacturing, shipping from the manufacturer in Mexico to Miami, blower that constantly supplies the air, painting intervention in the piece and sign with the names of the artist and project statement. The trip and stay in Essen by the artist is estimated $2000, according to the price of the air ticket, hotel and meals. The total cost of the project is $5000.00

Whatever amount is raised will be used toward the production of the piece. The cost of travel will be covered if more funds are raised to pay for it. All contributors will receive some kind of reward according to your contribution. Limited edition of t-shirts, silk screened prints and originals will be produced to reward the contributors. These rewards will be shipped in September 2012 once the campaign is completed. Please, review my web site at (http://www.blancacaraballo.com)

 How can you help?

You can get the word out about this project. Use the Indigogo share tool , place a link in your facebook or any other social media and let others know that they can contribute to this campaign. The money is needed urgently to start the manufacturing of the sculpture. Your help is greatly appreciated!

story:
Make people go to Lamalunga è un esperimento sullo scambio delle conoscenze e le azioni collettive in un piccolo villaggio rurale.
È un modo di ripensare le aree rurali, scegliendole come ambientazione per le attività culturali, in un percorso interdisciplinare.

I laboratori partiranno il 24 agosto e si chiuderanno il 30. Nei giorni precedenti, allestiremo l'area usando materiali di recupero.

Durante la settimana impareremo come produrre carta artigianalmente, ci occuperemo di sperimentazioni sugli impasti di cibo e sugli incarti, prenderemo parte ad una performance teatrale e progetteremo una scenografia per la stessa, riciclando carta, cartone e materiali di fortuna.

I laboratori sono aperti a chiunque voglia parteciparvi e voglia trascorrere una settimana di campeggio nel Sud Italia, nell'agro di Minervino Murge (BT).
Allestiremo l'area con l'aiuto di gente del posto e il materiale di recupero verrà impiegato nella costruzione di strutture temporanee e removibili.
Aiutateci a fare in modo che questo accada nel modo migliore!
Nel laboratorio su "Scenografia e riciclo" noi ospiteremo l'architetto Riccardo Dalisi. Abbiamo deciso di coinvolgerlo perché rappresenta per noi una guida "morale" nella progettazione sostenibile, grazie alla sua lunga esperienza di lavoro con i materiali poveri.

http://www.designboom.com/weblog/cat/8/view/4882/riccardo-dalisi-design-ultrapoverissimo.html
http://it.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riccardo_Dalisi

Questo è un progetto di collaborazione tra quattro gruppi diversi:
Make People Do Lab www.makepeopledo.it
Cartaelatte www.cartaelatte.it/
Zabar www.zabar.it/
Kuziba teatro www.facebook.com/kuziba.teatro

Necessitiamo di fondi per far sì che Riccardo Dalisi sia con noi, per il trasporto di materiali e i rimborsi delle spese di viaggio per tutti gli organizzatori, per l'acquisto dei materiali che useremo nel laboratorio e per offrire una ricompensa ai gestori della masseria che ce l'hanno gentilmente concessa.

Se sarete in Puglia in quelle date, vi consigliamo di passare a trovarci e partecipare ai laboratori! Noi saremo lì a partire dal 20 di agosto.

Vi aspettiamo!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Make people go to Lamalunga is an experiment about knowledge exchange and collective actions in a small rural village.
It's a way to rethink the country by bringing there cultural activities in a interdisciplinary course.

The workshops are running from august 24th to 30th
and we're going before to set the place by using recovered materials.
During the week we'll learn how to produce handmade paper, how to make design with food, how to shape a theatrical performance and build a set for it by recycling cardboard and other stuffs.
The workshops are opened to anyone wants to join the event and spend one week camp in the South of Italy, in the Minervino Murge countryside.

We'll be taking materials from recycling centers and junkyards to build temporary, transformable elements.
Help us make it happen! 

The scenography and recycle workshop will be run by the Naple-based artist-architect-designer Riccardo Dalisi.
We see Dalisi as a moral beacon for his sustainable project philosophy, thanks to his long experience with the use of poor materials.
Below are few links about him:



http://www.designboom.com/weblog/cat/8/view/4882/riccardo-dalisi-design-ultrapoverissimo.html
http://it.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riccardo_Dalisi

This is a collaborative project by four art associations: 
Make People Do Lab www.makepeopledo.it
Cartaelatte www.cartaelatte.it/
Zabar www.zabar.it/
Kuziba teatro www.facebook.com/kuziba.teatro

The funds raised so far will cover Riccardo Dalisi’s fee and all the expenses related to the workshops: materials (colours, brushes and other stuffs), travel expenses for the associations and the farm renting.

If you're in Puglia, Italy, you should come visit or join us! We'll be there since August 20th.

story:
Greetings and salutations!!!
My name is Chelleby Starr. I have been a visual artistic expressionist for over 20 years supporting myself solely on art, and the production of art, along with odd jobs here and there. :) My work has been displayed in galleries all over the United States, featured in articles in several publications, documentaries and films.  Recently, one of my artistic photographs was featured on Oprah Winfrey's Network OWN on Lovetown USA! Such a blessing! This campaign is to raise funds for the printing and launching of my new series IMMERSE to be displayed with my signature series Urban Angels, with a few images from my Beauty Among Debris series in galleries of Berlin Germany!!! Such an honor!

What I need and Oh Perks Galore!!!
5,000K here is the break down...

To be uber super blunt...to print the images, 50 total, it is going to take 3,000. The artistic images are being printed up on canvas. Canvas, instead of photo paper, is being used to add life and durability to the pieces. Another grand will be divided up and going to graphic designers, models and makeup artist service fees who have aided their skills in the production. And guess what? Round trip ticket to Berlin...1,000. If you know anyone who can print up the show with mega quality but less expensive, please contact this artist. And if anyone can get a better deal on a flight to Germany, round trip, ring my bell any time!!! In the unlikely event the full goal is not met (but I know it will be, because you all are awesome sauce) what monies are collected will be used for payment of service fees, printing and production of the art or art supplies.

Perks Galore
This is a great time to take advantage of this artist desperate plea...and rack in on some one of kind, unique to this campaign perks! What we got? There are high quality, glossy prints autographed by moi, t-shirts to show how stellar amazing you are for supporting the future of artistic passion, mugs, stickers, magnets, and even a hardback book boasting images from my entire photography collection! Yaaay! Plus a big wet thank you from me...and production credit to boot! Woot! (Yes I so went there...come with me...it is fun)

The Impact

"If art is to nourish the roots of our culture, society must set the artist free
to follow his vision wherever it takes him. " (John F. Kennedy)

"Art is the most intense mode of individualism that the world has known." Oscar Wilde

"The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams." Eleanor Roosevelt

"Johannes Chrysostomus Wolfgangus Theophilus Mozart, was a prolific and influential composer whose master musical artistic expressions transcended his life force. You know him as Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. All know his music, even if they don't know his name.  I marvel at the prodigious ability he harnessed. His works, his being, inspires this vessel.


It is my passion, pulse, life force desire to create art that exalts, encourages and illuminates beyond my existence in this realm." ~Chelleby Starr


Chelleby Starr Creed~

"Urghabháil an nóiméad. Beo gan oth. Rith boldy i dtreo do passions." ~ Chelleby Starr

(Translation)

"Seize the moment. Live without regrets. Boldy Run towards your passions." ~ Chelleby Starr

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey all you fellow starving artists out there! Have you only had a dollar in your wallet since last July? I feel ya! Completely understand if you do not have cash to invest! What you can do, is help spread the word by passing along the link to this campaign on all social media walls, emails, and tweet it. Get the word out! Appreciate you. And keep doing what you do! Keep painting, singing, dancing, writing, photographing, modeling, drawing. Art all day. Always!

Gratitude! ~Chelleby

  • Press

    http://www.joomag.com/magazine/FashionFrenzyMagazine/0236592001320802354
    "Creative Corner" Featured Artist Pages 62-63
    http://www.metrojacksonville.com/article/2009-nov-chellebys-urban-angels-evocative-new-photo-series
    URBAN ANGELS
    http://movementarts.blogspot.com/2008/10/blue-velvet-evolve-chelleby-photography.html
    BLUE VELVET EVOLVE


    "Chelleby has the unique ability to take any person in any situation and
    cultivate them into a magnificent work of art. With a keen eye for location,
    arrangement, props, fashion and a creative flare for make-up, Chelleby can bring
    out the inner model or inner freak in anyone. " ~Mia Movement Magazine


    Interesting  Side Note:

    What do Mozart and Da Vinci have in common? They did not fund their own creations! Many of the prolific artistic contributions, our foundations of art, were funded by Kings, private investors, even The Roman Church.


    Let us become one voice and leave a legacy of artistic history. Help me say, "We live. We were here!" Inspire. Transcend. C*
     


    Immense Gratitude goes out to Nathin Thorin & Embrose Miskell for their artistic contributions to the IMMERSE vision with their graphic design skills!!

Press http://www.joomag.com/magazine/FashionFrenzyMagazine/0236592001320802354"Creative Corner" Featured Artist Pages 62-63http://www.metrojacksonville.com/article/2009-nov-chellebys-urban-angels-evocative-new-photo-seriesURBAN ANGELS http://movementarts.blogspot.com/2008/10/blue-velvet-evolve-chelleby-photography.htmlBLUE VELVET EVOLVE "Chelleby has the unique ability to take any person in any situation and cultivate them into a magnificent work of art. With a keen eye for location, arrangement, props, fashion and a creative flare for make-up, Chelleby can bring out the inner model or inner freak in anyone. " ~Mia Movement MagazineInteresting  Side Note:What do Mozart and Da Vinci have in common? They did not fund their own creations! Many of the prolific artistic contributions, our foundations of art, were funded by Kings, private investors, even The Roman Church.Let us become one voice and leave a legacy of artistic history. Help me say, "We live. We were here!" Inspire. Transcend. C* Immense Gratitude goes out to Nathin Thorin & Embrose Miskell for their artistic contributions to the IMMERSE vision with their graphic design skills!!

story:
The Heart of the Matter

Thank you for visiting my page to raise money for the Moon Angel/Malakh Halevenah Cards and book.  These are a set of cards to guide personal and collective divination work in everyday life or, as art to hang on your refrigerator.  My hope is that your contributions will reflect back to you the same abundance you have given.  Like the moon reflects the luminosity of the sun, may your light be tenfold. 

My greatest wish is that my art will help others connect with their deepest desires and inspire creativity and connection.  Much of the original  inspiration for the cards grew out of a teaching in Judaism about feelings being messengers or angels. However,  I hope these cards will be a touchstone and daily practice in unconventional and liberating ways for anyone, of any spiritual practice.  And maybe speak to people who don't feel an easy way into spirituality or have felt isolated in those worlds.  It's all about the joys and oyes of living.

Oh, and by the way-This campaign is also to help support finishing the deck and beginning my budding business as an artist.  

By supporting this campaign you will be connecting in with a larger magical circuit of dreamers, weavers, mothers, lovers, visionaries, creators and community.  

(The video shows images of the cards and excerpts from the book that accompany the deck. Detailed images and more information about the cards can be found at: www.ryanrebekaherev.com)

Contributors

This project is my brainchild but there are many people I will need to work with to manifest the cards and other items out into the world.  Already I have gotten inspiring help!  I want to pay the artists who have already contributed and pay the artists who will help with the next stages.

So by donating you are supporting artists collaborating and creating art community.  That feels good, yea?

These are some of the radiant visionaries and minds behind this project:
Ryan Rebekah Erev (me), artist, performer, writer:  Ryan created the art and imagined the project.
Naima Noguera Mujica, filmaker:  Naima shot and edited the bright genius of a video essay you just got to watch.
Ro Seidelman, musician:  Ro created the luminous score and recorded my voice for the film.
Lizanne Deliz, artist, designer:  Lizanne's brilliant talent will be helping with the design of the cards and the book that accompanies them.
Chrysta Giffen, artist, photographer: Chrysta's impeccable skill will photograph and retouch the artwork I created for the cards.
Inkworks Press: A collectively managed and green business in Berkeley that will be printing the cards and other perks.

The Story Behind the Maker

I am an artist who has been making art for quite a while now and haven't shown much work outside of close friends for a very long time.  I am launching this campaign at the same time as I am having an opening of my work at Alchemy Collective Cafe in South Berkeley. It's a big leap that makes me nervous and excited and vulnerable all at the same time. 

I first visioned this project two and a half years ago.  At the time I had begun making art again for the first time in almost a decade.  I felt my own practice had in part fell to the side because of my own insecurities as an artist and also what I perceived as limited access to the art world.  In tandem, I was looking for a Jewish community that was in line with my feminist, queer, political identities.  Being radical in my support of peace for all Jews everywhere and Palestinian liberation,  and walking this world as a queer Jewish witch were ways I was looking to connect with Jewish community.

Last summer I was ordained as a Hebrew Priestess, through the Kohenet Hebrew Priestess Institute.  This has contributed to having a more earth-based, feminist community in my Jewish practice and reorient my understanding of what it means to be Jewish.

This project  grew out of several desires: a desire to provide access to art that is both accessible monetarily  and supportive of the artist who made it, a desire to collaborate with other artists and support them in their work and a desire to create something that would be a tool for people who like me, haven't always felt our quirky brand of beauty/magic/seekings had a place to express, explore and connect in.

    Where's the Money Going

    $4200 will go to paying the artist and contributors (listed above) for their time and work
    $3800 will go towards the printing of the decks, the creation and printing of other perk items and shipping costs.
    If I don't reach my entire goal I will do a smaller printing of the cards.
    Other ways to help:

    Please send on this link to others you think may be interested in this project.  Or to people you think may like to collaborate.

    Thank you dearly!

$3800 will go towards the printing of the decks, the creation and printing of other perk items and shipping costs.
If I don't reach my entire goal I will do a smaller printing of the cards.
Other ways to help:
 Please send on this link to others you think may be interested in this project.  Or to people you think may like to collaborate.
Thank you dearly!

story:
Our vision

alice is a collective, anonymous voice responding to urgent and accumulating social and environmental challenges. alice is a determined, inclusive, open-minded, and self-critical persona that speaks out publicly wherever leadership is failing. alice began at a 100-woman dinner in London. The aspiration for alice is to encourage and generate a movement that uses digital tools to recognize and reward “alice leadership” wherever it may be, and to inspire and support others to model ‘alice’ leadership. 

Our project

We are looking for support to build alice’s toolbox, an online zone to help catalyze extraordinary and every day acts of leadership. alice’s toolbox will consist of the following elements: 

• A tip off tool – Have you identified a crisis of leadership or a cause where collective action is stalling? The informant tool will enable the community to bring leadership failings to alice’s attention. 

  • An action portal – Once a number of causes or issues of poor leadership have been aggregated, alice will play the role of curator, enabling users to generate actions that combat the issues at hand. Actions will be crowd-sourced from the community and the most popular actions will be promoted by alice – and spread across the social media landscape.

• An advice community – Are you facing a leadership challenge in your own work? Could you really use a piece of advice from someone who has similar experiences of driving extraordinary change? Our advice column will enable the alice network to pose their questions for peer-to-peer guidance, support and insight from the wider community.

• A place to share stories - How often do you hear about extraordinary acts of courageous leadership? Part of alice’s goal is to foster acknowledgment and tell the stories of those every day acts of courage by individuals who are taking a stand and making change happen. 

• An invitation to talk – alice hopes to spur old-fashioned meet-ups (“alice jams”) over dinner where alice agents can come together and share their stories of leadership and mobilize around mutual areas of concern.

FAQs

WHAT WILL ALICE LOOK AND FEEL LIKE?

alice is a person, a voice within each of us that pushes us to take moral action in the world. alice aspires to a leadership that is:

·  Ambitious in its goals, but modest in temperament

·  Diverse and inclusive

·  Confident and compassionate

·  Fierce without force

·  Attentive and open-minded

·  Puts purpose before the person

·  Warm and approachable

·  Self-critical and eager to learn

WHO CAN BE PART OF ALICE?

alice’s doors are open to whoever may aspire to this new leadership. alice is open to both women and men alike, and to those of all ages and backgrounds, who feel frustrated with the status quo and want to be part of a community of change.  

HOW IS ALICE DIFFERENT FROM WHAT IS ALREADY OUT THERE?

alice is not a traditional leadership network. alice is an attitude / sentiment for modeling extraordinary ways of being in the world. Her ambition for change is rooted in anonymity and a modest temperament. alice isn’t fancy. You won’t find her headlined at the World Economic Forum or the Clinton Global Initiative (although alice may secretly be hiding in the crowd) – you’ll find her in the hearts (and thumbprints) of ordinary women and men who take courageous action. 

alice could become a huge, wide-scale movement, which would outstrip our capacity to deliver. Our aim isn't to build out another campaigning organization, but to focus on rewarding and honoring alice leadership throughout the world. We've designed our set of tools to ensure that we deliver on that promise.

WHAT WILL MY MONEY GO TO?

If successful, your funds will go towards the design and development of alice’s toolbox (all the tools outlined above). Your money will not go towards a particular issue or cause, but to the overall alice platform. 

Other ways you can help

Any contribution you can make will be greatly appreciated. Here are some other ways to pitch in: 

  • Help us spread the word about alice by sharing our campaign on social media and dropping a note to your networks
  • Sign-up to join the alice community at www.iamalice.org 
  • Use #alice to share ideas about the types of new leadership you see out there in the world

Thank you for joining us!

story:
Short Summary

It's Dawntime at the Art Monastery Project, literally and figuratively. A group of 12 ArtMonks have just taken up residence at the baroque Convento delle Clarisse in Caramanico, Italy. The beginning of a potential 6 year collaboration, this is an exciting and essential step for the Art Monastery Project. A new home in Italy where productions can be incubated and toured over the next 6 years. A new home for the ArtMonastic Laboratory, our experiment in creativity, contemplation and community, that's guided the Project and led to our co-founding of projects like the Changemakers' Festival, just finishing its second year in Europe.

We need you - ArtMonks and supporters the world over – to help bring the new day into being.

During this month, we are living the monastic hour of laudes, or dawn, beginning each day together with a sunrise practice and infusing our artistic explorations with material about this magical hour. This summer's ArtMonastic Laboratory will culminate in a new dance/theater piece, 'Prime: L'Ora dell'Alba' which will tour throughout Europe in the autumn.

If this year is successful, the opportunities to get involved will explode – from visits or retreats to Italy, to new artistic opportunities and links with the Castle in LA – the Art Monastery's new US base.

What We Need & What You Get

We've already been hard at work co-fundraising with Loom Ensemble, who are some of the ArtMonks in residence this year -- and have raised over 60% of our total goal of 6200 USD.

Now it's time to call you into the circle. We need to raise another $2000 to make the fall programming come alive. Get involved by backing us with a donation, or just sharing with your network. Your donations will directly support the residency in Caramanico, and the tour and performances of Prime.

We've got a list of perks and rewards for you to choose from in return, but whether you get yourself a bespoke vibrator inductor synth, a personalized thank you video from one of the ArtMonks, or just decide to get involved, you'll be becoming a part of this project in an important way.

And for any dedicated improvisers out there: If you'd like to visit Italy this month, we'd love to have you and have a guest bed waiting for you. Please let us know if you'd like to visit our summer community, have an ArtMonk experience and join the Dawntime!

The Impact

Your contribution will directly support the costs of the residency in Caramanico and the tour of our new piece. Previous Art Monastery Programs like the ArtMonk Retreat and other ArtMonastic Laboratories have had a profound effect on attendees. 

“You are working to pursue dreams of art and community, of creativity and straightforwardness… I’d like to say that there’s a holiness in what you’re trying to do, and holiness has never been an easy path to walk…

In a world of chaos and social and economic dispute, your community is a source of light and inspiration for me… What really matters is the honest and sincere spirit that you put every day into your work.” - Gerard Jara, 2012 visitor 

By getting involved, you're helping to create a world in which this kind of experience is possible not only in a monastery but in the everyday world. 

    Risks & Challenges

    This revival of the Art Monastery Project in Italy is off to a great start! We've got many new artists joining previous ArtMonks in a dynamic new community. Our hosts ReTe, in Caramanico are welcoming and thrilled to have us, and we've already got tour spots for the our show booked in Italy, Belgium, and Berlin. BUT in order to complete our fall season we'll need to finish our summer fundraising campaign. We believe that if this fall season is successful, many new doors will be opened, or suns will be rising (since it's Dawntime and all...). Finishing our residency strong in Caramanico will help to prepare the ground for up to 6 more years of work here, which means so many more opportunities for the entire Art Monastery Community. This is also the first AMP European tour in many years. We'll be working hard on that tour to share our art and artmonastic practices with the people we meet along the way--building relationships with people and spaces, sharing the ArtMonk experience, and seeding fertile ground for the future. 

    Help us make it happen this year! And come play with us in years to come! It's a new start, a new beginning, a new chapter. It's Dawn. Let's celebrate.

      Other Ways You Can Help

        Well first, you know every bit you do counts. If you can even give a dollar or two please do, or you could share the vision and share the campaign with your communities to help us raise funds. Or maybe you know a particular person who might be interested to get involved in some way...tell them, connect us! 

        Also, we are still booking tour dates, workshops and shows in London, Stockholm, and Amsterdam (we already mentioned Italy, Belgium, and Berlin)--do you know someone in one of these places who might like to get involved? We are looking for places to stay, venues to perform in, places and people to share the ArtMonk experience with, and any other wacky idea you have.
