story:
Who We Are

The Center for Art and Thought is a web-based arts and education 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. From our web platform <www.centerforartandthought.org>, winner of 2013 Horizon Interactive and 2014 AVA Digital Awards, we take the Philippines and Filipinos as a point of departure for thinking culture globally. A site where global processes like colonialism, migration, and globalization come together, the Philippines is an ideal starting point for understanding pressing contemporary global issues, from labor migration to environmental crises. CA+T’s virtual platform presents creative and scholarly works exploring these questions through four cornerstone programs: 1) Curated Exhibitions, 2) Commissioned Works, 3) a DIALOGUES series of moderated, thematically-driven conversations, and 4) a one-of-a-kind Artist-in-Residence Virtual Residency program.

Why We’re Fundraising Here

CA+T relies on a small, dedicated team to plan, coordinate and execute its online and offline programming, and all this programming requires money.  From the subscriptions that enable us to host a variety of media to developing partnerships with organizations to present exhibitions and artist and scholar talks, we’re doing a lot on a shoestring.

We’re applying for grants wherever we can, but many grants exclude the day-to-day operational costs that keep CA+T running and vibrant: the website fees and subscriptions, staff salaries, printing and postage, publicity. And, as a young organization, CA+T is still building a track record to make us truly competitive for the few grants that do cover general operating costs.

This Is Where You Come In

CA+T needs your help to pay our ordinary bills so that we can keep bringing you amazing art—like Jenifer K. Wofford’s Nurses—and scholarship—like Martin Manalansan’s essay about “the smelly immigrant”; original commissioned works, like Kat Larsen’s Deception Pass and Jeffrey Augustine Songco’s Confessional; the thought provoking DIALOGUES series, including Beyond the Horizon of Death? about the devastation of Haiyan; and the artists’ residencies, like Kim Alidio and Ronaldo Wilson’s incredible posts meditating on their projects.

Funding Will Go Towards

Operational costs (the services that keep CA+T up and running)

  • Staff wages and editorial, web, and curatorial consultant fees
  • Subscription fees for Vimeo Pro, ISSUU, Soundcloud, Dropbox, and web hosting that enable CA+T to present materials online in a range of media
  • Online and print advertising and publicity
  • CA+T’s lawyer and accountant fees
  • Online bookkeeping and fax services
  • CA+T’s payroll service
  • Permissions costs to republish articles on CA+T’s website
  • Printing, shipping, and postage costs

Expenses associated with CA+T’s special projects

  • Equipment (projector, screens) for offline exhibits
  • Installation and space fees for physical venues
  • Honoraria and travel funds to support artists and scholars speaking at public events
  • Special print editions of the DIALOGUES series and for other future projects
  • Other limited-run CA+T productions (works on paper, photographic prints, publications).

And check out the perks!

That column to your right is comprised of amazing creative writing, scholarly monographs, edited collections, subscriptions, and original works of art. Indeed, we would not be exaggerating to say that it represents a catalog of some of the most exciting work in Filipino, Filipino American, and Asian American fields today, from both established and emerging scholars and artists. 

So, at the very least, browse the list to see what’s new. You can see images of the contributions on this page and in the Gallery (tab at top), and you can learn more about most contributors and items by checking out the contributor profile on CA+T’s website. If you choose to donate, not only will your donation support CA+T’s mission to bring artists, scholars and the broader public into conversation, you’ll be bringing that conversation home. (Shipping is included in the amount of the donation.)

We are overwhelmed by the generosity of the organizations and contributors who have donated items—books, subscriptions, art works—to tempt you and to thank you for your support. Before we go any further, a big shout out to everyone who made the loot possible.

And remember: all donations are fully tax deductible, and you will receive an official receipt for your tax records.

[A teeny note: some of us are upset because we can’t format titles properly or include links in the Perks descriptions. Please know that it hurts us too.]

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share our Indiegogo campaign link: every link shared through social media can potentially generate over $10 in additional donations.

  • Tell your friends, family and colleagues about CA+T: not only might they donate, but they’ll learn about an awesome cultural resource. New users grow our community.

We Thank You for Your Support!
story_txt:
Who We AreThe Center for Art and Thought is a web-based arts and education 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization. From our web platform <www.centerforartandthought.org>, winner of 2013 Horizon Interactive and 2014 AVA Digital Awards, we take the Philippines and Filipinos as a point of departure for thinking culture globally. A site where global processes like colonialism, migration, and globalization come together, the Philippines is an ideal starting point for understanding pressing contemporary global issues, from labor migration to environmental crises. CA+T’s virtual platform presents creative and scholarly works exploring these questions through four cornerstone programs: 1) Curated Exhibitions, 2) Commissioned Works, 3) a DIALOGUES series of moderated, thematically-driven conversations, and 4) a one-of-a-kind Artist-in-Residence Virtual Residency program.Why We’re Fundraising HereCA+T relies on a small, dedicated team to plan, coordinate and execute its online and offline programming, and all this programming requires money.  From the subscriptions that enable us to host a variety of media to developing partnerships with organizations to 
present exhibitions and artist and scholar talks, we’re doing a lot on a shoestring. We’re applying for grants wherever we can, but many grants exclude the day-to-day operational costs that keep CA+T running and vibrant: the website fees and subscriptions, staff salaries, printing and postage, publicity. And, as a young organization, CA+T is still building a track record to make us truly competitive for the few grants that do cover general operating costs.This Is Where You Come InCA+T needs your help to pay our ordinary bills so that we can keep bringing you amazing art—like Jenifer K. Wofford’s Nurses—and scholarship—like Martin Manalansan’s essay about “the smelly immigrant”; original commissioned works, like Kat Larsen’s Deception Pass and Jeffrey Augustine Songco’s Confessional; the thought provoking DIALOGUES series, including Beyond the Horizon of Death? about the devastation of Haiyan; and the artists’ residencies, like Kim Alidio and Ronaldo Wilson’s incredible posts meditating on their projects.Funding Will Go TowardsOperational costs (the services that keep CA+T up and running)
Staff wages and editorial, web, and curatorial consultant fees
Subscription fees for Vimeo Pro, ISSUU, Soundcloud, Dropbox, and web hosting that enable CA+T to present materials online in a range of media
Online and print advertising and publicity
CA+T’s lawyer and accountant fees
Online bookkeeping and fax services
CA+T’s payroll service
Permissions costs to republish articles on CA+T’s website
Printing, shipping, and postage costs
Expenses associated with CA+T’s special projects
Equipment (projector, screens) for offline exhibits
Installation and space fees for physical venues
Honoraria and travel funds to support artists and scholars speaking at public events
Special print editions of the DIALOGUES series and for other future projects
Other limited-run CA+T productions (works on paper, photographic prints, publications).
And check out the perks!
That column to your right is comprised of amazing creative writing, scholarly monographs, edited collections, subscriptions, and original works of art. Indeed, we would not be exaggerating to say that it represents a catalog of some of the most exciting work in Filipino, Filipino American, and Asian American fields today, from both established and emerging scholars and artists. So, at the very least, browse the list to see what’s new. You can see images of the contributions on this page and in the Gallery (tab at top), and you can learn more about most contributors and items by checking out the contributor profile on CA+T’s website. If you choose to donate, not only will your donation support CA+T’s mission to bring artists, scholars and the broader public into conversation, you’ll be bringing that conversation home. (Shipping is included in the amount of the donation.)







We are overwhelmed by the generosity of the organizations and contributors who have donated items—books, subscriptions, art works—to tempt you and to thank you for your support. Before we go any further, a big shout out to everyone who made the loot possible. And remember: all donations are fully tax deductible, and you will receive an official receipt for your tax records.

























[A teeny note: some of us are upset because we can’t format titles properly or include links in the Perks descriptions. Please know that it hurts us too.]Other Ways You Can Help
Share our Indiegogo campaign link: every link shared through social media can potentially generate over $10 in additional donations.
Tell your friends, family and colleagues about CA+T: not only might they donate, but they’ll learn about an awesome cultural resource. New users grow our community.
We Thank You for Your Support!

story:
This project was successfully funded and the book is a reality! Thank you for your support. You can now buy the book here! https://www.etsy.com/shop/dogwoodillustration

This illustrated alphabet started as a personal passion project. As my work started becoming more and more digital/graphic design focused, I found myself yearning to get back to my traditional artist roots. Combining my love for typography, illustration, and animals was a no-brainer – but little did I know, this labor of love would take years to complete!

This alphabet series has been five years in the making. Partially because "life happens," but also because each piece was time-consuming to hand-draw in high detail. The result is a collection of beautiful animals, each representing a different letter in the English alphabet. I'm so excited to share it with you!

As I was creating the artwork, I dreamed of the day I would turn them into a children's book – Animals from A to Z. With each animal featured, there are several fun facts, each with a small illustration of their own!

It's also been a dream of mine to use the book to raise money for animal welfare. Over these five years, I've become more and more interested in the way we treat the animals we share this planet with. So after a lot of research, I've decided to donate 100% of profits to The Humane League, a global nonprofit working to end the abuse of farmed animals – the most abused animals in the world.

The Perks will be fulfilled well before the December holiday season. 

 

The funding will directly go to printing the Perks, shipping, and associated fees. I will not take one penny! 100% of profits will be donated. The higher the quantity of orders, the lower the print cost per item will be – and the more we can give to the animals! I will be working tirelessly to keep these expenses down to maximize the donation.

The artwork is available as individual letter prints (two sizes), a full alphabet poster, and of course, the book! There are also some mini stickers available, with pro-sustainability designs. All items are printed on environmentally friendly papers (no plastic/vinyl).

To see all the letters in close-up detail, visit the Instagram page.

 

Each animal's spread includes some basic facts about them (average weight, lifespan, habitat, etc) – as well as six fun facts with unique sketch illustrations for each!

Each copy will be hand-signed by the artist (me!) inside the front cover – Own a special, first edition of the book. The book will be tough, with thick paper to protect it from little hands. The pages and covers will be satin-coated for a soft touch, yet durable, finish.

The book all comes down to this:

BEAUTY
See the magnificent animal world through detailed, colorful, hand-drawn illustrations.

DISCOVERY
Learn fun facts about these amazing, diverse species, from the biggest bears to the smallest fish!

LOVE
Deepen your knowledge and respect for the animals we share our planet with!

 

The entire collection of letters comes together gorgeously on this 18x24" poster. Perfect for a nursery, kid's room, or if you're me – prominently displayed in an office! The "alphabet" concept is youthful enough for little ones, while the art style is mature enough for all ages to enjoy for a lifetime. The paper is matte finish, in absolutely stunning print quality. The colors are vibrant and gorgeous in-person.

The wide range of colors in the poster means it will flatter almost any decor or color scheme!

 

Hang your child's initials/name above their bed, display your family's initials on the mantle, or maybe just send your octopus-obsessed friend a letter O!

You can have any letter as a 5x7" or 11x14" print! Like the poster, these are printed on uncoated (matte) paper, in gorgeous vibrant color. The stock is thick, recycled, and perfect for framing.

Because Indiegogo doesn't allow you to leave a message for me at checkout, and listing a unique Perk for each of the 26 letters would be total chaos, please be sure to send me a direct message after you check out to let me know what letters you want! If you are unable or uncomfortable with sending a message through Indiegogo, please email me: kate@dogwooddesignillustration.com. I'll make sure you get the letters you asked for!

 

These 2" paper stickers are an adorable way to flaunt your sustainable self. Please note, they are paper, not vinyl (no new plastic!) – so while they are quite durable, they won't be waterproof.

 

Printer Highlight

I'll be using IndigoInk for the prints, posters, and stickers. They are local to me (to eliminate shipping cost), affordable, and use low eco-impact printing techniques. The book printer will be Mixam, who also promotes minimal environmental impact printing, and small quantities if needed – so we can get this book printed even if orders are low.

Sustainable Shipping

I will make every effort to reduce waste when packing and shipping the Perks. If you receive any plastic packing material, it will be because I am recycling it from my collection (saving it from the landfill! – yes... I hoard packing material). No new plastic will be purchased for shipping, only paper if needed.

 

Your contribution will make a difference. Beyond helping me fulfill my dreams of completing this book, you'll help donate as much as possible to The Humane League. I know there are many, many good places to contribute your money with all that is going on in the world – so I am very appreciative of your support. The more books that are sold, the cheaper they are to print, which means there will be more profit per book that can be donated.

My personal track record: I have years of experience ordering printed materials and cutting costs associated with these orders. At the end of the campaign, I will gather final estimates and negotiate cost based on the final number of Perks ordered. For items printed by IndigoInk, I have already ordered proofs (samples) of each Perk to verify their gorgeous quality. I have also been running an Etsy shop for years, so I am comfortable with packing & shipping orders!

 

It's Ready to Go!

The artwork is 100% complete, files are prepped, printers are at the ready. All I need is the funding to hit "submit!" No challenges anticipated here.

Production

The Perks will be printed even if the funding goal is not met, because the printers allow for small quantity printing (meaning this is a "flexible" campaign). Both printers have excellent customer service and I don't anticipate any problems with production.

Delivery

The goal to have all Perks delivered before the December holiday season is very reasonable. The printing turnaround for all Perks will only be about one to two weeks after the campaign ends at the end of October. This gives me plenty of time to receive the Perks, verify their quality, and pack & ship well before mid-December. 

COVID-19 Delays

In our current world, there is always the possibility that coronavirus will slow things down in some way, most likely the mail. I'll do everything I can to prevent this, but if any delay comes up, you'll be the first to know.

Possible Perks Confusion

The way that Indiegogo handles Perks may be a bit confusing for some. Please see below if you are unfamiliar:

  1. Choose one Perk and go to checkout (ex. a Poster)
  2. Swipe to see the multiple Add-Ons available. You can add any available options to your cart. Some options may add a couple bucks to your shipping cost due to weight.
  3. Check out!
  4. If you ordered a letter print, please remember to let me know your chosen letters! After you check out, you can either....
    • Send me a direct message through Indiegogo
    • Or, send me an email here: kate@dogwooddesignillustration.com

If anyone has any questions or needs clarifications, my door is open – feel free to message or leave a comment here!

 

If you, like so many, have been affected by the pandemic and can't financially contribute at this time, there are other ways to support!

Spread the word!

If you want to help raise funds for The Humane League, or just enjoy the artwork and know someone else who would too, please share this campaign! You never know who may be interested – some people like to get their holiday shopping done early :)

You can follow along on Instagram at @dogwooddesignillustration – an easy way to spread the word would be to share posts to your stories.

If you are interested in The Humane League, you can follow them too: @thehumaneleague!

Kate Rodman

Hi there! – I’m a graphic designer and illustrator from Maryland. My specialty lies in brand design, especially when using illustration to strengthen those concepts. There’s really nothing else I’d rather be doing than putting together a gorgeous brand – large, medium, or small. The way that illustration can transform an abstract concept into something tangible, real, and visual will always enchant me!

Personally, I’ve always had a strong interest in the natural world and animals since I was a kid. As I’ve gotten older, that wonder has only gotten stronger. It wasn’t until I became an adult that I realized how well being vegan meshed with these values, and how important it was for me to “walk the talk” and remove animal suffering from my life. Now I couldn't imagine it any other way! My personal work usually revolves around these concepts.

story:
SAVE THIRD SPACE!

Our lease at 946 Olive Drive is ending unexpectedly on April 20th due to a change in property owners and we urgently need your help to raise funds and find a new home to save Third Space so we can continue being a positive impact for Davis and the surrounding area.

Third Space has become an integral part of our community for the past three and a half years.  It has become one of the main venues for local emerging artists to create and showcase their work and has been the jumping off point for many musicians and creatives in our community.

We have hosted over 175 music shows, 32 art shows, 92 workshops, 41 theater events, 29 poetry and storytelling events, and 70 other general events. In total we have served over 15,000 people. We are currently home to 45 artists and musicians and in total have been home to over 100 artists since 2013.

We are an inclusive space where members of the Davis community come together to share ideas, stories, make music, learn new skills, collaborate, experience art, and connect with others. It is a vital part of the Davis spirit, and we are now asking you to help us stay a part of our community.

WHAT’S HAPPENING
We will be moving out of our current building at 946 Olive Drive by April 20th, with currently no future home.  We do not want this to be the end of Third Space BUT in order to continue, we need funding and a new building to move our tools and materials into a new space, put in a down payment or cover the deposit and rent in a new place and then start to rebuild our studios and venue.

TESTIMONIALS
Let us know why you think Third Space is important to the Davis community and beyond.
http://www.thirdspacedavis.com/community/

HOW YOU CAN HELP
We need money to cover the cost of moving our materials and equipment, to help cover the cost of a deposit on a new place, and to cover the cost of rebuilding in a new space.  Whether we are able to move into a new place (and where it will be) depends on you.  Here’s the breakdown of costs below.

WHAT WE NEED
We can offer tax deductible receipts for your donations, large and small, for small businesses, corporations, and individuals.

  • $16,000 - First 4 months of rent.
  • $1,000 - First 4 months of utilities.
  • $220 - First 4 months of Insurance
  • $4,000 - Deposit on new building.
  • $5,000 - Transportation and temporary storage of our tools and supplies.
  • $16,000 - Art studio construction materials and labor costs.
  • $6,000 - Fire Safety Improvements and Permits
  • $2,000 - Other Expenses

HOW YOU CAN HELP

  • Make a donation here.
  • Buy Third Space merchandise.
  • Spread the word on social media and email.
  • Know of an affordable building in Davis? Help us find a new home!
  • Have a huge storage area in or near Davis? Let us temporarily store our stuff.
  • Donate stuff we can sell at the next Davis Flea Market. (we’ll take almost anything)
  • Help us clean and move during our last month in our building. Contact us.
  • Are you a lawyer or know of one? We need legal help.

SHIRT AND TOTE BAG OPTIONS

1) Third Space Logo

2) Sacred City

3) (P)Resident Evil (Black and White Only)

Third Space Art Collective is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a nonprofit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Third Space Art Collective will be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
IMPORTANT UPDATE INFO FOR THOSE AFRAID OF BLIND BUY

All full-size bottle purchases will include a matching sample to try before opening the full-size bottle, so you can discover the fragrance on your skin. If the fragrance is not for you we offer free returns within 30 days of the original delivery date, free of charge. But keep in mind the price. If you want to buy a full-size bottle after crowdfunding you won't benefit from the reduced price anymore.

______________________________________

My name is Oliver Valverde and I'm the founder, perfumer and creative art director of avant-garden lab., an independent perfume brand I founded in 2010. 

www.avantgarden-lab.com

For those who know my work as a perfumer you may noticed how much I love the use of pure natural ingredients combined with extraordinary man-made aroma molecules.

I will never stop producing the highest quality most groundbreaking scents for people who crave something authentic, radically avant-garde, and tremendously wearable. 

This collection is not an exception. Each of these 4 new fragrance formulas include heavy doses of flower absolutes such as tuberose abs., jasmine sambac abs., jasmine grandiflorum abs, cassie flower abs., and one of the most loved raw material for any perfumer: orris butter.

​I need finnancial support for the production and launching of this collection. By supporting this you will help me to make these fragrances come alive.

Retail price vs Crowdfunding price (50ml bottles):

IR1S x TR0P1C4L - 170€ vs 90€

TUB3R0SE x F1G - 140€ vs 80€

J4SM1NE x CAL4MUS - 130€ vs 70€

C4SS1E x AMB3RNYL - 130€ vs 70€

There are many differents perks to choose (50ml bottles, 16ml bottles, Samples Set, etc.) 

You will also help me to continue creating new thrilling fragrances, as I probably will use the crowdfunding method for new launchings, making all of you part of my work as an olfactory artist. 

  • All the funds will go for production, raw materials, manufacturing, filling, labelling, packaging, certificates) and a new photoghraphy campaign. 
  • Even if avant-garden lab. doesn't make the total goal amount, I will receive the funds and  move forward with launching Mutant Flowers collection.

 

 

AWARDS: 

Oliver Valverde won 2 perfumery Awards

  • AMBERGREEN has been awarded with the Duftstars 2017 for the ¨Best Artistic Independent Perfume” by The Fragrance Foundation, Germany.
  • M.O.U.S.S.E II has been awarded with the Best of Beauty 2015 for the ¨Best Fragrance” by Allure, Russia.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP ME:

  • Share this campaign with fragrance lovers, beauty editors, friends and family.
  • Make an additional contribution by clicking BACK IT 

 

Thank you for your support! 

Oliver 

www.avantgarden-lab.com

OLIVER'S BIOGRAPHY 

Oliver Valverde is the founder, perfume designer and creative director of avant-garden lab. (formerly known as Oliver & Co. before the rebranding which has been launched in July 2020).

He is well renowned for his unique creative artistic approach in perfume creation, specially about synesthesia (vision to smell). 

Independent fragrance designer Oliver Valverde is known as an outsider in the perfumery world. Since he was a child he has been fascinated with scientific laboratories and nature. Despite his lack of formal training in the perfumery field and not imposing himself any creative limits, Oliver started to experiment with both natural and synthetic elements, combined with innovative, creative concepts to transform them into a new feature: unconventional fragrances that transcend time and trends. Through this creative mindset, into his creations, Oliver translates his vision of perfumery today: always breaking the codes from an olfactive to a visual point of view. Scents are astonishing, designs and graphics remain unique. There is no gender limits. A whole art portfolio for people expecting a brand to go beyond the standards of perfumery offering.

“Perfumery is an art, but an art expression that seems to be increasing corrupted by the mass and niche market. I’m here to get back to the traditional art of fragrance creation, with my own avant-garde touch of course.”  – Oliver Valverde
story_txt:
IMPORTANT UPDATE INFO FOR THOSE AFRAID OF BLIND BUY
All full-size bottle purchases will include a matching sample to try before opening the full-size bottle, so you can discover the fragrance on your skin. If the fragrance is not for you we offer free returns within 30 days of the original delivery date, free of charge. But keep in mind the price. If you want to buy a full-size bottle after crowdfunding you won't benefit from the reduced price anymore.
______________________________________
My name is Oliver Valverde and I'm the founder, perfumer and creative art director of avant-garden lab., an independent perfume brand I founded in 2010. 
www.avantgarden-lab.com
For those who know my work as a perfumer you may noticed how much I love the use of pure natural ingredients combined with extraordinary man-made aroma molecules.
I will never stop producing the highest quality most groundbreaking scents for people who crave something authentic, radically avant-garde, and tremendously wearable. 
This collection is not an exception. Each of these 4 new fragrance formulas include heavy doses of flower absolutes such as tuberose abs., jasmine sambac abs., jasmine grandiflorum abs, cassie flower abs., and one of the most loved raw material for any perfumer: orris butter.
​I need finnancial support for the production and launching of this collection. By supporting this you will help me to make these fragrances come alive.
Retail price vs Crowdfunding price (50ml bottles):
IR1S x TR0P1C4L - 170€ vs 90€
TUB3R0SE x F1G - 140€ vs 80€
J4SM1NE x CAL4MUS - 130€ vs 70€
C4SS1E x AMB3RNYL - 130€ vs 70€
There are many differents perks to choose (50ml bottles, 16ml bottles, Samples Set, etc.) 
You will also help me to continue creating new thrilling fragrances, as I probably will use the crowdfunding method for new launchings, making all of you part of my work as an olfactory artist. 

All the funds will go for production, raw materials, manufacturing, filling, labelling, packaging, certificates) and a new photoghraphy campaign. 
Even if avant-garden lab. doesn't make the total goal amount, I will receive the funds and  move forward with launching Mutant Flowers collection.

story:
What is POMADA?

It is a queer culture festival which takes place in Warsaw.

It is an independent initiative organized by artists, curators, producers, enthusiasts of nonheteronormative mazes of human desire and anyone who wants to participate.

It includes exhibitions, performances, concerts, film screenings and parties.

What do we do?

Since 2010 we have been inviting people to nonheteronormative meetings. We discuss the body, sexuality, alternative family concepts, functioning in the public sphere, the media, queer spirituality. POMADA is created thanks to the combined efforts of many volunteers as well as organizations and institutions, which support the initiative through their involvement.

This year the slogan EDEN takes us to queer utopias and secret strategies of survival; to the place of collective actions, resistance and escapist oblivion.

POMADA will take us to a place where harmony reigns and sin was born.

Our goal is to raise funds necessary to create an art program which will stand out against heteronormative art events organized in Poland – mainly exhibitions at public institutions and art galleries. Currently, it is difficult to find at least one cultural proposition which would be openly queer.

Help us organise 4 queer nights of FREE art events in Warsaw this October!

What will POMADA 8 include?

This year, all POMADA events will take place in one location, space that will become a queer EDEN for 4 amazing nights. 

We will invite our audience to an exhibition presenting video art, photography, sculpture, installations and paintings. The exhibition space will also host works that are more ephemeral, like choreography pieces, performance art, improvisations and fragments, as well as fashion experiments. We will take a closer look both at the individual as well as collective practices. 

Each night will offer a unique program: premiere film screenings, performances, concerts and DJ sets. We want to create a space where we can meet and get to know each other.  

EDEN, as a metaphor of a garden of life, is swollen with meanings and possibilities for interpretations. Its borders go from queer utopias to secret survival strategies in times when movements discriminating sexual and ethnic minorities become more and more radical. 

We will explore artistic practices and these going beyond art: individual and wild collective actions, alternative forms of resistance and expressing discontent.  

EDEN is also a fantasy of our own independent identity: more or less precisely defined, in constant transition, outside of norms, holy and sinful at the same time. 

Participants:

Szymon Adamczak, Anti Gonna, Alex Baczyński- Jenkins, Anatoly Bielov, Michał Borczuch i Dominika Biernat, Bracia, Dom Mody Limanka, Christa Joo Hyun D'Angelo, Christopher Füllemann, Martyna Gart, Krzysztof Gil, Aleksandra Jakubczak and Marta Konarzewska, Libuše Jarcovjáková, Agata Kalinowska, Kem, Ryszard Kisiel, Mihail Koptev, Maldoror, Jan Możdżyński, Krzysztof Niemczyk, Liliana Piskorska, Karol Radziszewski, Aldona Relaks, Łukasz Rusznica, Sebulec, Anton Shebetko

Why is organizing POMADA so important now?

The situation in Poland hasn't changed since our last Pomada edition, it is rather getting worst. The country is governed by a populist-rightist party, which has been continuously attempting at curtailing civil rights. The government is trying to exert pressure on NGOs, threatening their existence, which directly affects the LGBTQ community in terms of both legal regulations and their well-being. It causes us great concern to see growing consent for hate speech in the public sphere, most often targeted against minorities. At the same time, the authorities have been making attempts to manipulate history, writing it anew, with voices of nonheteronormative individuals or movements being not so much marginalized, as completely ignored. In the current situation, we can’t really count on official funding for cultural events which openly tackle queer or feminist issues – that is why it is so crucial, in this difficult time for Poland, to support each other.

What will we do with the money?

The funds which you will provide will - first and foremost - allow us to cover the travel and accommodation expenses of artists coming from outside of Warsaw and the costs of the organization of the exhibition and the accompanying events (transportation, printing posters and flyers, promotion, set design, equipment rental). Apart from barter support provided by cultural institutions, POMADA does not have any budget. It is a non-profit festival which offers FREE access to all of its cultural events. Without your help, the beautiful and strong POMADA will have to be significantly scaled down. 

What else can you do?

We will also appreciate any non-financial form of promotional support – share our campaign with your acquaintances and friends, LGBTQ people and anyone queer-friendly. If we collect more money, we will use it to organize POMADA 9 next year.

 Let’s unite and meet in EDEN !

 

http://www.pomadapomada.pl

https://www.facebook.com/PomadaFestival

https://www.instagram.com/pomadafestival/

story:
The Dreamer's Arcana is a 36-card, non-traditional arcana deck that takes its inspiration from dream logic and fantasy. It explores facets of the tarot that are rarely highlighted in traditional decks, and invites the reader to step off the beaten path and into the wilds of imagination.

The Dreamer's Arcana is textless and numberless, allowing readers to use their preferred names and order when working with it. All cards in the Dreamer's Arcana share the same reversible back, and artwork is borderless.

Thanks to the stretchgoals unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign, the deck currently contains 14 alternate art cards. These explore different facets of the same major cards, and allow you the flexibility to choose which representation you prefer (or to expand your major arcana to include additional cards!)

The current plan is to add an additional 8 alternate art cards to the deck, bringing the Dreamer's Arcana up to a full double major arcana deck, allowing for a variety of unique spreads and reading techniques, plus full flexibility in how you use the deck for regular readings.

The Dreamer's Arcana will be printed at 3"x4.25", which is a size in between the traditional Tarot card and the standard 'oversized' deck. This size is perfect for showcasing the brilliant artwork, while still being a very comfortable size for shuffling and handling the deck.

The Dreamer's Arcana will be printed on glossy 330gsm black core cardstock, and will also include a detailed guidebook, containing Apolline's artwork in full colour and an exploration of every card in the deck (including the alternate art cards).

Every copy of the Dreamer's Arcana will also come with a digital version of the guidebook.

Apolline is a French illustrator with a strong taste for fantasy and otherworldly art, and a particular talent for stunning landscapes and outlandish characters. She currently lives in Scotland, and specializes in board games, card games and children's book illustration.

You may recognise her artwork from the boardgames Muse, Borders of Kanta and Wreck Raiders, amongst other projects.

If you would like to see more of Apolline's work, please check out her Instagram or her Facebook page.

Liliana is an Australian creator, who has always been fascinated by the patterns and symbolism of the tarot. Her first deck was an original copy of The Mythic Tarot (which probably explains her attraction to nontraditional decks). The Dreamer's Arcana is her first tarot project, which she hopes to expand into a full 78-card tarot with complete minor suits.

You can follow her projects (including the Dreamer's Arcana) on her Instagram.

story:
So, Should Children Use Fountain Pens from the Age of 10?

Over the years, there have been many debates on whether children should use fountain pens or not, when they transition from pencil usage. Many parents have asked me this question and I realized my answers were average at best. So I decided to get my hands dirty and do some research and educate myself and parents who wish to do what’s best for their children.

When I started speaking to parents and teachers I realized that there are distinctly two schools of thought. Some people who are pro-fountain pens claim it helps improve handwriting and others seem to say ball-pens, micro-tips and gel pens work just fine in this day and age of advanced writing technology. Of late some educators and parents have completely discounted the importance of handwriting in the age of technology. Now who is right?

My family business has been in the fountain pen ink, fountain pens, ball pens, stationery, early-childhood education products, balance bikes and other baby & children’s products space for over 54-years now. Today we are one of the very few companies that still manufactures high-quality, hand-mixed, water and dye-based fountain pen inks using a secret formula that my family has passed down and improved over 3 generations! Yes, in the age of technology, ipads and cell phones we still sell fountain pen ink in India and to fountain pen enthusiasts world-over!  Children and parents love our inks and fountain pens and we have served over 400 million of them over the years! More importantly we have been in the business to Make Living Fun for children and parents, which is our mantra.

We decided that we must research and give customers and backers of our global handwriting movement authentic information so they take informed decisions that will help in overall development of their children. Over the years, we have been following some research globally, spoken to handwriting experts and have also studied various developmental aspects that are beneficial to children and adolescents. As Bril Inc our subsidiary in the US opens operations in 2019, we wanted to bring back the dying art of handwriting into every home in the US and world over with our inks, that have filled fountain pens that cost less than 50 cents to ones that cost more than $1000, over five decades. Our inks are loved by calligraphists and fountain pen connoisseurs in India and world over!

Back to the findings of our research on why we believe children should use traditional fountain pens from the age of 10:

This research has made us come to the conclusion that the use of traditional nib-based fountain pens with high-quality dye based ink is absolutely essential for children transitioning from pencils to pen usage.

Following are the reasons why you should definitely start your children off on fountain pens and not ball pens, gel pens or micro tips, from around 10 years of age (Std. / Grade 5) to at least 16 years (Std. Grade 10):

  • Traditional fountain pens with high-quality nibs allow children to hold the pen in the correct position. This ensures least pressure on a child’s hand and brings about awareness of grip leading to stability of writing in the long run. 

 

  • Holding the pen in one position becomes essential as the flow of ink is optimum (due to abrasion of Nib) in the position used most often by the child. This brings about discipline of grip and makes writing a conscious effort leading to fine motor skills and brain development.

 

  • Good fountain pen ink is less viscous than other inks and offers the best flow under least pressure. Writing for long durations with a fountain pen is much easier than using ball pens and even gel pens for young children transitioning to pen use.

 

  • Handwriting experts and graphologists advocate the importance of handwriting and its link to overall character and personality of a human-being. While there is no direct evidence that fountain pens improve handwriting, we know for sure that it brings about conscious writing and offers the best stability-flow balance for children to develop one stable way to write over the years. While an improvement in handwriting is subjective, fountain pens by-and-large make the written word look more beautiful if children are trained properly to use them. Did you ever wonder why calligraphy pens have fountain-pen-like Nibs? It’s not a coincidence you know.

 

  • Fine motor skills improve. Today the Montessori method of teaching emphasizes the need to write on sand, use chalk etc. among young kids. Similarly children benefit greatly from the mindfulness that is required while using fountain pens, and also from the slight friction when the nib touches paper if they happen to change their grip (knowingly or unknowingly).

 

  • Learning to write with a fountain pen takes practice and this helps children become more patient, write slower and work on this very important life-skill constantly as they go through school. Patience is a virtue that is quickly disappearing in a world of instant-gratification. Research shows delayed gratification during childhood has a direct correlation with success and happiness in adult life.

 

  • Handwriting that is stable and legible will help children communicate what they learn and know to the world better, with ease and confidence. Simply put legible handwriting helps even smart children score more in exams. Fountain pens definitely make children write with more self-awareness, confidence and take pride in their writing. Self-awareness and enjoying one’s work are by-far the most important aspects of education and long-term success in any field.

 

  • Conscious, mindful writing happens best with a fountain pen and this reduces mistakes and scratching. Laying an emphasis on the process and slowly improving the outcome is more important than ever today, as children grow up with Delete, Backspace, Whatsapps and Snapchats. We love technology, and children learn a lot from it, but let us not nurture a generation that only believes in things that gratify instantly and mindless, grammatically incorrect modes of communication.

 

  • It’s more Economical and Environment Friendly! While fountain pens for students cost more than the cheap ball point pens and gel pens, they last for years. One bottle of 60 ml (2.02 Oz) ink lasts anywhere between 6 months and one year. So a small investment takes you a long way and saves families a fair bit of money. Moreover fountain pens are not use-and-throw, so children are forced to keep them carefully and indirectly help in saving the environment. A subtle lesson in valuing what they have and also not contributing to more plastic waste by disposing ball point pens and refills maybe? Our study and talks with parents revealed that on average an Indian student disposes 7 ball-point pens a year! Imagine the plastic waste we can avoid with fountain pens with approximately 1 billion 7-17 year-olds in school (Figure extrapolated from UNESCO's website)!

 

  • It’s Fun! Don’t we all remember swishing and splashing ink on our friends’ shirts using our fountain pens? Anything that aids in playing a fun prank will never go out of fashion with kids! Now if that doesn’t Make Living Fun what will?

Never forget that handwriting is a person’s unique identity, it is an art form and this needs to be nurtured with care and not treated as frivolously as typing. Even the beautiful fonts in our iPads and computers were created by artists who studied calligraphy (Steve Jobs too was inspired by meditation and a calligraphy course he took). There is no substitute to learning an art form, as art is food for the soul and hence if we are to avoid drastic evolutionary rewiring, introduce your children to fountain pens in their formative years (i.e. when their school asks them to transition from pencil to pen or from 10 years of age if you are home-schooling your child).

While we were at it, we realized that over the last 5-6 years, some schools in Europe ( https://www.spectator.co.uk/2015/03/the-return-of-the-fountain-pen/ ) have gone back to making fountain pens compulsory. While embracing the latest gadgets is important, let us not do away with timeless know-how and make our children use traditional fountain pens at least for a few years from the year they transition from pencils to pens.

You will be surprised that schools in many countries still insist on fountain pen usage and that is indeed the way to go, if we truly care about how the art of handwriting helps in developing neural connections and brain-development!  

http://www.fountainpennetwork.com/forum/topic/209860-in-what-locales-are-fountain-pens-still-required-in-school/

Here is a very interesting article in The Economist about the importance of handwriting: https://www.economist.com/science-and-technology/2016/09/06/the-comeback-of-cursive

Backers get to choose from our amazing perks! They get the amazing free-flowing, quick-drying Bril Ink bottles in 7 vibrant colors and fountain pens, in well-packed bubble wrapping for international shipping at discounted prices! Help us spread the word and get children and adults writing properly again!

Deliveries commence February 2019. 

Why the heavy shipping charge? Global shipping of liquids is a real challenge and our inks have been priced super low. Despite that we have kept shipping charges to the bear minimum.

Customs duties and taxes in your country (if applicable) are payable by backers

Good fountain pen ink is less viscous than other inks and offers the best flow under least pressure. Writing for long durations with a fountain pen is much easier than using ball pens and even gel pens for young children transitioning to pen use. 
Handwriting experts and graphologists advocate the importance of handwriting and its link to overall character and personality of a human-being. While there is no direct evidence that fountain pens improve handwriting, we know for sure that it brings about conscious writing and offers the best stability-flow balance for children to develop one stable way to write over the years. While an improvement in handwriting is subjective, fountain pens by-and-large make the written word look more beautiful if children are trained properly to use them. Did you ever wonder why calligraphy pens have fountain-pen-like Nibs? It’s not a coincidence you know. 
Fine motor skills improve. Today the Montessori method of teaching emphasizes the need to write on sand, use chalk etc. among young kids. Similarly children benefit greatly from the mindfulness that is required while using fountain pens, and also from the slight friction when the nib touches paper if they happen to change their grip (knowingly or unknowingly). 
Learning to write with a fountain pen takes practice and this helps children become more patient, write slower and work on this very important life-skill constantly as they go through school. Patience is a virtue that is quickly disappearing in a world of instant-gratification. Research shows delayed gratification during childhood has a direct correlation with success and happiness in adult life. 
Handwriting that is stable and legible will help children communicate what they learn and know to the world better, with ease and confidence. Simply put legible handwriting helps even smart children score more in exams. Fountain pens definitely make children write with more self-awareness, confidence and take pride in their writing. Self-awareness and enjoying one’s work are by-far the most important aspects of education and long-term success in any field. 
Conscious, mindful writing happens best with a fountain pen and this reduces mistakes and scratching. Laying an emphasis on the process and slowly improving the outcome is more important than ever today, as children grow up with Delete, Backspace, Whatsapps and Snapchats. We love technology, and children learn a lot from it, but let us not nurture a generation that only believes in things that gratify instantly and mindless, grammatically incorrect modes of communication. 
It’s more Economical and Environment Friendly! While fountain pens for students cost more than the cheap ball point pens and gel pens, they last for years. One bottle of 60 ml (2.02 Oz) ink lasts anywhere between 6 months and one year. So a small investment takes you a long way and saves families a fair bit of money. Moreover fountain pens are not use-and-throw, so children are forced to keep them carefully and indirectly help in saving the environment. A subtle lesson in valuing what they have and also not contributing to more plastic waste by disposing ball point pens and refills maybe? Our study and talks with parents revealed that on average an Indian student disposes 7 ball-point pens a year! Imagine the plastic waste we can avoid with fountain pens with approximately 1 billion 7-17 year-olds in school (Figure extrapolated from UNESCO's website)! 
It’s Fun! Don’t we all remember swishing and splashing ink on our friends’ shirts using our fountain pens? Anything that aids in playing a fun prank will never go out of fashion with kids! Now if that doesn’t Make Living Fun what will?Never forget that handwriting is a person’s unique identity, it is an art form and this needs to be nurtured with care and not treated as frivolously as typing. Even the beautiful fonts in our iPads and computers were created by artists who studied calligraphy (Steve Jobs too was inspired by meditation and a calligraphy course he took). There is no substitute to learning an art form, as art is food for the soul and hence if we are to avoid drastic evolutionary rewiring, introduce your children to fountain pens in their formative years (i.e. when their school asks them to transition from pencil to pen or from 10 years of age if you are home-schooling your child).While we were at it, we realized that over the last 5-6 years, some schools in Europe ( https://www.spectator.co.uk/2015/03/the-return-of-the-fountain-pen/ ) have gone back to making fountain pens compulsory. While embracing the latest gadgets is important, let us not do away with timeless know-how and make our children use traditional fountain pens at least for a few years from the year they transition from pencils to pens.You will be surprised that schools in many countries still insist on fountain pen usage and that is indeed the way to go, if we truly care about how the art of handwriting helps in developing neural connections and brain-development!  http://www.fountainpennetwork.com/forum/topic/209860-in-what-locales-are-fountain-pens-still-required-in-school/Here is a very interesting article in The Economist about the importance of handwriting: https://www.economist.com/science-and-technology/2016/09/06/the-comeback-of-cursiveBackers get to choose from our amazing perks! They get the amazing free-flowing, quick-drying Bril Ink bottles in 7 vibrant colors and fountain pens, in well-packed bubble wrapping for international shipping at discounted prices! Help us spread the word and get children and adults writing properly again!Deliveries commence February 2019. Why the heavy shipping charge? Global shipping of liquids is a real challenge and our inks have been priced super low. Despite that we have kept shipping charges to the bear minimum.Customs duties and taxes in your country (if applicable) are payable by backers

story: I'm going back to school for computer science/art.  I'm going all out and buying the best laptop I can to have the tools necessary to develop and create art in many forms to help demonstrate what it is like to be depressed. I also want to create LGBTQ and all encompassing games. I want to open eyes and break open minds to teach and help foster empathy in our society for all subjects but I focus on depression and the LGBTQ community.  I need an awesome laptop to handle programming, and games. I'm making 2 video games as of right now. I create 3D objects. I need a powerful laptop for that. I draw, I need a strong laptop for smooth drawings with my wacom tablet. I compose music and need a laptop for production.

story:
Hello and welcome! :)

First, I want to thank you for finding your way to my crowdfunding campaign and for taking your time for reading this.

My name Is Katrin. Better known as @Jarlie86 on social media, like Twitter and Instagram. I'm 28 years old and I live in germany.  I'm an artist and illustrator with all of my heart and I'm working as a freelancer.

I'm an artist since I was able to hold a pencil in my hands and all I've learned about art, I taught myself. I worked for some agencies and as an Art teacher for children. Since a few months, I'm working hard to do my very own thing. I draw and paint portraits, mostly of actors and musicians and started to make products of my Artworks. But I'm also into digital works, children's book illustration, making sculptures and urban art. I like to call myself as an "creative allrounder".

Art is my life, heart and soul and I spend all my time to keep doing what I love and for making my fans, and fans of different fandoms happy. 


What I need

In order to be able to continue growing in my art and to put my creative career as an artist on a new level, there are a few things I need. Because I want to be able, to produce the products (Merchandise) on my own at home. This would change my life completely, because I would be able to create professional products by myself at home. It's really expensive to let companies produce products with your works, and I wouldn't just get percents of any sales, I would get the whole money. I would be able to build up an amazing shop and business with my works. For this I need a 5 in 1 Heat Press (I can use this amazing machine as a T-Shirt press, mug press, cap and plate press.

I can print my works on almost everything. Pillows, phone/tablet/laptop cases, keychains, and many many more!). I also need an electric Vinyl Cutter (for cutting out every design automatically I create. Precise!), a special Printer  for sublimation prints (+ special Ink), Sublimation Paper and heat roles. Together with lots of different blank Sublimation items*, like T-Shirts in different sizes and colors, mugs, keychains, pillows, plates and so on. This starterset, it would give me a 'Kickstart'! 

To get my own business run, I also need a professional Badge machine. My art looks really cute on those badges. I have a small one, only able to create little badges in one size. With the new Badge machine, I would be able to create (needle) badges in four different sizes, plus magnets and even pocket mirrors! I would be in aawww :) For this machine, I will need blank badgets/magnets/mirrors, but they will last for a long time.

The last machine I need is a calendar bind machine. It's really expensive to let companies produce calendars with your designs and with this machine, I would be able to do it at home, professional,by myself. 

You would help me so so much with every cent you spend on my creative career! It would open oppurtunities, I just dreamt since such a long time. I would be able to keep being a freelancer and to do what I love the most: Doing Art.

Overview:

- 5 in 1 Heat Press , A Vinyl Cutter, a special Printer, accesoires, blank sublimation items*, paper, ink  – approximately 2000 euros (including international shipping).

- Professional Badge  machine (+ accesoires) - approximately 400 euros

- Calendar bind machine -  100 euros


What if I don’t reach the target?

I will set the money aside until I have earned enough. I won't use it otherway for sure (why should I ? My dream is to have all these equipment!)


What You Get

    Artworks ! :) I would love to fly to everyone who spend money into my creative future, to give you a big hug, but we all know that it's not possible :)I'm an artist and there's nothing more personal than my Artworks that I can give to you from me. 

    I have different Perks, from 1 Euro up to 500 Euro. From smaller and bigger ArtPrints, up to original artworks and custom drawings (by a ref pic of your choice). I have a lot of Sherlock related Artpieces (Benedict Cumberbatch, Martin Freeman, Amanda Abbington, Mark Gatiss, Andrew Scott, and so on). but also other artists like Ed Sheeran, Samu Haber (Sunrise Avenue), Rea Garvey,...

    All Artworks, prints or original pieces, -won't- come with Watermarks for sure !!

                       ______________________________________________________

                                                   Sherlock Badge Set

        (We call it "Button" in germany. So, yes, they have a needle on the back)

                                             (available for the very first time!)

                                     Sherlock, John, Moriarty, Richard Brook

                       

                       

                   Shipping costs: Germany: 2 Euro, Anywhere Else: 4 Euro

    ____________________________________________________________________________

                             Badge Set "Cumberbatch and CO"

    (Andrew Scott as Jim Moriarty, Benedict Cumberbatch as Alan Turing, Tom Hiddleston, Green Skull)

                 

                    Shipping costs: Germany: 2 Euro, Anywhere Else: 4 Euro

                     ____________________________________________________________

    ArtPrints , size A5  (5.8”x 8.3” / 148 x 210mm) 

    Shipping costs: Germany: 2 Euro, Anywhere Else: 4 Euro

    You can choose 1 of those 5 motives:

                                           

                                                            Benedict Cumberbatch

                                                  (available for the very first time!)

                            

                                        Martin Freeman and Amanda Abbington

                                               as John and Mary Watson (Sherlock)

                           

                                                    Green Skull (Graffiti Style)

                            

                                        Samu Haber (Frontman of Sunrise Avenue)
                                               (available for the very first time!)

                          

                                                                       Rea Garvey
                                                    (available for the very first time!)

    __________________________________________________________________________

    ArtPrints , size A4  (8.3” x 11.7” / 210 x 297mm) Signed by me

      Shipping costs: Germany: 2 Euro, Anywhere Else: 4 Euro

    You can choose 1 of those 5 motives:

           

    Benedict Cumberbatch                                                       Tom Hiddleston

    (as Alan Turing in                                                       (available for the very first time!)

    "The Imitation Game"

      (available for the very first time!)                  

              

                                221B Baktersteet Living room (own concept art by me)

                          

                                            Benedict Cumberbatch as Sherlock Holmes

               

                                                 Andrew Scott as Jim Moriarty (Sherlock)

                      _______________________________________________________________

    Moriarty Fan-Set:

      Shipping costs: Germany: 2 Euro, Anywhere Else: 4 Euro

    -  1 ArtPrint "Moriarty" A4 (8.3” x 11.7” / 210 x 297mm)


    -  1 Bookmark, 2sided (with two charms, a crown and a key)


                               _____________________________________________________

    Mycroft Fan Set 

      Shipping costs: Germany: 2 Euro, Anywhere Else: 4 Euro

    - 1 ArtPrint "Mycroft' A4 (8.3” x 11.7” / 210 x 297mm)


    - 1 Bookmark ( with three Mycroft related charms, like Umbrella, Tea, BigBen, for example).


                                _____________________________________________________
    Sherlock & John / Johnlock Fanset

      Shipping costs: Germany: 2 Euro, Anywhere Else: 4 Euro

    - 1 ArtPrint "Sherlock" A4  (8.3” x 11.7” / 210 x 297mm) signed by me

    - 1 ArtPrint "John" A4 (8.3” x 11.7” / 210 x 297mm) signed by me


    - 1 Bookmark (2sided) with three John/Sherlock related charsm, like a violin, moustache, pistole,...)


    - 2 Buttons


                               ___________________________________________

    My Original Drawing of Ed Sheeran + Certificate (real Artwork, no print)

                      


                    ______________________________________________________

    My Original Drawing of Tom Hiddleston + Certificate (real Artwork, no print) 

                 


                   ______________________________________________________

                       

                             _______________________________________________

    Any extra money received go to more professional online Promotion and Advertising, like promoting my Facebook site and for getting my works 'offline' into magazines, newspaper for example, or for rent a room to do an Art Show. For my customers, I just use the best and finest art supplies. I work a lot with copic markers and professional coloured pencils. My way to paint with copics (especially) portraits is unique and famous by so many people out there. But the Various Ink to refill them, is really pretty expensive. So I would buy more art supplies to keep the quality of my Artworks. Extra money would also get into a new graphic tablet for my digital designs and for other art supplies like acrylics, brushes, portfolio folders, blank skatedecks ( I paint them too), sketchbooks, paper, and so on and so forth.


    Risks & Challenges


    Please keep in mind that creating a custom artwork takes time. I will not be able to ship your drawing within a week of the campaign closing. If you need your drawing for a special date, please ask me before contributing and picking that perk.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please, spread the word ! "Share" and/or "retweet" on  social media. Share it with your friends, your family, and everyone you want to share it with. Also, don't forget to use the IndieGoGo Tool.


                                    !! Thank you - Thank you - Thank you !!

story:
The Why:

In 2015, my sister had her first son. As a gift to him, I painted a watercolor alphabet made of animals. Each animal forms the shape of the letter it represents and is accompanied by a rhythmic word set to encourage reading, vocabulary building, and fun!

 

The How:

My goal is to reach $500. This will cover the first 50 books and shipping costs. The sales from these books will allow me to print more and expand the ABC collection. I have 3 more children alphabet books in the works (and one for adults!)

If you donate $20, you will receive my everlasting appreciation and an autographed copy of the book.

If you donate $50, you will receive my unending gratitude, an autographed copy of the book (with a hand-drawn Critter just for you!), and 3 Critter Letters of your choice printed as greeting cards.

If you donate $100, you will receive my undying love, an autographed copy of the book (with a hand-drawn Critter just for you!), and a Critter Name Print. The Critter Name Print is a 12x36 poster of any name made from the Critter Letters. 

Here is a Critter Name Print for my niece, Sheridan. 

Estimated shipping of books is late October or early November.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello, 

I’m Lynnette Miranda, a visual artist, curator, and writer currently based in New York City and soon-to-be based in Kansas City, MO. I was recently accepted into ACRE, a two-week artist residency in Steuben, WI. Admissions were remarkably competitive with over 790 applications this year for only 80 slots. Please help me attend this amazing residency! 

In Fall 2016, I will be the Curator-in-Residence at Charlotte Street Foundation, where I must produce five exhibitions within 18 months. My goal is to curate exhibitions that balance experimentation, scholarship, and multigenerational engagement while supporting the Kansas City artistic community. Producing this number of original exhibitions through a rigorous approach is daunting. Furthermore, moving halfway across the country is a stressful and expensive endeavor.

At ACRE, I will focus on developing and enacting experimental research strategies for my upcoming curatorial projects, including my first exhibition as the Curator-in-Residence. My research focuses on ‘otherness’ and ‘difference’ beyond identity and representation and considers strategies for collective knowledge building. I hope to produce a series of printed works reflecting and reimagining this research through zines, charts, diagrams, and other printed matter. By joining the ACRE community, I will have time to focus and develop my ideas, while being surrounded by supportive, generative, and critical artists and organizers from across the country.

Please help me get to ACRE! Opportunities like this allow me to grow as an arts professional, and they push me to develop complex ideas and projects. Other programs I have attended or will attend include:

  • Independent Curators International Curatorial Intensive in New Orleans; Fully funded by The kurimanzutto Scholarship for Latin American Curators
  • OxBow School of Art and Residency; Fully funded by the Latinx Artist Visibility Award
  • Little Paper Planes + Residency; Free studio space in San Francisco

Learn more about my work at www.lynnettemiranda.com
Learn more about ACRE at www.acreresidency.org

 

WHAT I NEED

I'm humbly asking for $1,100, which will assist me with the following:

  • $600 ACRE Residency Fee -- includes room, board, food, and studio facilities.
  • $200 Studio Materials -- screening printing inks, specialty printmaking paper; mylar; tracing paper; specialty drawing and mark-making materials.
  • $200 Travel Expenses -- to Steuben, WI (2 hrs from Madison, WI)
  • $100 IndieGOGO fees -- This campaign will cost me 10% of all contributions.

I was recently accepted into ACRE, a two-week artist residency in Steuben, WI. Admissions were remarkably competitive with over 790 applications this year for only 80 slots. Please help me attend this amazing residency! 
In Fall 2016, I will be the Curator-in-Residence at Charlotte Street Foundation, where I must produce five exhibitions within 18 months. My goal is to curate exhibitions that balance experimentation, scholarship, and multigenerational engagement while supporting the Kansas City artistic community. Producing this number of original exhibitions through a rigorous approach is daunting. Furthermore, moving halfway across the country is a stressful and expensive endeavor.
At ACRE, I will focus on developing and enacting experimental research strategies for my upcoming curatorial projects, including my first exhibition as the Curator-in-Residence. My research focuses on ‘otherness’ and ‘difference’ beyond identity and representation and considers strategies for collective knowledge building. I hope to produce a series of printed works reflecting and reimagining this research through zines, charts, diagrams, and other printed matter. By joining the ACRE community, I will have time to focus and develop my ideas, while being surrounded by supportive, generative, and critical artists and organizers from across the country.
Please help me get to ACRE! Opportunities like this allow me to grow as an arts professional, and they push me to develop complex ideas and projects. Other programs I have attended or will attend include:

Independent Curators International Curatorial Intensive in New Orleans; Fully funded by The kurimanzutto Scholarship for Latin American Curators
OxBow School of Art and Residency; Fully funded by the Latinx Artist Visibility Award
Little Paper Planes + Residency; Free studio space in San Francisco 

Learn more about my work at www.lynnettemiranda.comLearn more about ACRE at www.acreresidency.org
 

WHAT I NEED
I'm humbly asking for $1,100, which will assist me with the following:

$600 ACRE Residency Fee -- includes room, board, food, and studio facilities.
$200 Studio Materials -- screening printing inks, specialty printmaking paper; mylar; tracing paper; specialty drawing and mark-making materials.
$200 Travel Expenses -- to Steuben, WI (2 hrs from Madison, WI)
$100 IndieGOGO fees -- This campaign will cost me 10% of all contributions.

story:
**Update

Thank you to all of our contributors and everyone that has helped spread the word for the Playa Moon fundraiser! We are just over 50% funded, and on track to meet our goal in the last week of our campaign. There are a few new perks to check out, and we are putting together some surprise thank you packages for the 3 funders who refer the most people to the campaign (see details below), and for the last 10 people to donate.

We are excited to bring Playa Moon to the burn this year (she’ll be located at 7:30 & J), and need your help to share the details with our larger community and social groups.

We’ve added a few new perks, and upgrades.

1) $200 – personal graffiti – we will create a piece of  original graffiti art on our firehouse structure at the burn, and send you a photo of the finished work.

2) $100 – custom cocktail - Have a custom cocktail created and named after you. We will serve it at the Do-More-Now bar on playa, and even send you the recipe!

3) $45 – Monthly Do-More-Now motivational emails. Each month receive a new email with a Do-More-Now motivational saying or quote to keep you motivated until next Burning Man!

4) Update to the Full Monty – Sticker, thank you from playa, t-shirt, boyshorts, monthly motivational emails, custom cocktail and personal graffiti.

5) Thank you for Sharing – Use the sharing buttons on the page (http://igg.me/at/playamoon), and we will track the number of visitors from your link. The top 3 referrers  will receive a special token of our appreciation!

6) Last 10 – The last 10 contributors to the campaign will receive a special thank you package.

Thank you again!

Chad and the whole crew of Do-More-Now



What is Playa Moon?

Playa Moon is a 65’ spherical projection screen. Each night of Burning Man the Playa Moon will be inflated, rising from the desert floor to cast a 6-story hypnotic combination of lights and images that will be visible across the playa.

Do-More-Now is a camp of experienced Burners with a multi-year proven track record of bringing innovative, inspiring, and larger than life projects to Burning Man including the 5-story Firehouse, Cervantes, Starlight, Escher, the 2,500 ft2 Escher Puzzle, and the Clown Shoe. This year the team is bringing Playa Moon to light up the desert night.

Bringing Playa Moon to Burning Man 2015

As with any grand plan, bringing Play Moon to Burning Man requires vision, elbow grease, a bunch of crazy people, and, of course a certain amount of money. The team has already procured the structure, pumps and basic anchors, but is looking to raise funds for additional costs and considerations. These include:

Transport & Fuel

o  The Playa Moon with all of assorted accessories requires a truck and a trailer to move it 700 miles to the playa and back again.

o  We will also need fuel for the pumps to make Playa Moon rise. Estimated transportation and fuel costs: $1,500.

Anchoring

o  An inflatable this size requires a very heavy duty additional anchoring system to ensure the Playa Moon stays exactly where we put it. Estimated anchoring costs: $1,500.

Lights & Projection

o  Additional lighting and controls to create a hypnotic light show.

Stretch Goals & Flexible Funding

The basics are nice, but we’ve set a few stretch goals for this project.

Stretch Goal 1: If we exceed our initial goal, we will add basic projectors and project images onto the sphere.

Stretch Goal 2: This is the goal for reaching our ultimate vision. Adding even more lights and higher quality projection to create stunning coordinated effects and video treatments sure to inspire even the crustiest of Burners.

Flexible Funding: In the event that we do not meet our initial goal, funds will be used first to fulfill perks, and subsidize safety & transport costs. Any amount raised above those costs will go to fuel and lighting.

Initial Target

Transport $1,500

Anchoring $1,500

Lights $500

Perk Fulfillment $500

Misc.Fees & Contingency $500

Total $4,500

---------------------------------

Stretch Goal 1

Level 1 - Expenses $4,500

4 x Standard Projectors $2,000

Perk Fulfillment $250

Misc Fees & Contingency $500

Total $7,250

--------------------------------

Stretch Goal 2

Level 1   Expenses $4,500

5 x Hi-Quality Projectors $5,000

Controller Software $1,000

Perk Fulfillment $650

Misc. fees & Contingency $500

Total $11,650

The Fun(ds) Stuff

Contributors to Playa Moon Rising get to bask in the knowledge that they helped bring this unique project to the playa. We’ll maintain a list of contributors on our website so you can see your name in lights (let us know if you’d prefer to remain anonymous, that’s also cool). In addition, contributions at $10 or above will receive some super-cool items of swag.

$1 – $5 Our Heartfelt Thanks – The Wall of Fame.

o  It takes a village to raise a Moon! All of us on the project team thank you for your donation and support for Playa Moon Rising. If you are on playa, come and visit us. If you can’t make it, we’ll be posting pictures and videos on the web site. Either way we can put your name in our list of donors on the site – the Wall of Fame.

$10 – Sticky Business

o  Playa Moon Rising stickers are perfect for showing your love of giant spheres, and decorating your water bottle or peechee.

$25 – You’ve Got (Dusty) Mail

o  Few things can make your day like receiving mail from Burning Man. You’ll receive a handwritten note of thanks, complete with the unique BRC postmark, and a touch of Playa dust.

$50 – Dial T for T-Shirt

o  Playa Moon Rising T-Shirts will be much sought after this year – unique to those who helped make this happen.

$75 – Do More Now Undies

o  Boyshorts emblazoned with the motto Do More Now! Ideal playa wear.


$100 – Honey, I Shrunk the Moon

o  You too can have your very own miniature Playa Moon, and it bounces to boot! Receive your own 28” Hippity hop resembles the inflated Playa Moon when fully lit.


$250 – The Full Monty

o  Do you want it all? You can have it. You get your name on the wall, the postcard, t-shirt, boy shorts, and hippty hop.


Other Ways You Can Help

Looking for more ways to contribute?

  1. Spread the word. Tell your friends and family. Share the link – share the joy!
  2. Share this project on the social media network of your choosing!
  3. Get involved. Are you local to Seattle, or headed to the burn this year? Email chad@do-more-now.com.
  4. If you really want to be a major part of this project, you’d have to join our fabulous camp and come help us blow it up. We have a few spots remaining. Email alin@do-more-now.com.

Photos

Photos provided courtesy of the remarkably talented Esspressobuzz, esspressobuzzphoto@gmail.com.
