story:
The Wishing Tree:

Click Here for Wishing Tree Home Page

The Wishing Tree is an interactive 30-foot tall laser-cut steel illuminated willow tree holding thousands of inscribable silver leaves cascading down from three levels to form a canopy of wishes from around the world. This sculpture was installed on three different continents in 2014, and is designed to provide her visitors with an artistic point of connection for linking themselves to people in other cultures, exploring the common wishes we all share, and fostering empathy for one another and our Earth. 


The concept of the sculpture is based on an ancient global tradition of respecting and recognizing a tree as a sentient being. Through-out time, cultures from across the world wrote messages and wishes, hanging them on special trees with an offering in an attempt to gain good graces and wisdom. 

Today, many of us are less connected with Nature. The life force of our planet is often seen as something to be consumed. As a result, it seems we humans have a destructive and fragile relationship with our environment. The Wishing Tree invites us to consider reconnecting to the earth by making a healing wish for our world and for each other


Photos of Wishing Tree in Santiago, Chile in 2014 below: 



The Wishing Tree was conceived as a social experiment in connectivity and as a place to resonate with others through shared desires, vulnerabilities, humor, beauty and above all, calls for peace and harmony. Because it was originally created as a global sculpture that toured, it has become an emissary of good will, and a safe, peaceful gathering space at each festival.  Please join us at the Heart and Mind Festival as we welcome the Wishing Tree into our midst and celebrate our connection to Nature.


The Wishing Tree sculpture has recently completed a first world-tour with the Mysteryland Festival, starting in Bethel Woods, NY on the site of the original Woodstock Festival at Yasgur's Farm and then being shipped over to Amsterdam, Netherlands to the longest running electronic music and arts festival in Europe, and finally to Santiago, Chile. 




Photo of the Wishing Tree in Bethel Woods, NY in 2014:

Up close and personal with the base of the tree and it's tribal laser-cut designs: 

Photo of a woman flowing threw the wishes in Santiago, Chile: 


Here is Wishing Tree sculptor artist Kate Raudenbush talking about the piece in Amsterdam, Netherlands:



About artist Kate Raudenbush



Kate Raudenbush is a New York-based, Burning Man-bred artist. Her large-scale allegorical environments are created as a set-piece to catalyze human connection and social dialogue. 

Referencing history, geometry, spiritual mythology, and biology to inform the narrative of her work, she utilizes welded laser-cut steel, mirror, and light to shape her concepts into large-scale, climbable, enveloping environments and sacred spaces that invite both intellectual curiosity and visitor exploration. In this way, the artwork is not just an object to behold, but also an experience to be lived and learned from. 

A self-taught sculpture artist, Kate’s work and words have been published widely and seen in art museums from Seoul to Reno, in art fairs from Miami to the Hamptons, and in festivals from Amsterdam to Las Vegas, Santiago, New York City and many epic fiery gatherings of Burning Man.


Kate Raudenbush giving a TedX talk at Burning Man in 2011: on Socially Conscious Art: 


Click Here for Kate Raudenbush Homepage


The Heart and Mind Festival


This sculpture will be installed in Ellenville, NY for the Heart and Mind Festival put on by the Golden Drum community and Sacred Arts Research Foundation that are based out of Brooklyn, NY. Heart and Mind Festival is in its third year as a shamanic healing and tribal arts festival that aims to bring together a global synthesis of visionary artists, spiritual practitioners, healers, musicians, activists, and elders in a gathering to share self-expression, arts, wisdom, healing ceremony, and a global representation of spiritual traditions in the service of higher consciousness and community. 

The Heart and Mind Festival will take place on a beautiful piece of land purchased last year by the Golden Drum community in the serene forests surrounding Ellenville, NY two hours outside of New York City. 

Promotional video for Heart and Mind Festival 2015: 



Featured Artists and Events at the Heart and Mind Festival:

Photo of Sacred Fire and Traditional Native American Sweatlodge Ceremony from Heart and Mind 2014: 


Photo of Tata Pedro Cruz and Shumantla Fenix, wisdom-keepers who sit on the Mayan Council of Elders leading a Mayan Fire-Ceremony at Heart and Mind 2014: 

Photo of Dream Seed, a shamanic sound healing meditation group that performs a unique synthesis of world music from across the globe that will be performing at Heart and Mind:

 The Art of Alfredo Zagaceta and Moises Llerena, two life-long students of world-famous visionary shamanic Peruvian-painter Pablo Amaringo, will be traveling from Peru and Switzerland to display their other-worldy paintings at Heart and Mind this year
Click Here for Alfredo's Website

Alfredo Zagaceta of Pucallpa, Peru with his work:

Moises Llerena who now resides in Switzerland next to his work: 

Elders from Spiritual Traditions across the World at Heart and Mind Festival 2012: 

Taino wisdom-keeper, ceremonial leader, founder of Golden Drum and creator of Heart and Mind Festival, Maestro Manuel Rufino (on right) pictured with his teacher of over 40 years, Master Domingo Dias Porta of Venezuela at Heart and Mind 2012: 

Click Here For Golden Drum Homepage

Homepage for Sacred Arts Research Foundation



What will this funding empower?


The funding from this indigogo campaign will go entirely to pay for the machinery needed to install and deinstall this massive sculpture along with expenses to cover materials to create new leaves for participants to write on, which require laser-cutting due to the shape and number needed. Kate and a dedicated team of volunteers from Golden Drum will be giving five days of intense physical labor to install this sculpture as an act of community service as an offering to the festival. 

This is ordinarily a very expensive piece to install where many workers and the artist are paid but a shared vision by Kate and Golden Drum has come together where we felt called to build this piece entirely on volunteer labor due to it's message of global healing and community. We are aiming to build this piece solely to inspire, transform, move, heal, empower, and unite people while staying true to a core value that art is deeply sacred and NOT a commodity. 


The Perks!

Rewards for helping  us pass on this powerful message of peace, harmony, compassion, healing, connection to nature, and community to the world by supporting our campaign! 

Photo of the stainless steel laser-cut Wishing Tree Pendent designed by Kate Raudenbush that will be given to the first 100 people to donate $65: 

Photo of handmade Shipibo Tapestry from Pucallpa, Peru that is available for a $520 donation to help bring the Wishing Tree to Heart and Mind Festival 2015 (comes with pendent as well): 


The  photography book:  Burning Man: Art on Fire. Personally signed by  artist  Kate Raudenbush.



Photo of Amanda Capobianco, founder of Brooklyn Light and teacher of 10 years during a trip to India who will be offering private Reiki and Yoga classes to those who help us with $165 and $200 donations. Only 10 sessions total available! (Comes with pendant as well) 

Click Here for Brooklyn-Light Yoga and Reiki


Photo of Jerry Walsh of Didge Project, performing at Alex Grey's Chapel of Sacred Mirrors, who will be playing and teaching at Heart and Mind Festival and offering  private 1 on 1 didgeridoo lessons to those who donate $165 to help bring the  Wishing Tree to Heart and Mind Festival 2015 (Comes with pendant as well) 

Click Here for Didge Project Homepage 


Please help us make this dream a reality! Thank you for your support and donations! 

Love,
The Wishing Tree creative team

story:
60 illustrations in 60 days to benefit a shelter for pigs.

(please go to UPDATES to see the illustrations)

Before I will write you the story, I shell introduce ourselves:

Kate - the pig sanctuary founder and me - Iwona - the illustrator.

The project comes from kind of helplessness, the lack of time for making art and need to cooperate with people…to see…that they care.

You know how it often is…you make sketches, you draw or paint and gradually leave it, as no one else cares but you. I’ve been quite shy with promoting my art for many years… but now when I have my goal to help my friend with building the shelter for pigs… have no choice but go for it :)

As I see it, 3 of us could be happy:

You – having an original and good quality (yes!) art piece,

Me – doing what I love,

Pig – having a safe house.

Daily I will be posting my works one by one (in the UPDATING section and GALLERY). Hopefully, I will get the response from you people ;) 

As soon as I get my funding pledges, I will send the original to my backer by post.

All the funds except for materials, packaging, and posting will go for building the pigs’ house.

There are 4 pigs already in the Pig Sanctuary - Azyl Chrum Chrum, located in the small village Zajączkowo in Poland. Kate – the founder is opting for 20 pigs ultimately.

FB page - https://www.facebook.com/chrumki/

ENGLISH version of the Sanctuary page: 

https://www.facebook.com/savepigs/

The secret is, I wouldn’t have the nerve and the courage to plan this project if it was not for helping the animals.

I teach art in the secondary art school. During my long two month holidays I would love to create art …but! also be helpful with it and assist my friend in building a shelter for pigs.

With the funds from this project Kate could build a new house for 2 pigs saved from an industrial farm …huraaay!

Here is some updating ... to show that this campaign is not only the artist seeking your support but alive beings being saved... Look! We are building the first pig house from the Polish crowd funding site funds...

If I don't get complete funding? Pity, but any money will add a milestone to building a new house for pigs.

The campaign is finished on 4th of August, then in 15 days period, I will get my funds. I will be shipping gradually your orders, the latest posts should go around 20th of August. Thank you for your patience :)

Here is the set of illustrations I've created so far... after 8 days of running the campaign :

If you'd like to see my art:

1. just traditional forms ;)    liegmann.art.pl

2. here I post some updates of the project     www.instagram.com/iwonaliegmann/

e-mail: liegmann@wp.pl

You can also help with sharing the info about this campaign. Thank you!
story_txt:
60 illustrations in 60 days to benefit a shelter for pigs.
(please go to UPDATES to see the illustrations)
Before I will write you the story, I shell introduce ourselves:

Kate - the pig sanctuary founder and me - Iwona - the illustrator.

The project comes from kind of helplessness, the lack of time for making art and need to cooperate with people…to see…that they care.
You know how it often is…you make sketches, you draw or paint and gradually leave it, as no one else cares but you. I’ve been quite shy with promoting my art for many years… but now when I have my goal to help my friend with building the shelter for pigs… have no choice but go for it :)
As I see it, 3 of us could be happy:
You – having an original and good quality (yes!) art piece,
Me – doing what I love,
Pig – having a safe house.


Daily I will be posting my works one by one (in the UPDATING section and GALLERY). Hopefully, I will get the response from you people ;)

story:
Air Carafe

Introduction

Hi. My name is Gary Casey and I am reaching out from the west coast of Ireland.

I have been operating in the Product Development arena for over 20 years now but have never developed anything for myself!

I am about to undergo a development that will be funded by me. The goal? To bring the Air Carafe to the world. This is a patent pending design that I know will be of huge benefit to the wine drinkers of the world.

Please go to the Facebook page and LIKE.

Those that have spent time learning how to fully appreciate wine understand that letting red wine aerate to oxidize the high tannin content is important to fully appreciate the more subtle flavors in a good bottle of wine.

However, to allow the full flavor of a young red wine to develop by having your wine “breathe” for an hour or more also makes the wine vulnerable to insects such as dreaded fruit fly, which can easily gain access through the opened bottle of wine.

As you anticipate enjoying your wine after a long day at work or enjoying time with friends, have the peace of mind knowing that your wine is being protected with the air carafe. The protective mesh allows air to enter in freely and keeps any bugs, dust, and other particulates out of your delicious red wine.

Be assured that the sturdy, long lasting design will allow you to fully enjoy your red wine as well as certain white wines to an even greater degree for many years to come.

Take a moment to watch the video above in order to visually see what a great solution the Air Carafe is for allowing your wine to breathe.

Development

I have taken the design to the point where I have machined a prototype from ABS plastic material.

At this point I am ready to go but will need to raise capital to fund the production of an injection mould tool. This tooling is required to produce the part in production quantities. The cost of this tooling? €8,000. Adding in other development costs such as packaging and instructions design a total target funding goal of €10,000 is required.

Perks

Perks are basically your way of supporting me. By pre-ordering the Air Carafe, you will be integral in this product launch and receive free shipping to anywhere in the world – you’ll be the first to enjoy the benefits of this innovative product that takes enjoying wine to the next level.

No perks?

If you don’t wish to get a perk but like the sound of what I am trying to produce, then you can still help. Spread the word! Tell your friends, click Like on Facebook – that would be really of huge benefit as well.

story:
About

Kalos Eidos is inspired by the hypnotizing visual evolution of a kaleidoscope and its dependence on human interaction. The main objective is to create a conversation between sight and touch within a site specific installation. This project has been designed to accommodate collaborations with independent artists and our aim is to provide an opportunity for artists to take part in Nuit Blanche through the Kalos Eidos project, and in turn receive exposure.

Kalos Eidos has been formally accepted as an Independent Project by Scotiabank Nuit Blanche, and will be appearing in all print and online media associated with the City of Toronto. In conjunction with the Toronto School of Art, the project hopes to transform the South West corner of Bloor and Dufferin on October 4th, 2014.

For further information or inquiries in participation please contact us at kaloseidosnuit@gmail.com.


Our goals

·  Involve local artists

·  Engage the community

·  Reinvent the location through use of multiple video projections, mirrored surfaces, reflective material and mobile sculptural components

·  Allow viewer interaction

·  Inspire viewer imagination


The Impact

With your help, we will be able to provide the materials necessary for visual artists to participate in the installation. Also, due to the digital component of the project, funds raised will support the rental fees of high-power projectors for the video work submitted. Read more about the submission outlinehere.


Other Ways You Can Help

DONATE MATERIALS:

Kalos Eidos is rooted in reusing and recycling materials. Currently, we are in need of construction supplies, see a complete list of materials to be donated and drop-off locations here. Anything you can provide is greatly appreciated!

DONATE YOUR TIME

We need volunteers to help on site during the event. Check out the positions we are looking to fill here.

SPONSORSHIP:

We are currently looking for large partnership-­level sponsors. If you are interested in working with us please contact kaloseidosnuit@gmail.com to develop a company specific sponsor agreement.

story:
I realize that this is in dollars, but it will be converted to the British Pound when my campaign has ended. As an example, if you donate $20 its equivalent in pounds is £12.24.  If you donate $10 it's equivalent is £6.12 and so on...

The Project:

Hi, my name is Danielle and I am currently in my third and final year at University. For my final project I am planning a photography exhibition which will be focused on Dreamland fun park in Margate, Kent. Margate is my hometown and I have many memories of going to Dreamland when I was younger. Unfortunately today the old fun fair site is desolate and abandoned and the rides have been moved away, some even burnt down. I aim to reflect on how Dreamland was in the past and compare it with how it is today through a series of photographs that I will take and found footage. I also intend on involving people who live in Margate by sending out postcards to them in the hope that they will write a personal memory on the card and send it back to me. These will also feature in my exhibition. I want my exhibition to be personal experience for everyone who visits, due to different memories of Margate. I hope to create discussion and learn more about my hometown and how it may develop in the future. 

By contributing even the smallest amount will help me hugely. I want my exhibition to be as good as possible, especially as it is my final year and I really want to show what I can do so I'd be grateful for any help that you can give. 

What I Hope To Raise & What You Get

I am hoping to raise around £300 to make my exhibition as good as possible. This will mostly go towards making sure the Private view of the exhibition runs smoothly including the provision of food and drinks, transport/labour costs for setting up in the daytime and materials to decorate the exhibition space (wood, cloth, cushions and directions to the gallery.) It will also go towards exhibition advertising and some print costs. 

Any one who contributes to my fundraising will get email updates of my progress (providing you give me an email address) which will include sneak-previews of my work before it is finished! You will also receive an invitation to my exhibition nearer the time. 

Donations at £10 or more will receive a personalized handwritten thank you postcard all the way from Margate! (providing an address is given, if not an e-postcard will be sent via email) plus updates and an invitation to my exhibition. 

Personal Aims

This is my final year project and I am hoping it will act as a launchpad for my career. I hope to go into working with events which is a reason why I am planning my own exhibition. I am aware that working alone is a lot of work but I want to show my skills and dedication to something I enjoy doing. 

What Else Can You Do?

I am aware that not everyone will have money to give, but if not there are other ways you could help me. I am looking for copies of old postcards and old photographs of Margate that I could use in the postcard part of my project. If you have these or even any old videos of Margate I would be grateful if you could let me know by email at daniellesandwell@gmail.com Also if you would like to take part in my postcard project, please also email me with your details. 

Lastly, if you could share my project to anyone you know who might be interested I would also appreciate that. (Particularly people you may know who visited Margate and Dreamland, or currently live in the area would be great!) I need as much information as possible. 

Thank you to anyone who has/is going to contribute.
You will be helping me out so much.

Danielle

story:
Bonjour. Nous sommes le West Coast Montréal Street Impro Club et, aujourd’hui, nous avons besoin de votre aide.

Depuis maintenant trois ans, nous sommes les champions en titre du Punch Club. Sans aucune résistance, nous avons défoncé chacune des équipes qui s’est présenté devant nous et les avons humilié devant une foule monstre.

Mais être champions du Punch Club, ce n’est pas donné à tout le monde. Le 27 mai prochain à la Sala Rosa, ce privilège sera refusé à l’équipe Poulin-Dargis-Longpré.
C’est pourquoi nous avons besoin de votre argent : pour aider une équipe perdante à avoir l’air un peu moins perdante.

Notre objectif est d’amasser 600$ pour permettre à cette petite équipe de débutants de prendre une photo en bobette après leur défaite pour faire croire à leur cercle de connaissances qu’ils ont peut être gagné

story:
I have been invited by the Jacob Lawrence Gallery to open a solo show June/July, 2018.  The Jake has a mission of honoring the late painter’s legacy and promoting social justice and experimentation in art.  The gallery is associated with and acts as an educational resource for the University of Washington and the greater public.

This is an exciting opportunity for me to create work I have been dreaming about for some time and I am honored to have the chance to exhibit in this beautiful space with a mission that aligns so closely with my work.  My goal is to raise $8000 which will cover all expenses for the show including production, fabrication, printing, framing, installation and public programming.  I will be working in my usual multidisciplinary fashion and the body of work will include sculpture, photography and performance.

Megumi Shauna Arai is a self-taught Japanese/Jewish multidisciplinary artist working in a variety of mediums including photography, installation and textile. She grew up between the Pacific Northwest and Tokyo with a cultural anthropologist mother and economist father.  Immersive experiences of regional crafts related to her multicultural upbringing contribute to her reinterpretations of these traditions into a contemporary conceptual context.  The artist is drawn to investigating assimilation and resistance, othering and social disconnection in the present day through community engaging cross-disciplinary work.

story:
Hello!

I'm so excited for this opportunity to bring a Creative Reuse Studio to the community!

Using reusable, unique, and donated materials, creators of all ages will be invited to explore and create. A large variety of unique and useful items will be at your disposal. Items will rotate regularly. So there will always be something new and exciting to spark your imagination! 

My name is Yon. I'm a local preschool and art teacher, single mom, and lover of all things sustainable and creative. Thank you for helping my vision for the community become a reality!

You can feel good about supporting ReTreasure! 

This store will keep items out of landfills. Materials that would otherwise be thrown away will find new life. 

Donating cash and materials will keep costs low for local families. A large part of ReTreasure's mission is to be accessible to everyone who wishes to use it. 

ReTreasure will help people build confidence in their abilities. It is my belief and experience that ALL people have a need to exercise creativity.

 My vision is that patrons of this store will feel success and have a ton of fun while they allow themselves to let go and find their muse, whether it's been hiding for decades.or is a constant companion.

Helping to fund a fun business

Through this campaign you will have the opportunity to bring this experience to life!
You have the opportunity to  pre-order memberships, sign up for classes, and help at any level you can. 
As a thank you, gifts such as tee shirts and drop-in passes are available.
Gift levels range from $1-$1,000. 
Perks can be donated. If you'd like to transfer your perk to someone who can't afford studio time or membership on their own, we'll gladly do that for you.
Money raised will go towards signing a lease, start-up software, business license fees, video production, retail materials, and other costs associated with starting a business.

A resource for the community

Local teachers and crafters can come in and use the industrial sized laminator. 

Bulk items for small or large projects will be available for sale as well as unique items for classroom science experiments, preschool exploration, home schooling lessons, and general tinkering. 

A community swap table will be a place for people to freely share usable art and craft materials that still have life in them but aren't able to be sold in the store. 

This unique style of art is accessible to EVERY person, regardless of age, ability, or experience. 

Thank you for your kind contribution and support. It truly is appreciated.

Thank you to Heather and Adam Crockett for filming and producing the video for this campaign. You guys rock!

Thank you to all of the friends and family who have supported me with encouraging words and boxes and boxes of stuff to share with the community. I don't have the words to tell you what that has meant to me. I feel honored and humbled by your faith. This place is going to be great!

story:
Archaic Remnants and The Methods of Transfer is a collaboration of visual arts, music, dance and film . We build out industrial spaces into full installations and build an authentic dance and live music in direct communication with the set - to be performed infront of an audience. After performing The Cave, we have moved to a new space in order to bring to you The Web of Azoth ; a story of the elements - of transendence - of infinite history and the power of Alchemy.

It takes a lot to transform a space; plaster, chicken wire, fabric, paint, lighting, costumes, sound equipment, and projections. Not to mention the costs of putting up the actual performance for the public; advertising, seating , and a host for the night. 

We are only able to inhabit these spaces for a limited time. It's a lot of work , money and materials for a such a temporary world. It's very important to us to be able to film these happenings in high quality so that we can share what we create to other spaces, venues, communities and residencies. 

Come join us and experience The Web of Azoth for yourself!

Performance Dates: October 17 - 18th & 23-25th  Doors at 7:00 - Showtime: 8:00

story:
Visit the Scrollture Gallery.


The Scrollture Vision: To bring forth an exciting new platform for individuals to create meaningful artwork and cement precious moments upon. 

Scrollture, LLC helps you create artwork on an innovative canvas designed to resemble a scroll (the Scroll Canvas).  These art pieces do everything from inscribing sacred text, to sharing artistic visions; from completing a room’s ambiance, to celebrating life’s treasured moments.  Through our graphic services and on-demand printing, customers can capture thoughts, ideas, or any significant moment and have it laid on canvas.  As a cost-effective competitor to stretched canvas and framing, the Scroll Canvas offers new depths to canvased work, and can transform artwork not just in presentation, but also meaning.


The Scroll Canvas. . . A Viable Alternative

Stretched canvas and framing has been the dominating platforms for canvased artwork with no viable alternative ways to present artwork on canvas. . . until now!

Framing provides great aesthetic enhancement to your artwork, but it is also EXTREMELY expensive.  Stretched canvas is a more cost effective platform, yet it does not do much to enhance the presentation of your artwork. The scroll canvas rivals stretched canvas in cost and aesthetically enhances your artwork in ways that stretcher bars simply cannot. Plus, this beautiful platform captures the sacred essence of your work. 

The scroll canvas platform is made of high quality artist canvas attached to scroll rods. Prints are made using the giclee’ process - the highest standard in digital fine-art printing.  End Caps/Finials are added to the end of the rods to enhance the presentation of the artwork printed on the scroll, much like the frame design enhances the presentation of framed artwork.  As framers provide a multitude of frame styles and colors to choose from, Scrollture provides a myriad of styles and finishes for you to select.

   The Cap Series

The Cap Series consists of the standard caps provided to customers.  These end caps are made of wood and will come in a host of finishes, which will include white, black, mahogany, warm oak, bronze, and gold.

   The Classic Series

The Classic Series is a collection of wood and resin finials with a classic look.  A variety of styles are provided with finishes including white, black, mahogany, warm oak, bronze, and gold.


The Need

We need $20,000 to keep this vision moving forward.  All of the funds raised will go towards start-up costs, which includes capital equipment, opening inventory, administration and promotional expenses for the first year.  Please see below for a breakdown of how the funds will be allocated.

Following the success of this campaign, we will be able to build the business in the phases outlined in the above diagram, starting with paying our campaign costs and providing you, our wonderful supporters, with your well-deserved perks!


Summary of Perks

Below is a summary of the perks provided as a thank you for supporting this campaign.  Please see more detailed perk information to the right.

Scrollture Youth Art Contest

The Scrollture Youth Art Contest encourages youth, ages 18 and under, to express himself/herself artistically by providing the opportunity to have their work celebrated!  Winners will receive a scroll print of their work.  As a supporter who chooses a perk, you will receive the chance to help choose the winners of the contest. 

Discounts off Scrollture Purchase

Receive 5%, 10%, or 15% off a purchase from Scrollture! You will receive a discount code that can be utilized once the Scrollture website is launched.

Scroll Purchase

Pre-order your Sacred Scroll (limited amount available) and choose between the following attributes:

  • Sizes 14" x 16" or 16" x 20"
  • Blank Scroll Canvas or Customize Print
  • Cap Series or Classic Series Finial

The Artist Circle

Artists and photographers interested in creating works on the platform can become a part of our Artist Circle.  Create a 16” x 20” scroll print and choose a Cap or Classic Series finial in an assortment of finishes. We will add you to our “Artist Circle” page that can showcase your print and provide a link to your work.  You will also receive a special discount code for a Lifetime 5% off all future purchases.


Let Your Creativity Shine Through!

Scrollture exists to help you bring your artistic vision to life.  What would you create a Sacred Scroll for?  Below is a couple scrolls to get your creative juices flowing. See the Scrollture Gallery for some more wonderful creations! 


Call To Action

Now that you know who Scrollture, LLC is and the wonderful service it provides, it's time to answer the call and contribute to the campaign!  Choose one of the wonderful perks.  Also please share our vision with your friends and social media contacts on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest.  

Thank you for your support!


For questions or comments, please contact us at scrollture@gmail.com

story:
My little cheap tablet is dying and I really need a new one. This time, I would like to buy a *NICE* tablet with better support and programs. I'd like to buy an Intuos.

The one I want, unfortunately, is $500.

So I thought I'd see if maybe the internet could help me. I'd like to buy a Intuos Pro, the large size. I know that sounds ambitious to try to fund that, but I figure I have a thousand followers on Twitter, and half of them gave me a dollar each, I'd be there.

To pay for fees, taxes, and shipping, I have made the goal slightly higher. If you think you can help with this project, you will be allowing me to continue drawing awesome feminists, body positive images, and eventually start my own comic.

Thank you so much for anything you can give. As nervous as I am to ask for this, I just don't know how else to keep drawing.

This is a short campaign. I have no idea if it will work. I'm putting myself in your hands, internet. Let's see what we can do together.

story:
About Eighth Generation

Eighth Generation is a Seattle-based small business, founded when Louie Gong (Nooksack) began customizing shoes with cultural art. In seven years, Eighth Generation has grown into a brand recognized for products that showcase art created by "Inspired Natives." Now we’re about to launch our first line of beautiful, high quality, 100% wool blankets designed by Native artists. We’re asking for your support as we move into this exciting and important new phase in our company’s development.

With your support, Eighth Generation will become the gold standard for Native wool blankets!

The wool blanket holds a prominent place in Native communities, often given as gifts or awarded in ceremonies to honor individuals. Historically, though, the only producers of wool blankets are non-Native companies who have frequently chosen to appropriate cultural art instead of collaborating with cultural artists. It’s time to change that. We’re about to become the first ever Native-owned company to offer wool blankets.

When you contribute to this campaign, your dollars will:

  • Help us compete with more established businesses by adding our first full time staffer - a marketing and sales specialist - to the Eighth Generation team;
  • Recoup a portion of the cost of our initial collaborative blanket with Evergreen State College's Longhouse, which was covered by Eighth Generation.  The blanket honoring the Longhouse's 20th year of service to the community will be used for giveaways and fundraising by the Longhouse;
  • Set a precedent for Native-owned companies to be the leading producers of art featuring Native designs;
  • Support the continuation of traditional Native arts and practices;
  • Support the development of business experience within tribal communities.

Thank you for your consideration. Every dollar donated will help establish Eighth Generation as a Native-owned, community-engaged source for wool blankets.

For your generous contribution, you’ll receive:

$10: Digital thank-you note with a virtual tour of the Eighth Generation studio

$25: Personalized thank-you card with a design by Louie Gong or one of our Inspired Natives artists


$50: Hardwood paddle pendant, hand-painted and laser-etched. Signed with a Thank You note on the reverse side.  Approximately 4" x 5".

$100: Eighth Generation t-shirt, plus a limited edition variety pack of shoe art stickers

$125: Eighth Generation's "Transformation" Throw Blanket by Michelle Lowden (Acoma Pueblo)

$200: Limited edition "Hummingbird Moon" serigraph art print (15" x 20"), signed and numbered by artist Louie Gong

$350: Salish pattern blanket (Only 50 available in a box signed to your specifications). We will get in touch with you via email at the end of the campaign.

$500: Evergreen State College Longhouse blanket with signed box (only 50 available!)

  • $1000: One-hour Skype presentation with Louie Gong at the Eighth Generation studio for you and a small group
  • $5000: Two-hour studio visit or Skype-based consultation for up-and-coming artists or other interested parties (for up to 25 people)

Thank you for your consideration. Every dollar will help establish Eighth Generation as a Native-owned, community-engaged source for wool blankets.

The Economic & Community Impact of Supporting Native-Owned Companies

When you support Native-owned companies, your purchase represents:

  • More dollars in the pot of finite consumer resources accessible to Native artists -- increased access to the consumer market and more "shelf space" for Native artists;
  • More circulation of opportunities and resources within tribal communities;
  • Breaking the pattern of cultural appropriation;
  • Increasing the business capacity and recognition for Native-owned companies;
  • Support for Native ownership of Native stories and cultural capital.

These blankets symbolize a major step in reclaiming Native art for Native artists, and you can help simply by donating and sharing this link.

At Eighth Generation, our community service work has supported communities far and wide, with collaborative projects such as:

  • Custom mural for the Port Gamble S’Klallam skate park
  • Creating the new Chief Seattle Club logo
  • Custom mural in the Labateyah Youth Home
  • Designing the Huy logo
  • Seattle Indian Health Board Indigenous Cultures Day
  • Workshops in tribal communities throughout the country

We’ve built our company through hard work and strong relationships with community members — and now we need your support to write the next chapter in our company’s story.

The Challenges of Consumer Education

Because there has never been a Native-owned, community-engaged option for wool blankets -- and many people may have never imagined that this was possible -- it may be hard to understand the true economic and social impact of this project. And helping people understand may challenge their beliefs and commonly accepted ideas about business. 

Thus, the burden of consumer education lies with us. We accept this responsibility, and plan to meet it through the following:

  • Ongoing development of the Inspired Natives Project, a capacity-building initiative anchored in the mantra "Inspired Natives, not Native-inspired"
  • Create a video highlighting the economic impact of cultural appropriation

Many of the existing, entrenched options for consuming Native arts and culture do not support the sustained health and wellness of the Native community. While we advance our mission to educate the public on being responsible consumers of Native arts and culture, you can help just by paying attention and making ethical, informed choices about the companies your dollars support.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t donate, there are other ways you can help us reach our goal:

  • Spread the word! Share this page on social media to get the word out (use the Indiegogo share tools).
  • Check out our website at eighthgeneration.com.
  • When purchasing products featuring Native art, make sure they’re made by Native artists – not imitators. Remember to support Inspired Natives, not Native-inspired!

story:
Taking Guåhu Guåhan to Hawaii

si dåkot-ta alcantara-camacho, is a one of a kind Chamorro performance artist, born and raised in Duwamish territory in Turtle Island.

alcantara-camacho is set to attend "Creating Futures Rooted in Wonder" Symposium at the University of Hawaii Manoa in September 2015.

This opportunity will allow alcantara-camacho to present  "Guåhu Guåhan" (I am the Place of Existence), a solo performance work inspiring the fullest expressions of contemporary Chamorro culture. 

With traditional Chamorro chant, urban rap and hip hop music written especially by alcantara-camacho, Guåhu Guåhan features contemporary dance sequences choreographed by movement director and dramaturge, Jack Gray from Aotearoa.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1,200 to pay for the cost of a single one way airfare from Guam to Honolulu.

We request an artists per diem of $50/day, to assist with food, transport and daily needs for the duration of the 2 week Symposium. ($700).

Currently, alcantara-camacho is teaching free community workshops at Sagan Kotturan Chamoru (Chamoru Cultural Immersion Center) in Guåhan (Guam). This voluntary service develops new Chamorro performance in preparation for the 2016 Festival of Pacific Arts - hosted for the first time by Guåhan.

Your support for local, grass-roots, conscious community activism supports the well-being of the Marianas Islands. Through arts, we enrich people to recall ancestral obligations to ensure we maintain our mantra: "Our Islands Are Sacred".

The Impact

This project is a life work of alcantara-camacho in dialogue and discussion with other Pacific artists. It reminds us that despite our borders, we are all connected.

alcantara-camacho and Gray, collaborate on a number of projects and activations; the Cultural Informance Lab (UC Berkeley, 2014), Lenapehoking Transformance Lab (New York University) and Ohlone Transformance Lab (California State University at Hayward, 2015), the Indigenous Knowledge Gathering (California Institute of Integral Studies, 2015) and Indigenous Choreographers at Riverside Project (UC Riverside, 2015).

After Hawaii, they will work together on "Mitimiti" by Atamira Dance Company in Aotearoa, and the Lono Project at New York University's Asia/Pacific/American Institute in 2016.

Risks & Challenges

Social Justice and Indigenous issues are hot topics around the globe dealt with politically in many different ways. The point of this art is to find a platform for authentic expression of issues that helps people (Chamorro and/or otherwise) to overcome their challenges of disempowerment.

The key message of the show and it's creators, is that it is the people themselves, who have always known the best ways to take care of the land and each other.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate all kind offers of reciprocity and support. THANK YOU! MAHALO.

story:
You read that correctly, as part of the 36TH Annual Rhubarb Festival we're transforming Buddies in Bad Times Theatre into a bathhouse that Hamlet would be proud of!

This faggy-feminist production of Hamlet In A Hot Tub combines live theatre, video and drag into the first contemporary queer Shakespearean tale with a happy ending.

We receive a modest budget from Buddies in Bad Times Theatre but for this installation there are some additional expenses for lighting, staging and costumes that will make our show spectacular and truly twisted!

This show will be epic and we'd love you to be a part of it. Below is our budget, and while modest, it really will help us create a theatre experience you will never forget.

....................................................

Hamlet In A Hot Tub Budget

Additional Projector Rental $150 x 4 days $600.00

(incl. insurance)

Costumes x 4 characters $800

Food x 6 rehearsals $300

(guaranteed to improve acting and coordination)

Postcard invitations, Posters $250, Wrist bands

Wigs & makeup $250

..........................................................................

Buddies in Bad Times Theatre presents the 36TH Annual Rhubarb Festival, Transgressions in Performance

February 18-22, 2015

Hamlet in Hot Tub adapted by Brock Hessel and David Bateman featuring Paul Bellini and Donnarama with Art Direction by Raymond Helkio

Evening passes $20 through the Box Office 416-875-8555

..........................................................................

Festival Director Mel Hague, Associate Festival Director Cole Alvis, Festival Sponsor TD Bank Group, Media Sponsor NOW Magazine

story:
who~what~where

            For nearly two years the U.G. Collective has been on a mission to strengthen the community through the arts. Being the creative minds that we are, our efforts have been diverse and dynamic. We have hosted benefits for community arts organizations and programs like the Geneva Theater Guild, The Smith Center for the Arts and the Boys & Girls Club of Geneva’s Teen Center music program. We have sponsored monthly events that promote cultural vibrancy in our community and provide opportunities for artists and performers to share their work. We have also facilitated after school music programs at the Phelps Community Center, The Boys & Girls Club of Geneva’s Teen Center and the Geneva City School District Head Start summer program.

            These efforts continue to be a focus for us, but we feel the need to increase our impact and serve the greater community. By mobilizing our members to be active in the community through service and volunteering, we will inspire pride of place and enhance public spaces while promoting creative growth and better citizenship. The concept is simple: members of the U.G. Collective will be required to volunteer a minimum of 24 hours a year. For every hour served members will earn credits that can be redeemed for various offers by The U.G. Collective. Offerings include but are not limited to: workshops, presentations, one on one lessons, discounts to local businesses, U.G. apparel and much more. Your contribution will help us build the infrastructure needed to move us forward and inspire a community to work and grow together.


To you from me

To my friends and family,

            It’s easy for some of us to forget all of the behind the scenes efforts of a musical when we are watching from a seat in the Smith Opera House. Hours spent rehearsing, building sets, the stage crew backstage and the tech crew running lights and sound. Like a musical, there are many things needed to move the U.G. Collective forward. Things like a website that will help us communicate with our members and share our efforts with you and your friends. Or the maintenance of equipment that’s constantly used for programming and community events. The fact is, this campaign goal is a fraction of what we need to provide a year of quality programming, creative community engagement and to sustain this initiative. But every dollar counts and will be put towards what the Board of Directors deems essential to the progress of this organization.

           Our goal for this campaign is $5,000. This would be a much needed springboard into 2014 as we launch the “Beyond Music, Art & Culture” initiative. This initiative will increase community engagement through service with our members, connect volunteer opportunities to willing and able bodies as well as provide opportunities for creative and personal growth. Things like branding, operating efficiency and capacity building can be taken for granted from an outsiders perspective. But they are necessary pieces needed to grow our organization and bring our vision of strengthening the community through arts to fruition.

           The efforts of the U.G. Collective thus far have only been possible with the contributions of my friends and family. Time and resources have been donated by myself and those willing and able to give. Though I will continue this labor of love and take the small victories as they come, I know that together we can really make a difference. So I'm asking for your help. Support this initiative in any way you can. Time and resources go a long way and I promise you, your contribution will inspire and bring a community together.

Love,
Pablo

Founder


$2,000 Founder Perk: Gym Class Heroes “The Papercut Chronicles II” platinum plaque donated by Matt McGinley drummer of The Gym Class Heroes. [only one available]


why...?

           They say many hands make light work, but I feel in this age of instant gratification and instant access to information it’s easy for us to get caught up in our own lives. I’m definitely guilty of it. We have the world in the palm of our hand and it’s our duty to make use of that power. I’m not saying go out and be a superhero but getting to know your neighbor is a start and supporting local businesses makes your community that much stronger. That same collaborative effort could be carried in all we do. That’s why this campaign isn't just about the U.G. Collective moving beyond music, art and culture. It is about building a sense of community, being proud of our efforts and working together.

Other Ways You Can Help

            As an artist and head of a not for profit organization, I don’t make much money. So I understand financial hardship and the desire to contribute but simply not being able to. But that doesn't stop me from being involved and supporting things I believe in. Everyone has a passion and skill, everyone has a network of friends and everyone has a heart. So listen to your heart and do what you feel inspired to do. Re-tweeting, sharing posts, emailing, texting and talking to people are things we practically do everyday. So if you can’t give monetarily consider spreading the word and donating your time. If you’re a graphic designer or grant writer your skills would be very helpful to our efforts. Something is better than nothing and you would be a part of something truly special. We can’t do this without you, so thank you...from my beard to my shoes :-)

~Pablo...xoxo
story_txt: who~what~where            For nearly two years the U.G. Collective has been on a mission to strengthen the community through the arts. Being the creative minds that we are, our efforts have been diverse and dynamic. We have hosted benefits for community arts organizations and programs like the Geneva Theater Guild, The Smith Center for the Arts and the Boys & Girls Club of Geneva’s Teen Center music program. We have sponsored monthly events that promote cultural vibrancy in our community and provide opportunities for artists and performers to share their work. We have also facilitated after school music programs at the Phelps Community Center, The Boys & Girls Club of Geneva’s Teen Center and the Geneva City School District Head Start summer program.            These efforts continue to be a focus for us, but we feel the need to increase our impact and serve the greater community. By mobilizing our members to be active in the community through service and volunteering, we will inspire pride of place and enhance public spaces while promoting creative growth and better citizenship. The concept is simple: members of the U.G. Collective will be required to volunteer a minimum of 24 hours a year. For every hour served members will earn credits that can be redeemed for various offers by The U.G. Collective. Offerings include but are not limited to: workshops, presentations, one on one lessons, discounts to local businesses, U.G. apparel and much more. Your contribution will help us build the infrastructure needed to move us forward and inspire a community to work and grow together.To you from meTo my friends and family,            It’s easy for some of us to forget all of the behind the scenes efforts of a musical when we are watching from a seat in the Smith Opera House. story:
The Accidental Photographer

How did I become a photographer?

I was asked by a friend (for whom I directed 2 videos for his band) to take non-traditional engagement photos and then I was asked by his fiance to photograph one of their (4) huge Indian engagement parties. Another friend, who is a Food Network Celebrity Chef, saw those photos and asked me to photography her based off of the theme of the "7 Deadly Sins & Food". 

(At the time I didn't even own a camera. These 3 people became friends on facebook and secretly coralled all of my other friends to get me a camera for my birthday).

Since then, I've photographed famous chefs, musicians, fashionistas, new product launches, books, etc.

What will the money be used for?

Exhibit space rental for 1-2 nights either in Downtown LA or the Melrose District

Photography Prints of varying sizes (most will be  16" x 20"  BUT (2) centerpiece selections will be 72" x 19")

Fixtures for displaying photos

Publicity & Promotions

Valet for the nights of the event

Wine & Cheese

Portfolio of Prints

Roundtrip Plane ticket to NYC to meet with John Wegorzewski (he's interested in exhibiting my work in Manhattan & South Hampton) [I can stay with friends just need the plane ticket]

Why is this important to me?

My photos are diverse and as broad as the letters of the alphabet, hence A to Z...

Photos are a form of documented history. I want to be the next great American female photographer and I am not ashamed of my ambition. And, I know with your help I can be.

Any amount is greatly appreciated and there are other ways you can help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Please share and repost. Even to people whom you think may not be interested...you never know!

 

(In order to use the money meaningfully my Perks will be limited as to not incur additional costs that will defeat the purpose of the fundraising. But know I am FOREVER GRATEFUL TO YOU ALL)

story:
Hello!

We are WCA – Women’s Caucus for Art, a 41-year old arts & activism volunteer-run not-for-profit organization, which has also been an NGO of the United Nations since 1975. We have 1200+ members nationwide. The President of LuXun Academy of Fine Arts in Shenyang, China invited our International Caucus group to create an art-based cultural exchange with Chinese women artists. This exciting project will take place at the Academy in April 2014! Eighteen of us are actively developing this exchange and exhibition. We need your help to succeed.

The project is titled Half the Sky: Intersections in Social Practice Art

(wondering what Social Practice Art is??? - you are not alone – keep reading!)

We really need your help!  

  • to subsidize travel for the delegation of WCA members who will
    • share our lives through our universal artist perspectives
    • explore contemporary art practice in different cultures
    • build community with Chinese women artists in Shenyang
    • encourage mutual understanding in ways that transcend language barriers
  • to purchase technology to support the events developed by our American delegation
  • to create the catalog that will include the art works and essays from US art historians and writers

Women artists and writers throughout history have received little or no acknowledgement or compensation, and have had to shoulder many of their own costs.

We want to help these women participate in this worthwhile exchange by giving them financial support. No work will be for sale at this exhibition. DONATE TODAY TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN! Your name will be added to our Wall of Gratitude and you will receive our other perks to thank your for your assistance.

Sixteen women will be chosen to participate in this dedicated delegation. We have to GET THEM TO CHINA! (As well as all the art!)  The costs are challenging but completely doable with you help.

WHO ARE THESE WOMEN?

Artists will be juried by Alma Ruiz, Senior Curator at the Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles. Essayists will be selected by Terri Weissman, Ph.D, Assistant Professor/Art History: Modern and Contemporary Art and History of Photography, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. (Find out more about them below). Sixteen WCA members will make up the working delegation that will travel to Shenyang for the interactive components of this project.

This project includes a joint exhibition for Chinese women artists curated by Beijing –based artist and curator Yin Ou Zhao and self-identified women artists juried through WCA. The catalog will include selected essays around the topic of contemporary art practices.

Both of these aspects of the project - the cultural exchange and the exhibition - collectively form a piece of social practice art (okay, ready for that definition?)

Definition:  Social Practice Art

Social practice art encompasses a wide range of art forms - public art,interactive media, performance, dialogue, activism, community practice, community building, interventions, and collaborations that cross art, public and social arenas. It is participatory, creates social networks, and brings attention to social issues through interactive components. 

WHAT TYPE OF ART WILL BE EXHIBITED?

New Media

Innovative work that uses technology, such as digital imaging, animation, video art, sound art, video games, some of which will printed at the Academy.

Installation

Small and large environments, and light and sound-based work

Social Practice Art Documentation

Since most of this art is action-based, interactive and short-lived, it is often well-documented through photos, video and writing. Artists will be able to submit this documentation for consideration in this exhibition and as stimulus for discussion between our delegation and the Chinese artists.

Traditional Art

Includes painting, drawing, photography, sculpture, ceramics, fiber, collage,

And all of this needs your help in getting to China!

WHO ARE WE?

Women’s Caucus for Art www.nationalwca.org

International Caucus of the Women’s Caucus for Art wcainternationalcaucus.weebly.com

Link to our most recent international project - Woman + Body, a collaboration with Korean artists in South Korea, Fall 2012. Woman + Body Exhibition

Here are some of the fabulous people involved:

 

Jing Deng - WCA International Caucus China Liaison, native of China, now living & working in the New Jersey,  Jing's website,  and childhood friend of Yin Ou Zhao

 

Yin Ou Zhao - Half the Sky Chinese Curator, artist, graduated from LuXun Academy, lives in Beijing. Her father, a famous Chinese art professor, taught Er Wei Shen

 

Wei Er Shen - President of LuXun Academy of Fine Arts in Shenyang. He invited WCA's Interntional Caucus to create this project LuXun wiki page

 

Sherri Cornett - Half the Sky Director and Chair of WCA's International Caucus, artist living in Montana, accepted this invitation and pulled together an enthusiastic and talented group of women to make this happen. www.sherricornett.com

Alma Ruiz - Half the Sky Juror for Art, Senior Curator, Museum of a Contemporary Art, Los Angeles www.moca.org, Alma's LinkedIn page

 

Terri Weissman, Half the Sky Juror/Editor for Essays, Assistant Professor, Art History: Modern and Contemporary Art and History of Photography, University of Illinois – Urbana-Champaign, Terri's Academic Bio

 

Priscilla Otani - current WCA President, Half the Sky Project Advisor and artist living in San Francisco, www.mrpotani.com

 

Alli Berman - WCA National Board Member,Chair, Half the Sky Publicity and Fundraising, artist living in New York, www.alliberman.com

Sandra Mueller - WCA National Board Member, Half the Sky Juror Search/Events/Catalog, artist and creativity guide living in Malibu www.beartrageous.com

 

Karen Gutfreund - WCA National Exhibitions Chair, Half the Sky Logistics/Administrative, living in California, karengutfreund.com

 

Krista Jiannacopolous - WCA National Board Member, Half the Sky Publicity/Research, artist living in Los Angeles www.krista-art.com

 

Sal Sidner - Half the Sky Fundraising/Publicity, artist living in Florida http://www.artslant.com/global/artists/show/249016-sal-sidner?tab=PROFILE

WHY SHOULD YOU FUND US? WHERE WOULD THE MONEY GO?

In its constitution, UNESCO - United Nations Educational, Scientificand Cultural Organization - states that "art plays an important part in education and that artists, by their works, may influence the conception of the world held by all people, and particularly by youth"... Art also "reflects, preserves and enriches the cultural identity and spiritual heritage of the various societies, constitutes a universal form of expression and communication and, as a common denominator in ethnic, cultural or religious differences, brings home to everyone the sense of belonging to the human community."

  • $36,000 Wow! Yes! Huge bucks!

This would fund our whole project! - Travel costs + room/board for the delegation; tech equipment to support the events that will build transcend language barriers, build relationships, create understanding and community; design and print catalogs for all participants, Chinese dignitaries and generous donors like you, gifts for our Chinese hosts, design and printing of signage, shipping subsidies for artists selected for the exhibition.

  • $24,000 Yes! Still a huge number!

Travel costs for US artists in delegation- We will have 15 working delegates traveling from the US to Shenyang, China and back. Current price estimates for roundtrip flights are $1600 from either the east or west coast. We dream about covering the whole cost of flights for each delegate and your donation can guarantee at least a partial subsidy for each artist.

  • $6000   Our minimum goal for this campaign!

Room & board for full delegation, $100 travel stipends for each delegate, editing/printing/shipping of catalog to participants/donors, tech equipment (hard drives, computer pad, converters, speakers), baggage fees for tech equipment/catalogs/gifts, art materials for events, gifts for our hosts, printing of signage/posters/postcards 

  • $1,600

Roundtrip flight for one delegate to Shenyang, China

  • $1,500

$100 travel stipends for 15 delegates

  •  $1,000

Design, translation, printing and shipping the full-color, bi-lingual catalog for the exhibition part of this exchange. The catalog will include images of all art included in the exhibiiton, short bios and contact information about each artist, essays about contemporary art practices by women by selected art historians and authors. We will be setting this up on lulu.com for print-on-demand, but we wish to give one free printed catalog to each artists and essayist in the catalog, to each of our Chinese hosts and to those donors who give $250 or more.

  • $1000

External hard drives for new media works to be presented in the exhibition, speakers, electrical converters, power strips, computer tablet for sending “real time” posts and videos and for connecting to artists back in the US

  •  $400

Extra baggage fees to bring tech equipment, catalogs & gifts with us to Shenyang

  •  $200

Design and printing of gifts for the Chinese artists and our hosts at LuXun Academy of Fine Arts - we are thinking certificates and caps. Gift-giving is an important component of the Chinese culture - especially as a way of saying thank you.

  •  $200

Art materials for collaborative projects & events between our delegation and the Chinese artists

  •  $100

One external hard drive that will hold new media works (remember this term described above under What Types of Art Will Be Exhibited?)

  •  $100

Room and board at LuXun Academy for one delegate during the duration of the exchange

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP AND PARTICIPATE

Spread the word!

Share with your contacts.

Join WCA. WCA Membership Application

Submit to the exhibition. http://wcainternationalcaucus.weebly.com/call-for-art-half-the-sky-intersections-in-social-practice-art.html

Submit an essay. http://wcainternationalcaucus.weebly.com/call-for-essays-half-the-sky-intersections-in-social-practice-art.html

story:
About the Creator

Sarah Strudwick is the creator of this unique project which involves embracing, exploring, owning and healing our inner child. She has worked as a voice dialogue facilitator for a number of years and is the successful publisher of two books on healing from abuse. Since Sarah was a small child, she always wanted to do something different and unique that would inspire others and also help them heal.

Initially inspired by the work of Australian Psychotherapist and author John Nutting and the unique experiences of childhood.  Both John and Sarah's work has appeared internationally.

The cards have been lovingly designed and created by a talented graphic children’s artist called Rajesh Das. Rajesh has worked on a number ofchildren’s books.

Having already successfully published two books on the subject of trauma and abuse and currently working with voice dialogue and inner child healing, the inspiration behind these cards was to create something that everyone can enjoy.

 

 

What is the Inner Child?

Inner child is a concept which is used in many popular psychology models to denote the childlike aspect of a person's psyche. The inner child refers to all of the emotional memory and experiences stored in the brain whether they are good or bad.

Carl Jung referred to a similar concept as the Divine Child whilst some psychotherapists refer to the inner child as the true self.

For those adult children who have suffered from childhood abuse often therapy involves exploring the wounded part of our selves and witnessing the stories of their origins in childhood, and healing them.

 

Why be involved in this project?

This project will appeal to everyone. Whether you are looking for healing, or just want to embrace your inner child,. Whether you just love great artwork or are interested in oracle, meditation or tarot type cards, this is a project for your own inner child.
 
Purchasing these cards is a way of honouring "your inner child" and showing them how much you really care about them.

You will also be contributing to "Save the Children".  If we raise enough money we also plan on sending free card packs to Abuse Centres around the country in order that they can be used in the waiting rooms when people are going to therapy.

We have also included Herb Duncan's glass sculptures as part of the rewards.

Please see the perks on the right to see what else we are offering.  More perks will be added as the project progresses.

 

How can you use these cards?

Even if you had the most glorious childhood, sometimes we still need a small reminder that there is a part of us that never goes away. By exploring our inner child, we can learn to be more intuitive, creative and most of all have more FUN!

There will be 47 cards in all in each deck which come in a lovely presentation box and a set of instructions on how to use them. These cards will no doubt appeal to the inner child in everyone. Including the artwork that has already been commissioned, some of the other titles include: “The dreamer,” “The Musician,” “The Artist,” “The Wounded Child,” “The Ghost train,” “The Roller Coaster” “Memory Lane” and many many more exciting cards to inspire and fire up your childlike imagination.

These are not tarot cards but they can be used as a meditation aid or for guidance to help you re-align yourself to the authentic you. Each card has a unique interpretation on the back of each image

 

How to pledge

You can pledge in any number of ways. Please also bookmark the page so you can see what other perks we add along the way.


All offers, apart from the personal thank you email, INCLUDE standard postage to anywhere in the world (where applicable).


You can find us here on www.love-my-inner-child.com

 

Join Facebook

Follow us on Twitter



What can you do to help us?


If you haven´t got the money at the moment, but still would like to help turn this project into reality, don´t worry – you can still help A LOT by sharing this content.

We hope too that you will feel inspired to share it with your friends, family and colleagues. Remember the more people that see it the better. Feel free to share via email or on Facebook, You tube, twitter, tumblr and any other networking site you can think off. Feel free to blog and share with like minded souls.

We'd really like to say a big thank you for being part of this project whatever amount you are able to pledge.

 

 

Other Useful stuff you might want to know

When do you receive all your Goodies?

Expected delivery of the cards will be in January 2013, because of the amount of work involved in creating them.  If we can get any orders out by Xmas we will do our best to fulfil them but the artwork is going to take time to finish and be printed. Because we have chosen flexible funding the first part of the money will go to getting the artwork complete and then printed afterwards.

 

How we are using your Money?

The cost to print small runs is significantly higher than it is to print cards in the thousands.  These cards also come in a lovely box rather than a tuck box.  The cards measure 3 1/4 x 4 3/4 inches and each card has a unique meaning on the back which increases printing costs as each card is different unlike a standard, tarot deck.

We need $4000 for the artwork and $4000 for printing.  The additional money is going to be used for postage and processing fees.  Even if we do not reach our goal, each contribution will go to getting the artwork done. We promise will send you a lovely gift of equal value whatever pledge you make.

Sarah and Rajesh will be working on this project full time once the funding is successful. 

 
In addition to funding the cards 10 per of all the cards we end up producing will go to Save the Children Charity

 

What if we go over funding?

If we receive more than we ask for ALL the monies will be reinvested back into the project to enhance it.

If the project goes significantly over the funding, there will also be an Iphone app designed and possibly a Facebook App. We might even add some more cards to the 47 that are already planned. The Inner child website will also be updated to include a free integrated card reading programme where you select a card and the meaning appears just like the Android application.  If we reach funding before the allocated date will we include all the other goodies in our original project and the Sedona Trip.

 

Once again THANK YOU
for taking the time to pledge your support!



         

 

If you have any questions feel free to email Sarah

About the Creator
Sarah Strudwick is the creator of this unique project which involves embracing, exploring, owning and healing our inner child. She has worked as a voice dialogue facilitator for a number of years and is the successful publisher of two books on healing from abuse. Since Sarah was a small child, she always wanted to do something different and unique that would inspire others and also help them heal.
Initially inspired by the work of Australian Psychotherapist and author John Nutting and the unique experiences of childhood.  Both John and Sarah's work has appeared internationally.
The cards have been lovingly designed and created by a talented graphic children’s artist called Rajesh Das. Rajesh has worked on a number ofchildren’s books.

story:
IT'S OUR MOST EXCITING SEASON YET! Hard to believe we're launching our 9th season. Incredible. It's been an amazing year: we dedicated ourselves to building infrastructure: hiring 2 staff members, increasing our annual budget by $20,000 and paying more of our artists. And the impact has been HUGE! Not only is the organization running a lot more smoothly but our events are more powerful and more packed than ever. (Funny how that works...)

This coming season, we've got even more fantastic stuff coming up: we're going to begin making podcasts of our live events so that folks all over the world can get in on the fun. (Right?) We're holding our first evening service for the winter solstice in NYC. And, fingers crossed, we'll be having our first gathering of The Secret City Brooklyn! On top of all that, we'll be presenting more performance, visual art, food, live music, games, community interaction, storytelling and all of the other juicy stuff that folks have come to expect from our events.

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO? This campaign accounts for $20% of our annual budget. But how does that break down, exactly? We'll tell you.
  • $25 -- pays for gas and partial tolls for Chris and Bobby to drive into NY city for each monthly service--one way!
  • $50 --covers childcare for one service.
  • $100 -- pays for a stage manager for one service.
  • $150 -- pays for two featured performers or one session of rehearsal space.
  • $200 -- covers the costs of one coffee hour.
  • $500 -- covers our rent for one service at Dixon Place or at the Byrdcliffe Theater in Woodstock.
  • $1000 -- covers musicians and artists for one month. Or, pays for airfare and rental cal for Chris and Bobby to get to LA.
  • $2500 -- covers half the cost of one service.

THE IMPACT. The Secret City continues to grow in the most amazing ways. Thousands of people have taken part in our events in NYC, LA and Woodstock. We've done so much with the participation of our amazing donors and friends. With your continued support, we'll continue to present the most exciting mix of artists and performers and to make the events that only The Secret City can make, providing community interaction, artistic engagement and our own special brand of spiritual haven to artists and art lovers.

WHAT ARE THE RISKS TO THIS CAMPAIGN SUCCEEDING? You may be thinking, "Hey, The Secret City is  a non-profit corporation now with a growing annual budget, why do they still need me?" The truth is, yes, we've been growing steadily since we started, but we still depend on this annual crowd-fund. Our organization was born at the dawn of social media and the foundation of our donor base comes via crowdfunding. So, please know how crucial it is for us to make this goal.

THE BIG FINISH! Ok, all you art lovers, you know how this part goes: please give as generously as you can and then share this campaign with your friends, family, co-workers and community at large. And, you can share our fantastic pitch video anywhere you like--cuz it's funny and short and cute.

THANKS! We're gonna go BIG this season and we're are so excited to have you continue the amazing, joyful, colorful ride with us. THANK YOU for being such a vital part of our program, our growth, our exciting new season: thank you for being OUR COMMUNITY.

With love.

Chris Wells
Founding Artistic Director
